2:55.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Botanical
runners.comment: Showed very useful form over 1m2f last term; interesting returned to this trip
runners.spotlight: Showed very useful form over 1m2f in notable handicaps at York (won/second) and Listed event at Goodwood (went very close) last term; interesting returned to this trip with 1m reappearance under his belt.

quotes.race: Knights Solicitors Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical was in super nick today. The worry was the drying ground as he was so dominant on quite soft ground at Hamilton, but he showed he copes with it. He was pretty dominant there and while he'll get a bit of a clobbering for that, he's a smart horse - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Hamilton Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Botanical won it really well and he should be a nice horse next year. The handicapper will have his say and will know whether it's a strong race but hopefully he's not too hard on us. He seems like a Class 2 horse and we'll see if he can climb the ladder a bit next year. I think ground is quite important to him, he was beaten on a sounder surface at Ascot the time before. I'm not sure if we'd run again this season - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He would have liked the ground much slower at Doncaster but I think he ran well back at a mile. We'll be careful where we go with him but he could be flying the flag in plenty of stakes races and we could get the passport out for some slower ground in France or further afield. He might run in the Earl of Sefton in a few weeks if the rain comes. 07-04-25

runners.name: Checkandchallenge
runners.comment: Interesting returned to AW, being 2-2 in this sphere (including Listed win)
runners.spotlight: Ties in with Botanical on reappearance form; has scored only once in last 18 turf runs but looks interesting belatedly returned to AW, being 2-2 in this sphere (first two career starts, including Listed win).

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud James Seymour Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Checkandchallenge has run in some hot races this year and I don't think he has actually run a bad race in any of them. Dropping back into a Listed race today it was just nice to get his head back in front. I know the distance between them was a long way at Ascot the other day, but he was fourth in a Group One and he picked up a good bit of prize money and he had some nice horses behind him. I think a mile and a quarter is right for him. We went back for the stiff mile at Ascot as we felt on that track it was going to suit him and he got his just rewards. He can cope with those extremes out there today where a lot of other horses can't. He is in the Hong Kong Mile, but I think he deserves a nice break. There will be plenty of options for him next year. Horses like him can turn up in those Group One races that cut up a bit and pick up a bit of money. We might also look at those Group Three and Group Two races in France again next year - William Knight, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Burradon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely delighted and excited with the manner in which Checkandchallenge has done it in what looked a competitive field. He had to go and win today to warrant a run in the Guineas and that's still on the agenda. It looked like there was a bit left there, which there needs to be to be competitive in the Guineas. There's improvement still to come from him, it wasn't all about today. The big challenge is he's got to convert his all-weather form across to turf, but there's no reason why he can't. He did a nice bit of work on the grass gallops last week which pleased us and made us feel he was definitely above average - William Knight, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who won his first two races and earned a place in the 2,000 Guineas. His second start when bolting up in Listed company at Newcastle had plenty of people talking about him and I must be honest I thought he'd win but not in the manner he did. We decided he had to take his place in the 2,000 Guineas but he never got a chance to show his true colours. He got wiped out at the start, which caused him to lose his action, and from there on things never went right. Unfortunately he came back sore, having knocked a joint. It has been hard work getting him back but he's there now and ready to go again. I looked at Royal Ascot but he had a slightly dirty scope before and you must be 100 per cent for that meeting. He heads to Newmarket for the July meeting, where we'll aim for the Listed Sir Henry Cecil Stakes over a mile and then we'll look to the Thoroughbred Stakes at Glorious Goodwood. He'll run at Newmarket as long as they get nice ground and hopefully we can get him back to where he was before the Guineas. He'll have to carry a penalty there for his Listed win but it's a lesser race and hopefully it'll help him get his confidence back. We're all very excited about getting him out again. Further down the line we could look to step him up to 1m2f. 30-06-22

runners.name: Crown Board
runners.comment: Very lightly raced; may improve back on AW, being 1-1 in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo; finished behind Checkandchallenge in last appearance but he's another runner who may improve back on AW, being 1-1 in this sphere (comfortable debut win); wears first-time hood.

runners.name: Exoplanet
runners.comment: Absent since running well at Royal Ascot in 2023; new yard; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Absent since running very well in 1m2f Group 3 at Royal Ascot in 2023 (final start for Roger Varian); gelded later that year and sold for 18,000gns last October; betting may prove instructive.

quotes.race: Racing TV EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Exoplanet is lovely. The plan was always to come here and get him started. He's a nice horse that has looked the part at home, especially in the past couple of weeks when the recent rain helped us get him onto the grass. He's strengthened into his frame over the last two or three weeks and I thought David gave him a lovely ride. He moved through the race nicely and finished well under pressure. He could be put away now, but we will see - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky last season in the London Gold Cup, where he was drawn widest of all, and the Hampton Court, when he got knocked sideways in the straight. He's back cantering after an injury and unlikely to be ready to run before July, but we've had him gelded and he's definitely a nice horse if we can get him right. 25-04-24

runners.name: Lions Pride
runners.comment: Finished third in this race last year; overall form figures at Kempton read 1132
runners.spotlight: Beat all bar subsequent Group 1 winner Kalpana when last seen, taking his Kempton form figures to 1132; gelded since; Listed scorer in 2023 and finished third in this contest 12 months ago; solid chance.

quotes.race: Racing TV Floodlit Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't go overly quick, but I was happy with the way Lion's Pride jumped up two gears really quickly at the bottom of the straight. He won the race there and was still strong at the line. We've always thought a lot of him and he's had excuses for when he's been beaten. He had good horses like Middle Earth behind him when he won here before, so he's a nice horse - Rab Havlin, jockey.

runners.name: Military Order
runners.comment: Record of 121 on AW includes a success in last year's Winter Derby; major player
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 121 on AW, the wins in the 2023 Derby Trial at Lingfield (1m4f) and 2024 Winter Derby at Southwell (1m3f); strong contender, assuming he returns from 379-day absence in top form.

quotes.race: BetUK Winter Derby Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Military Order was a bit cute last time, so Charlie [Appleby, trainer] said to run him quiet off the bend and he came back strong. It's a nice prize to win and it's nice that he's stepped up on his form in the trial. He's always been a talented horse and could go back to a mile and a half easily - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Military Order just didn't run his race. I suppose that can happen sometimes. I thought I would follow Frankie through. He was relaxed but all in all it was a bit disappointing. You find when they are not travelling or running a race it is normally a case of them not handling the track - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Military Order had to overcome a race around a track that at this stage of his career, doesn't really play to his strengths. As soon as I was in position he was there for me, he's a very balanced horse. He's come through this test great and did everything right. It's another tick in the box for him - William Buick, rider, speaking on ITV.

quotes.race: Darley Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We could think about the Lingfield Derby Trial for Military Order and I don't think he wants that ground, but he's a nice horse. He's a similar stamp to his brother [Adayar]. He's big horse, so I don't think he'd want rock-hard ground, but it's rare big races are run on it - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Future Stayers Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam-Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Going up from the seven furlongs to the mile was going to put us where we needed to be. Staying is going to be Military Order's forte. For a horse who got into a bit of a race for a moment he soon put it to bed when he hit the rising ground. I think he is still a big baby, he still hasn't got a clue to be honest. He is a typical horse that finds life very easy at home. He goes up and down the hill there and finds it very easy. I feel there is plenty more improvement to come. He has got the same profile as Adayar now as he finished fourth first time then won - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Okeechobee
runners.comment: Progressive record includes a good second in this race last year; top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Good second in this contest last year then went one better in the Gordon Richards Stakes at Sandown (1m2f) later in April, taking overall record to 211121; absent since; top on ratings and progressive to boot.

quotes.race: bet365 Gordon Richards Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We're very happy with that as it was the first time Okeechobee has really had to get his head down and race. He doesn't have many miles on the clock and we could look at supplementing him into the Prix d'Ispahan at Longchamp next month as we think the race will suit him - Barry Mahon, racing manager to Juddmonte.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Okeechobee ran great off a 550-day layoff and it was good to see. We couldn't ask for much more off level weights with the winner. We'll look at something like the Gordon Richards Stakes at Sandown - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Radcliffe & Co Handicap
quotes.quote: Okeechobee would have been the kind of horse who probably would have won the Cambridgeshire - a strongly run nine furlongs. That's out of the window and he only came into training as a three-year-old, while he'd never done a piece of work on the grass until about a month ago. What he did before that was on pure ability. He's going to progress and has a great temperament. We might run him again and I think there are a mile and ten-furlong Listed races coming up. At the same time, he doesn't want bottomless ground. Ryan Moore said after Kempton he was a Group horse - Harry Charlton, trainer.

runners.name: Teumessias Fox
runners.comment: Rosebery win took his Kempton record to 3-4; respected kept to this venue
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in the Rosebery (1m3f handicap) on seasonal debut, taking Kempton record to 3-4 and AW score to 4-9; faces stiffer task on these terms but warrants some respect kept to this course.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Rosebery Handicap (London Middle Distance Qual') (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: The pace was on early and I was happy to bide my time. Teumessias Fox is a quality horse when things click for him. We don't always know when he's going to perform, but it's great he can compete in these big pots for King Power. He's a fun dude. He loves it round here but he can also perform on turf - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap
quotes.quote: Teumessias Fox lost his way a little last year. He was gelded before his break and we found that he wants his races spaced out. Hopefully he can keep on progressing and hopefully he doesn't go up too much so he can get into one of the Ascot handicaps. I'd have thought it would be a mile and a half but we'll probably put him in the Copper Horse as well - Andrew Balding, trainer.

4:05.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap

runners.name: Ahlain
runners.comment: Low-mileage filly whose AW record reads 11432; she's 2-2 over C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage filly who ran well at Lingfield (7f) when last seen in August, taking AW form figures to 11432; she's 2-2 over C&D and commands respect with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Nibras Angel
runners.comment: 0-12 since winning first two starts; enough to prove on AW/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Raced only on turf when trained by Ismail Mohammed and is 0-12 since winning on first two starts; enough to prove on debut for new yard; still with same owner.

quotes.race: Robert (Bob) Vickery Memorial Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We worked Nibras Angel before the race and we really think she's a quality filly. We work her with most of our horses and she runs away from everybody. I was worried two or three days ago because a horse kicked her in the bit on Warren Hill, she made lots of noise, but she was fine. We have to see how she'll come out of the race, I don't know if we'll go directly to the Sun Chariot or find a Group 3 or a Listed race for her. She didn't run as a two-year-old and when we work her she's still babyish and green - Ismail Mohammed, trainer.

runners.name: Tiger Crusade
runners.comment: Form dipped sharply last month, suggesting he's gone off the boil
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW scorer, most recently in January; went close over C&D in February but form dipped sharply (in two runs) last month, suggesting he's gone off the boil.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Tiger Crusade has a lower mark on turf as he has not won for a long time but he stays seven furlongs and on that slightly tacky ground he was always going to finish off six furlongs well. He has been running on quicker ground on the turf, but I think he likes to get his toe in a little bit. That trip today on that ground was perfect for him - Bryan Payne, part owner.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and has come down the weights. I think he's ready to win as he's in that sort of area. He's another No Nay Never who enjoys the synthetics, but he's very capable on turf. He could finish only a never-dangerous sixth at Goodwood on Tuesday following a slow start. 04-09-24

runners.name: Metaverse
runners.comment: Possibilities off a workable mark with Doncaster reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: Recorded his novice win over C&D and gained sole handicap success off this mark at Newmarket later in 2024; possibilities with Doncaster reappearance under his belt.

stable_tour.quote: He was a late maturing horse but managed to win a maiden this winter. We tried to teach him by dropping him to 6f, but he's now on a break and could be back in May. He could be an improving horse and he's still unexposed. 11-04-24

runners.name: Dancing Magic
runners.comment: Still a maiden but is well handicapped on best turf form
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with second-place finishes in Chelmsford maidens switched to AW; now 0-17 but this reduced mark makes him look well treated on best turf form.

stable_tour.quote: He was free in the Dante and didn't switch off. That was his worst race, but he was only beaten a length and three-quarters by The Foxes in the Craven. We've put a hood on him to try to get him to settle and the Hampton Court is the plan. His form behind Auguste Rodin from last year looks okay now and that horse has shown one bad race doesn't make a bad horse. 13-06-23

runners.name: Dapper Valley

prev_owners.owner: Thurloe Royal Marsden Cancer Charity II

runners.comment: Folded tamely on reappearance; AW is an unknown
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Nibras Angel, having raced only on turf; something to prove in this scenario and reappearance effort (folded tamely, well held) adds uncertainty.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Golf World Cup EBF Maiden Stakes (Newcomers' Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was worried about running Dapper Valley on the ground, but he's always shown up a good bit at home and I loved the way he travelled. He took it in his stride and could be a very good two-year-old. I imagine we'll look at something else - possibly a race back here at the Lockinge meeting - before he is hopefully a Royal Ascot horse -  Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Follow Your Heart
runners.comment: Record of 9-39 on AW features four C&D wins, the most recent in February
runners.spotlight: Record of 9-39 on AW features four C&D wins, the most recent in February; successful at Wolverhampton last time; back up the weights but has solid claims.

runners.name: Supreme King
runners.comment: In career-best form (over 6f) the last twice; 0-15 at 7f and beyond
runners.spotlight: In career-best form (over 6f) the last twice, winning at Kempton then second at Wolverhampton; however, he's not the percentage call, being 0-15 at 7f and beyond.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell
runners.comment: Progressive this year (maiden previously), producing form figures of 131121
runners.spotlight: Progressive over 7f-8.5f this year (maiden previously), producing form figures of 131121; won at Chelmsford last time; upped further in grade but is hard to dismiss.

runners.name: Invincible Aura
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 2 & Partner

prev_owners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 2 & Les Boyer

runners.comment: Weighted to the hilt but is consistent and again has frame possibilities
runners.spotlight: Remains weighted to the hilt off career-high mark but has consistent AW form and again holds frame possibilities; record this year is 13433; he is 1-1 at Kempton.

runners.name: North View

prev_owners.owner: Dr John Wilson And William Prosser

runners.comment: Looks interesting with blinkers refitted on second run for new stable
runners.spotlight: Blinkered when performing well at Newbury (won) and Kempton (second) in final two starts for previous yard; interesting with the blinds refitted on second run for new stable.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was such a good race at Ascot. Obviously the winner won the Acomb, and Ralph Beckett likes his horse a lot too. I ran North View over too far at Newmarket, that was my fault, so it was nice to see him win today. I wouldn't be opposed to dropping him back to five furlongs either because he has so much speed. He's the sort of horse we will go slowly with and see what the handicapper does with him before making any fancy entries but I promise you he's better than that - Peter Chapple-Hyam, trainer.

3:30.race_name: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Fillies' Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Mercury Day
runners.comment: Stiff task in C&D Listed event on reappearance and this is much more realistic
runners.spotlight: Kicked off her 2024 campaign with two wins (maiden/handicap) on turf; no further progress since but faced a stiff task in C&D Listed event on reappearance and this is much more realistic.

quotes.race: Durcan Bloodstock Pat Smullen Memorial Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were gutted Mercury Day was balloted out of the Sandringham Handicap at Royal Ascot as we've always liked her and she's from a good Juddmonte family. She's in a mile and a quarter handicap at the July Festival but Jim said to stick at a mile for now - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Sky Safari
runners.comment: Record of 2-3 in her first season last year; the type to improve further this term
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 (over 7f) in her first season last year, winning at Wolverhampton (AW debut) the final time; gives the impression this new trip will suit; looks the type to improve further this term; respected.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sky Safari has had a couple of niggles but she's always looked a nice filly. She's shown ability at home, she's a big girl but she's also got an engine as well. She showed a really good attitude inside the last furlong - James Fanshawe, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Atlantis Blue
runners.comment: Has shown best form, including two wins (maiden/handicap; both 1m) last July, on turf
runners.spotlight: Placed a few times on AW but has shown best form, including two wins (maiden/handicap; both 1m) on turf, last July; lacks recent match practice and record suggests she's likely set for a supporting role.

quotes.race: Download The Fitzdares App Now Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Atlantis Blue used to be quite headstrong but I managed to drop her in and she's learning her trade. She's well handicapped and seems to be going forward - Jim Crowley, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: More Than A Feelin
runners.comment: Three-time AW winner; form dipped last time but mostly consistent otherwise
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on AW; successful three times, including over C&D, in 2024; form dipped last time but generally consistent otherwise and may rebound, provided she takes to added cheekpieces.

runners.name: Top Of The Class
runners.comment: Won well over C&D on penultimate start, confirming that Kempton suits her best
runners.spotlight: Latest effort suggests she remains in form; won well over C&D the time before, taking Kempton form figures to 4211621 and confirming this track suits her best (0-12 elsewhere); strong claims back here.

runners.name: Dramatic Effect
runners.comment: Turf success last June; lacked consistency afterwards in 2024; not solid
runners.spotlight: Opened her account in 1m novice event on turf last June; lacked consistency afterwards in 2024, latterly on AW; capable of being involved off current mark but isn't a solid option.

runners.name: Twirler
runners.comment: Two unconvincing efforts this winter for new stable; best watched
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins for previous yard; unconvincing efforts this winter for new stable, having been friendless in the betting both times; best watched unless the market signals go the other way.

4:40.race_name: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Coup De Force
runners.comment: Suited by the return to AW last autumn, winning three times; now 5-9 in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Suited by the return to AW last autumn, winning three times (including over C&D) and taking overall record in this sphere to 5-9; respected, assuming she returns from layoff in the same form.

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We went pretty hard and the plan was not to go there too soon on Coup De Force. The race worked out perfectly. She travelled exceptionally well and I was confident turning in, she took me into the race nicely, and although she had a little look in front she was always going to get over the line - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Dream Of Mischief
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Cotton / Mrs Suzanne Conway
runners.owner: Mrs F Cotton, Mr & Mrs P Conway
runners.comment: Fairly useful handicapper over 7f/1m; something to prove back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful handicapper over 7f/1m and is only 1lb above last winning mark; however, has something to prove back at 6f for first time since 2yo debut (midfield).

runners.name: Giant
runners.comment: Disappointing dropped to 6f last time but this return to Kempton may prove a plus
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 7f handicapper who has shaped as if 6f is worth exploring; disappointing when dropped to this trip at Wolverhampton last time but gained sole handicap win at Kempton and could well fare better back here; on an attractive mark and worth another chance.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the gelding (operation) has helped and a bit of a break and Giant has come back fresh and well. Everything went to plan and he's done it nicely - Richard Spencer, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Rebel Path
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Two wins at Chelmsford this winter; has remained in form; place possibilities
runners.spotlight: Successful twice at Chelmsford (6f) this winter and has remained in form, creditable third at Wolverhampton most recently; place possibilities off unaltered mark.

runners.name: Dashing Harry
runners.comment: C&D scorer for previous yard; has gained both wins for current stable over 5f
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer for previous yard but has gained both wins for current stable over 5f; unplaced in last five attempts at 6f and doesn't look the percentage call.

runners.name: World Of Darcy
runners.comment: Has an unconvincing record on AW and can be opposed in this grade
runners.spotlight: Completed a Class 6 hat-trick on soft/heavy ground last October; has an unconvincing record on AW and can be opposed in this grade.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Apply Today EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I took a bit of a gamble and ran World Of Darcy at Newmarket over seven furlongs because I felt that now's the time to decide what we're going to do with him. Luke [Morris, jockey] said drop him back to six and get him a bit of confidence because he's obviously had a few hard days at work and we picked this one. There's nothing wrong with him, but he's not very big. There's always going to be a doubt whether this horse trains on, but at the moment he eats well and works well. There's a winter campaign and I think that's what I'm aiming for. We've got a big entry at the weekend, but we'll look at that and decide what the ground does. We'll see how he recovers and then we'll make decisions - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto National Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: World Of Darcy is a good solid horse, he'll be winning plenty of races. He'll probably go for the Windsor Castle - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Northern Commercials - Used Stock For Quick Delivery EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed. World Of Darcy travelled really sweetly and I could have done with a lead for longer. Karl said whatever he did today that he would improve a lot for it - Sam James, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Elite Status, who's a very good horse, in the National Stakes and will definitely go for the Windsor Castle, barring accidents. He's tough and solid and the stiff five furlongs will play to his strengths. He'll go there with a chance. 14-06-23

runners.name: Hierarchy
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: Only 1-18 on AW but recent form is consistent and includes four second-place finishes
runners.spotlight: Only 1-18 on AW and gained the win in 2021 but finished first past the post in January (disqualified; rider weighed in light); consistent subsequent form includes four second-place finishes; solid contender.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice last year over 6f and finished second, beaten only a head, in the Group 2 Mill Reef Stakes. He started the year promisingly enough when second to Go Bears Go at Ascot but found life tough at Group 1 level in the Commonwealth Cup, where the ground was far too quick for him. We'll drop him back to handicap company next time and he may go to Newmarket this week. 06-07-22

runners.name: Cypriot Diaspora
runners.comment: Fighting chance off current mark provided she transfers turf form back to AW
runners.spotlight: Three-time turf winner, most recently off 1lb higher last June; ended her 2024 campaign with a pair of second-place finishes; fighting chance provided she's as effective back on AW (third attempt).

stable_tour.quote: She's tough little filly who won last time out at Goodwood, her second win of the season. She's a 6f filly and possibly a 7f one. She has no real ground preferences- she's a good regular runner and is still improving. She goes to Carlisle on Thursday for her next run. 11-07-24

6:20.race_name: Virgin Bet Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Cinnodin
runners.comment: Two wins and a second from three runs over C&D; this mark is within range for in-form yard
runners.spotlight: Wildly inconsistent but made it two wins and a second from three starts over C&D when going in off 3lb lower a fortnight ago; this mark is within range for a yard going great guns if he's in the same mood.

quotes.race: Athlone Handicap
quotes.quote: Cinnodin didn't do much wrong at Wetherby, he was just a bit unfortunate in the circumstances. We thought this race might cut up and we had it as a plan a month ago. I don't normally like going a mile and three quarters with a three-year-old this early on but he would get two miles tomorrow as he is an out-and-out stayer - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably his own worst enemy. He keeps running so well and it's hard to find a four-year-old 0-80 2m race, but he'll go and win once he gets one of them with a bit of pace. 18-09-24

runners.name: Grey Fox
runners.comment: Spent most of career racing at around 1m; won well on comeback over 2m here last month
runners.spotlight: Has spent most of his career racing at around 1m but looked an unlucky loser on his first crack at this trip over C&D last autumn and duly won well on his comeback here last month; no surprise to see him defy a 4lb rise.

runners.name: Tradesman
runners.comment: Capable off this mark but a lot will hinge on his mood and how he handles the stalls
runners.spotlight: Has often blown the start and he refused to jump away at all without the usual blinkers (back on here) last month; is capable off this mark but a lot will hinge on his mood and how he handles the stalls.

runners.name: Moel Arthur
runners.comment: Has run well over C&D before but others have more pressing claims back from a short break
runners.spotlight: Wins have come off slightly lower marks round Lingfield in the winter and he doesn't arrive in much form; has run well over C&D before but others have more pressing claims back from a short break.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (GBBPLUS Race)
quotes.quote: The two-mile trip was the question mark, so the way the race panned out suited Moel Arthur. I don't think I've ever been as slow around here - Callum Shepherd, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Orchestra
runners.breeder: S C Ecurie Ades-Hazan & Pvp Racing
runners.comment: Not allowed his own way over C&D last time; one to consider for a yard among the winners
runners.spotlight: Not allowed his own way over C&D last time, back from wind surgery, and that effort was likely similar to his previous near-miss here; is one to consider for a yard among the winners with its jumpers of late.

runners.name: Believitanducan

prev_owners.owner: Christopher Murray And Miss J R Macey

runners.comment: Won a couple of juvenile hurdles; relatively unexposed on the Flat; goes on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Has won a couple of juvenile hurdles for this yard, either side of being out of his depth at Cheltenham, and remains relatively unexposed on the Flat; goes on the shortlist.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was pretty good performance from the second-last. It's a good start. As soon as Believeitanducan jumped the first I thought he'd be all right and it's good to have a winner for the Owners Group again - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: 138th Year Of The Watt Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Believitanducan deserved that. He's been bumping into one and he loved the two miles, cut in the ground and 8st 2lb. He was really tough, he's so genuine - Jessica Macey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought privately as a dual-purpose horse by Anthony Bromley for the Owners Group, having won his last start on the Flat for Jessica Macey. He got a trip and he handled soft ground and I'd like to think he'll be one for juvenile hurdles later in the season. I've been very pleased with his schooling. 07-11-24

runners.name: Legacy Power
runners.comment: Market spoke his way on comeback and that has to go down as disappointing; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Maybe needed his first run in the best part of a year behind Grey Fox over C&D last month, but the market spoke firmly his way there and that has to go down as disappointing; it leaves him with something to prove.

runners.name: Alex The Great
runners.comment: Done well since wind surgery and back to form last time; this company is a bit stronger
runners.spotlight: Can miss the break and/or pull hard but he's done well since having wind surgery and came back to form last time; this company is a bit stronger off a career-high mark though.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: You never want to be giving too much ground away [at the start] but even so, Alex The Great is a horse who wants to be coming off a pace. We're still learning about him but he's put that [below-par] Newcastle run behind him - Tony Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: French Martini
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Oliver Piraud Et Al
runners.comment: 11-1 for the the voided Lingfield 0-60 handicap on her return 24 days ago; market useful
runners.spotlight: Revelation on her final start at Bath last autumn (2m1f, soft; first run since wind surgery) when winning easily off 3lb lower; was sent off 11-1 for the voided Lingfield 0-60 handicap on her intended return 24 days ago; market useful.

runners.name: Blenheim Lad
runners.comment: Not achieved much in three runs on Polytrack; needs career-best back from five months off
runners.spotlight: Won two 0-55 handicaps round Southwell last autumn before a poor one off revised mark latterly; hasn't achieved much in three previous runs on Polytrack and will need a career-best effort back from five months off.

runners.name: Anzac Day
runners.comment: Leading contender on his Newmarket win; gelded since and back from 18-month absence
runners.spotlight: Absent since recording a useful RPR with emphatic success over 1m2f at Newmarket 18 months ago (second start); gelded during his time off; leading contender provided he returns in the same form.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Anzac Day had run an encouraging first race at Goodwood and Andrew Balding said he had moved forward from that. He was out on the wing and had no cover so did well in the circumstances - James Doyle, rider.

runners.name: Senor Cortez
runners.comment: Flat debutant who has modest claims on his bumper form
runners.spotlight: Flat debutant who holds modest claims on his bumper form.

runners.name: Celtic Queen
runners.comment: Bumper form suggests she's likely to come up short on Flat debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of her four bumper runs but hasn't shown enough to think she'll figure highly in this field on Flat debut.

runners.name: Ammes
runners.comment: Brother to a five-time AW scorer; duly showed ability with 2l fourth at Chelmsford
runners.spotlight: Brother to a five-time AW scorer; duly showed ability with his 2l fourth at Chelmsford (1m2f) in sole 2yo start; open to improvement this year.

runners.name: Criminal
runners.comment: 95,000gns yearling; siblings include a Listed winner; check the betting
runners.spotlight: 95,000gns yearling; by Sea The Moon and sibling to three winners, notably Aleas (1m-1m3f including AW/Listed; 110); dam 1m 2yo Group 3 scorer (104) from smart family; check the betting.

runners.name: Ernst Blofeld
runners.comment: Frankel colt who made a promising debut (clear third) here two weeks ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt who made a promising debut (clear third of 14) in 1m maiden here two weeks ago, while shaping as if he'll be suited by this longer distance; respected with progress on the cards.

runners.name: Modern Style
runners.comment: 900,000gns yearling; by Frankel and sibling to five winners; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 900,000gns yearling; by Frankel and sibling to five winners, notably Alkandora (French 10.5f Listed; RPR 107); useful dam is out of 1m4f Group 2 scorer; powerful yard; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Padua
runners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster
runners.comment: May yet confirm the promise of his Lingfield effort (went close)
runners.spotlight: Slowly away in both 2yo runs (1m, AW) and doubly hindered his chance by pulling hard here latest; however, went close at Lingfield and may yet confirm that promise; dam's side gives optimism for 1m2f.

runners.name: Spanish Train
runners.comment: 170,000euros yearling; siblings include a Group 1 winner; market instructive
runners.spotlight: 170,000euros yearling; Lope De Vega half-brother to three winners, notably Ancient Wisdom (7f-1m5f including 2yo Group 1; RPR 114); dam 12.5f Group 3 scorer; wears tongue-tie on debut; market helpful.

runners.name: Sword Of Wessex
runners.comment: Form of Sandown effort has substance; major player if taking well to cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Hung under pressure at Sandown (1m) when last seen but stuck on well towards the finish and the form received a big boost at Newmarket last week; major player provided he takes well to cheekpieces.

runners.name: Too Darn Seanie
runners.comment: Likely to be more interesting in handicaps shortly
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced gelding who needs improvement on bare figures and is likely to be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.name: Warrior King
runners.owner: O T I Racing, Paul Inglett & Partner
runners.comment: 65,000euros foal; by Saxon Warrior; major stable; heed the market signals
runners.spotlight: 65,000euros foal; Saxon Warrior half-brother to two winners, notably Wohileh (1m4f AW; RPR 82); dam unraced daughter of 1,000 Guineas winner; major stable; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Holy Smoker
runners.comment: Siblings include a four-time AW scorer; duly showed ability in Wolverhampton race
runners.spotlight: Closely related to a four-time AW scorer; duly showed some ability (fifth over 8.5f) at Wolverhampton in sole 2yo run; open to improvement.

runners.name: Romance In Rome
runners.comment: Ran to a modest RPR here in sole outing for Ollie Sangster
runners.spotlight: Only fifth of six, running to a modest RPR, at Kempton (1m3f) in sole outing for Ollie Sangster; still with same owner; hood applied.

5:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Fives Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Study Up
runners.comment: Carries a big weight but is 1-1 (6f; Salisbury) and looks open to progress
runners.spotlight: 4yo gelding who concedes plenty of weight all round but is one of the main form contenders all the same, having scored at Salisbury (6f) last July in sole start; again wears hood; open to progress.

stable_tour.quote: He's run only once but that was a very pleasing debut at Salisbury last July when he won by a length and three-quarters. He had a hold-up after that but he's training nicely and I'm looking forward to getting him back on the track. 17-04-25

runners.name: Hoodie Hoo
runners.owner: Ged Mason, Sir Alex Ferguson, Jim Mcgoff
runners.comment: Form of reappearance win at Wolverhampton has been boosted; strong contender
runners.spotlight: Made all for clearcut success in Wolverhampton maiden (6f) on reappearance and the runner-up boosted that form by going one better in C&D handicap last week; respected with further improvement likely.

runners.name: Almizan
runners.comment: Poor claims on form
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival over 6f in sole start for Owen Burrows; folded tamely over 1m here since; poor claims on form.

runners.name: Keybaar
runners.comment: 190,000gns yearling; by Earthlight; notable connections; interesting debutant
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns foal, 190,000gns yearling; Earthlight half-brother to four winners, notably Nationwide (5f/6f including AW/Bahrain; RPR 100); dam 6f 2yo/11.6f winner (78); notable connections; interesting debutant.

runners.name: Palmarian
runners.comment: His 7f efforts suggest this drop in trip and first-time hood will suit
runners.spotlight: Gosden colt whose 7f efforts, at Newmarket (faded into fourth) and Doncaster (failed to settle), suggest this combination of a drop in distance and first-time hood will suit; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Reddeef
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Comparatively exposed but produced his peak 2yo effort at Kempton
runners.spotlight: Comparatively exposed, having raced five times, but may prove suited by the return to Kempton having produced his peak 2yo effort (close second) at this venue; gelded over the winter.

runners.name: Sprinter
runners.comment: 75,000gns yearling; by Cotai Glory; one of two newcomers for his connections
runners.spotlight: 75,000gns yearling; Cotai Glory half-brother to three winners, notably Kandoo (5.7f 2yo; RPR 73); dam 1m 2yo winner (71); one of two newcomers for his connections; market instructive.

runners.name: Teardrops
runners.comment: 75,000gns yearling; by Tasleet; stablemate of Sprinter; market instructive
runners.spotlight: 75,000gns yearling; by Tasleet and sibling to five winners, notably  A Momentofmadness (5f/6f including AW; 109); dam 6f 2yo winner (74); stablemate of Sprinter; check the betting.

runners.name: Topwarrior
runners.comment: Showed some promise in the Wolverhampton race won by Hoodie Hoo; may improve
runners.spotlight: Seems held by Hoodie Hoo on Wolverhampton form, having finished just over 6l behind that rival, but showed some promise amid greenness and may improve with the experience under his belt.

runners.name: Lokma
runners.comment: Never landed a blow in 6f maiden at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Only a modest fifth of seven and never landed a blow in 6f maiden at Wolverhampton, having been very easy to back; best watched unless the market signals go the other way.

runners.name: Silver Wraith
runners.breeder: W H & Mrs J I Simpson
runners.comment: Sandown effort can be marked up; may be capable of progress
runners.spotlight: Met traffic issues on her way to close fourth at Sandown (5f) in sole 2yo start and the effort can be marked up; that was an ordinary maiden for the track but she may be capable of progress.

runners.name: Westington House
runners.owner: C Engel, S Nettleton & J Palmer-Brown
runners.comment: Achieved a meagre RPR in 7f contest at Kempton
runners.spotlight: Better than her meagre RPR suggests in 7f contest at Kempton, having had more rivals behind her than in front; however, may be more interesting in handicaps later on.

5:50.race_name: Virgin Bet Fives Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Sheriffs Court
runners.comment: Won a heavy-ground French maiden last autumn before sold for 60,000gns; market useful
runners.spotlight: Won a heavy-ground maiden over 6.5f for Andre Fabre last September prior to being sold for 60,000gns; it's still early in the year for his new yard but they've been among the winners and the market will likely tell a tale from a wide stall.

runners.name: Chilly Breeze
runners.comment: On the go early last spring; Oisin Murphy is a positive booking back from a year off
runners.spotlight: On the go early last spring, finishing last of four on debut before beating a couple of useful rivals at a big price on soft ground at Nottingham next time; Oisin Murphy is a positive booking on return from a year off and it will be interesting to see how he goes in the market.

runners.name: Atmosphere
runners.comment: Gelded Â£40,000 yearling who's the third foal of an unraced mare; market the best guide
runners.spotlight: Gelded Â£40,000 yearling by Advertise who's the third foal of an unraced mare; stable (also saddles Rapper's Delight) doesn't have a great record with 3yos here.

runners.name: Dr Strangelove
runners.comment: Yard just getting going for the season (Billy Loughnane 1-12 for them); market will guide
runners.spotlight: Late-foaled Mohaather half-brother to six winners who was withdrawn from his intended debut last autumn; yard just getting going for the season (Billy Loughnane 1-12 for them) and the market will guide.

runners.name: Fort Augustus
runners.comment: Well drawn on his comeback from six months off, having been gelded; helps set the standard
runners.spotlight: Expensive to follow last backend, twice getting turned over as favourite over C&D latterly; well drawn on his comeback from six months off though, having been gelded, and helps set the standard.

runners.name: Haazeez
runners.comment: Didn't progress last season; has been gelded ahead of this return from seven months off
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress last season, albeit his Ayr and Yarmouth defeats at short prices look better now than at the time; has been gelded ahead of this return from seven months off.

runners.name: Lazzar
runners.comment: Showed enough in two soft-ground runs last autumn to suggest he's worth keeping an eye on
runners.spotlight: Showed enough in two soft-ground runs last September to suggest he's worth keeping an eye on for a yard among the winners, having since been gelded, especially should the market speak his way.

runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.comment: Shaped fairly after a slow start on recent turf debut; needs a better break from stall 11
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling who shaped fairly well after a slow start on recent turf debut, albeit he was some way off the market leaders; entitled to improve but will need a better break from the outside stall.

runners.name: Pantani
runners.comment: 125,000gns yearling; half-brother to four winners; unseated early on debut last summer
runners.spotlight: 125,000gns yearling by Pinatubo who's a half-brother to four winners; was easy to back ahead of his sole start last summer, when swerving right and unseating his rider after a couple of furlongs.

runners.name: Rappers Delight
runners.comment: Siblings Bonny Angel and Another Gift improved plenty with racing; may well follow suit
runners.spotlight: Gelded Â£135,000 yearling by Harry Angel who's a brother to Bonny Angel and Another Gift, both of whom improved plenty with racing; no surprise to see him follow suit.

runners.name: Miss Chester
runners.comment: Trainer not noted for 3yo newcomers and she's likely best watched from a wide stall
runners.spotlight: Half-sister by Ribchester to fair sprinter J R Cavagin; trainer wouldn't be noted for 3yo newcomers and she's likely best watched from a wide stall.

3:34.race_name: Tip Top Clean Convenience Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Saint Segal
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant Et Al
runners.comment: Dominated from the front at Newbury in December and has remained in very good form since
runners.spotlight: Returned to peak form when dominating from the front at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) in December and has been placed on all three starts since; still on a workable mark and can make another bold bid.

quotes.race: BetVictor Home Of The Lucky Dip Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Saint Segal owed us. He's behaving himself better but he's only six and needed to learn how to settle over the two-and-a-half-mile pace. He's switched off and just goes on so that's great - Jane Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's back to 100 per cent after his final-fence fall at Ascot in November, which was such a shame as he was length in front at the time. We wanted to go to the Desert Orchid at Kempton over Christmas but he just wasn't quite ready in time. He's fine now though and the plan is to go for the two-mile handicap chase at Lingfield's Winter Million fixture on January 21. We've given him plenty of time since Ascot and the Lingfield race stands out for him. Soft or heavy ground would definitely be in his favour. 11-01-24

runners.name: Western General
runners.comment: Thriving 7yo who cruised clear for wide-margin win at Hereford last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Thriving 7yo who cruised clear to win by 22l at Hereford (2m, good) last month, his third success this season; 10lb higher in a deeper race, but will be fine over the longer trip and needs to be taken very seriously in current mood.

quotes.race: BetMGM Who Wants A Nine-Darter Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Western General was very good. As soon as I got to the leader he pricked his ears, went on and won very nicely. This race was perfect as he's shown form on heavy ground and two miles is right for him. Hopefully we can find another nice race - Freddie Gingell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's always threatened to be a nice horse and won very well last week. Hopefully, he can progress from that. 07-11-24

He stopped very quickly at Exeter last time, but had a little bleed and is much better than that. He hasn't shown his best form for whatever reason this season, but he's very well handicapped. Once he gets a bit of sun on is back, he should have a strong second half of the campaign. 18-01-24

runners.name: Jetoile
runners.comment: Ran well for a long way when sixth of 30 over the big Aintree fences this month
runners.spotlight: Well below best form this season, but came second off much-reduced mark at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in February and ran well for a long way when sixth of 30 over the big Aintree fences (2m5f, good to soft) this month; enters calculations.

quotes.race: Jewson Fast Set Finish Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This has been the target since the day we turned out Jetoile after winning at Chepstow. All he does is jump and travel. The fences being out has hopefully done us a favour with the handicapper. He has to either go for the Peterborough Chase or the December Gold Cup. I'd say at this moment in time we will probably go for the Peterborough, but we will enjoy today - Ryan Potter, trainer.

runners.name: Light N Strike
runners.comment: Respectable third at Ascot last month; can do better on this left-handed track
runners.spotlight: Suited by the return to good ground when very respectable third of five at Ascot (2m1f, good; jumped left on occasions) three weeks ago; needs to build on that performance but remains on a good mark and ought to be better suited by this left-handed track.

stable_tour.quote: I think Plumpton on Monday was a run too many for him and he'll go on a break, but he'd done well during the summer and it will be nice to get him over a fence again in the spring. 02-11-22

runners.name: Paint The Dream
runners.comment: Very well handicapped on old form but has not shown much for owner-trainer this season
runners.spotlight: Best known for his heroics at Newbury but is also suited by this track; very well handicapped on old form for Fergal O'Brien but, following a long absence, has not shown a great deal for his owner-trainer this season, including when back at Newbury last month; revival needed.

quotes.race: Coral Bet Bundles Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Paint The Dream is a lovely, lovely horse and he seems as good as ever. He ran a cracker at Wetherby last time and I think he's even improved again this season - he's filled out more and was bouncing in the parade ring. He could run at Cheltenham on either New Year's Day or the end of January, but we'll speak to the team. He can go on soft ground as well, not heavy though - Bob Preston, part-owner.

quotes.race: BetVictor Greatwood Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Paint The Dream is a lovely horse and we always thought there was a good day in him. He won well here last season and we could look at Aintree. He wants the ground quicker than this, although he won well. We thought he'd win last time and couldn't work out why he ran a bit flat. We had him checked out and there was nothing, but Connor was positive yesterday and said he'd do the job - David Brace, owner

quotes.race: MansionBet's Bet 10 Get 20 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect Paint The Dream to come here and do that, but I didn't expect him to be 16-1 either. His form in the Dipper last season was rock-solid and he showed us today what he can really do. I think the tactics - letting him bowl along in front on a big galloping track - helped, while he jumping was very good. He hasn't been very good in tight, but we'd done a lot of schooling at home. The handicapper gave him a chance today and he's done the job, but I think he can go on. He's very straightforward and there are more races in him. - Fergal O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Real Stone
runners.comment: Caused 33-1 surprise in February but may need some rain and others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Rewarded very positive ride and caused 33-1 surprise at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February but was not quite in the same form when dropped back to 2m1f at Kelso last month; may need some rain here and others appeal more.

quotes.race: betting.betfair.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The race fell apart pretty dramatically, two of the others didn't run their race at all so you should take the form with a pinch of salt. But given our current form I'll take any win. There's nothing wrong, the horses just aren't absolutely ripping. We've probably got a few good days in Real Stone as he didn't do a lot of racing as a youngster. But under pressure he does go pretty violently left so that rules out Ascot and Kempton - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Real Stone has been coming back from injury and has taken a while to get going. He wasn't a bad horse in his younger days, but it's taken him a while to get going again. Hopefully he can build on that - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Real Stone is a massive, unfurnished horse who we see as a chaser down the line. He has ability and the ingredients are all there, but we didn't expect him to do that first time up - Harry Skelton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won a nice race at Haydock last season but injured himself when falling on his last start. We'll aim to start him back at Haydock on November 23, because the track really suits him. Soft ground is what he wants and when he gets the conditions he needs he'll be productive. I'd like to think he could win a race or two this term. 12-11-24

runners.name: Bourbali
runners.owner: W Pope, E Legg, M Green & T Swaffield
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last time but has generally remained in good form since October win
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing at Kempton last month but has generally remained in good form since winning off 1lb lower there (2m2f, good) in October; considered each-way.

quotes.race: "Book Christmas Festival Hospitality Now" Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There might just be improvement to come from Bourbali over a fence. He's obviously very good around here - Joe Tizzard, trainer speaking to RTV.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Kempton last time and loves it around there, so we'll go back there on November 25 for a 0-135 over two miles four furlongs. He's not the biggest but he's got a great attitude and is a super jumper. 07-11-24

His saddle slipped at Exeter in November. I'm not sure that was trainer fault, but he went and won next time at Kempton so I was forgiven! We then stepped him up in grade for the Wayward Lad and he got into a fight with a superior horse up front, which probably cost him as they went like the clappers. That's how he is and the handicapper has got hold of him, but he's a genuine little horse who runs his race every time. I'll have to pick and choose my way with him, but wouldn't be afraid of running in the better races because there's good prize-money in some of them without winning. He ran a solid race at Wincanton last week and is too consistent for his own good. 18-01-24

runners.name: Beau Balko
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last time but this largely consistent 7yo is on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 7yo who was runner-up three consecutive times after his Wincanton win (2m4f, good) in November; slightly below form when dropped back to 2m at Newbury last month but this move back up in trip will suit and his current mark is workable.

quotes.race: BetMGM Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a brilliant ride. Beau Balko just needed the run at Kempton and he's improved like a lot of ours have and they'll only get fitter as the season goes along. Last season we couldn't drop him in as he was always too keen but we could over two and a half [miles] there - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Audley Chaucer Solicitors Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beau Balko is a lovely horse who is improving all the time. I might try to run in him a novice handicap hurdle back here on the last day of the season - we won the race with Knappers Hill last year. I think that would be a good move and he'd go on any ground - Paul Nicholls.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent fun horse who went chasing last season, saving his best effort for his final start at Ayr, where he was galloping all over the opposition when making a complete hash of the second-last. Luckily, the handicapper left him on the same mark, so he should win more races over fences. He was a few pounds below his best on his return at Kempton last month, when he jumped a bit novicey, and is sure to come on for the run. 04-11-24

runners.name: Sageburg County
runners.comment: Upped in grade after last month's Uttoxeter second but is very well suited by this C&D
runners.spotlight: Rebounded from poor performance and went down fighting when second at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) last month; up in grade and 2lb higher but ran very well over C&D on both previous visits to Chepstow, more notably when winning by 3l on good ground a year ago.

stable_tour.quote: He's really ground dependent. I ran him the other day at Warwick and they probably went a real good gallop on soft ground, but he just wasn't himself. He's going to go to Stratford on Monday and we'll step him up a little bit in trip. He needed that race last time because he hadn't run for more than two months. 05-03-25

2:59.race_name: Tip Top Riders Restroom Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Rouge Vif
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie D & A Montbroussous
runners.comment: Very disappointing in recent years but makes stable debut from very tempting mark
runners.spotlight: Smart 2m chaser in his prime; generally very disappointing in recent years and absent since pulled up for Richard Bandey last May, but makes debut for latest new stable on a very tempting mark; worth a second look.

quotes.race: Bentley Flying Spur Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You see Rouge Vif at his best on better ground. He's got that good-ground action and is so slick to jump out of it. Daryl was saying there was so much pace on beforehand, but they couldn't go his gallop and he was in his comfort zone out there - it was lovely. I'd hoped he'd improved for the summer as he felt more powerful and he's strengthened up a lot and to do that in a handicap off 156 has slightly surprised me. Daryl says he'll stay two and a half, but he's quick and has a high-cruising speed. He looks like a proper two-miler  - Harry Whittington, trainer.

quotes.race: Agetur UK Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Rouge Vif is a proper horse and I love him to bits. He's a great character and would run through a brick wall for you. I was really confident coming into this as the form of his Kempton run is so solid. He's an excellent jumper - such a natural - and he's so quick. The better the ground, the better he is and he was very good today. I always feel he gets a little underestimated and he's a massive price for the Arkle. We've always felt he's an Arkle horse and he's tough as nails. Andrew and Kate (Brooks) put so much into the game and deserve all the success they are having - Harry Whittington, trainer.

quotes.race: G C Rickards Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Rouge Vif has a hell of a lot of ability and is above average. My assistant has done a great job with him at home as he's quite quirky. Hopefully, he'll go on to bigger and better things - Harry Whittington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We're still learning about him. He's quite keen at home and just getting his act together now. He'll have an away day somewhere and then go to Cheltenham for the Shloer Chase on Sunday. After a few runs, I could see him being awesome for the Celebration Chase in the spring but he's got to get into our system and it doesn't happen overnight. 08-11-21

runners.name: Alto Alto
runners.comment: Back in good form since fitted with a visor for last two runs
runners.spotlight: Responded well to first-time visor when making all at Plumpton (2m1f, soft) in February and ran well until stamina ebbed away at Fontwell (2m3f, soft) last month; drops back in trip today and will be fine on the faster ground; contender if the new headgear continues to keep him focused.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Master Trainer Chris Gordon Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Alto Alto was a different horse to the last time I rode him. I couldn't keep him on the bridle last time at Windsor but today he's completely changed with the visor on. A small-runner field and getting his own way in front has made a massive difference and he just loves Plumpton - Freddie Gordon, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Zoe Davison Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Alto Alto is the first one of mine who has ground it out for a very long time. It's been a frustrating period, most of them just haven't seen it out. We put a tongue-tie on him which he maybe needed for his wind - Chris Gordon, trainer,

stable_tour.quote: He's been a grand horse. He cost the owner Â£21,000 and he's won five races and has been brilliant. His five wins have all come at Plumpton and he seems to save his best for that venue - a bit like his trainer really. He won there again last time but there isn't really anything suitable for him for a while. There's a Fontwell 0-120 handicap we might look at and a couple of other races, but we'll keep him in as low a grade as we possibly can. Some horses can throw the towel in a bit when they're in a race that's a little bit too tough, but when they're in a field where they've got a scent of victory, like he had at Plumpton last time, it's very different. He's very much one of those horses. 26-02-25

runners.name: El Muchacho
runners.comment: Back in Britain after spell with a German stable; on workable mark for new trainer
runners.spotlight: Won small-field Plumpton chase for Harriett Dickin (2m1f, good) just over a year ago and is back in Britain after four-race spell for a German stable towards end of 2024; not an easy one to weigh up at present but it will be interesting to see what Olly Murphy can do with him.

quotes.race: David Slater Big 7-0 Birthday Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've only had El Muchacho for a couple of weeks and we're learning about him all the time, but fair play to Bradley, he gave him a very good ride, and his jumping was impeccable - Harriet Dickin, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Again 25th January Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I thought  El Muchacho was going to win easily enough then the second horse picked up quite well when I got to him. I was a little bit short of room on the rail. He's a nice horse, Milton's done well with him and he's obviously progressed - Harry Cobden, rider.

runners.name: Doyouknowwhatimean
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Michael Lysaght
runners.comment: Not really firing on all cylinders in recent months and could use some rain
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner on heavy ground last season (2m/2m1f) but not really firing on all cylinders in recent months; continues to to slip down the weights but needs to up his game, and could use some rain; cheekpieces (worn for last two races) removed.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very acceptably at Newton Abbot first time up last month over a trip that was plenty far enough. It was the first chance I'd had to get a run into him, given the ground, and I think he could be winning again soon over a slightly shorter distance. 12-11-24

runners.name: Sao Carlos
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason J Hales & J Diver
runners.comment: Didn't get far on recent chasing debut but was in fairly good form over hurdles beforehand
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider in early stages of last month's chasing debut but was in fairly good form over hurdles beforehand and remains lightly raced; could still have a good future over fences.

quotes.race: wetherbyracing.co.uk Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Sao Carlos's jumping was great up the straight. I loved the way he went through the race, he gave me a really classy feel, although when he came off the bridle it took a while for the penny to drop - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't seen the best from him but he had an underlying issue last season, hence his dip in form towards the end. He'll be seen at the end of next month and is handicapped to be very competitive. 24-10-24

He won a bumper at Market Rasen last season and we'll start off in a maiden in the middle of the month. He is doing everything nicely and jumps great, so he seems like a good young novice to get excited about. 01-11-23

runners.name: Gower Prince

prev_owners.owner: Jan Johnson&yor Gunna Be Lucky Syndicate

runners.comment: Absent since disappointing run last summer but resumes on good mark; back in original yard
runners.spotlight: Won for Nigel Twiston-Davies at Wincanton (1m7f, good) exactly one year ago; absent since disappointing run for him last July but on a good mark for this first run since rejoining Matt Sheppard; hood refitted; worth a glance in the betting.

runners.name: Ideallko
runners.comment: Won three in a row during the winter and is still in good form; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with with three consecutive wins this winter (2m-2m5f, good to soft/soft) and is still in good form; up in grade today but recovered well from bad mistake in home straight to finish second here (2m3f, good) last month and may still have a bigger run in him.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned it around. Adam Wedge came back after his win at Plumpton in October saying he's a different horse all of a sudden. He's got the hang of it over fences with two wins from three starts. I can see that being a catalyst for him to improve again. 02-11-23

He won at Ffos Las and Plumpton and was running a good race when he turned over at Sedgefield on Boxing Day. He took a fair whack, so we haven't rushed him back, and he doesn't want deep ground either. He'll be out when it dries a bit and he showed last time he'll be more than competitive off his mark, wherever he goes, whatever the trip. 28-02-24

4:07.race_name: Tip Top Lavish Latrine Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Bertie B
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in good form but looked out of sorts on both outings this year
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with three good runs towards end of 2024, including clearcut win at Plumpton (2m4f, good to soft), but looked out of sorts on both outings this year and needs a boost from the refitted cheekpieces.

runners.name: Getaway Drumlee
runners.comment: Pulled up in a chase in February and also disappointed over hurdles last month
runners.spotlight: Made good start to chasing career in the autumn, but ran poorly over fences in February and also disappointed when back over hurdles last month; may benefit from this drop back in trip but still has a point to prove.

quotes.race: yeeehaaa.bet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Getaway Drumlee can be all right. He'll overcome a fence as well, but I'd imagine he'll go on through May and then we'll give him a break before we go chasing with him next season. He ran a blinder at Doncaster and better than I expected him to. It was great to see him follow up as he jumped and travelled beautifully, and it's nice to see Beau [Morgan, jockey] getting a couple of nice winners for us towards the end of the season. He had a couple of nasty problems - a fibrillating heart and a fractured fetlock - after Sandown when he last ran before this season, so he's had to overcome quite a bit. He's got a good attitude and it's brilliant to see his head back in front for his owners, who have shown so much patience with him - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We have a lot of lovely novices this season and among them is Getaway Drumlee. He joined us after winning his point-to-point at Tattersalls Farm in the spring and had been working so well I expected a big show from him on his rules debut over hurdles earlier this month and he did not disappoint. We started him off at Hereford over 2m3Â½f and although a little green he won very comfortably and can only have learned from the experience. I think he could be versatile regarding his trip as his point win came over 3m, yet I could see him being effective over 2m if asked. He is nice horse and although not too big he jumps well and has a lovely attitude. 26-10-22

runners.name: Geezer Rockstar
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in poor form but on good mark if back on song after wind op
runners.spotlight: Absent since pulled up in two handicaps in late 2024 but looked quite useful when winning Ascot maiden (2m3f, good) 13 months ago and will be dangerous off current mark if back on song after wind surgery.

stable_tour.quote: He surprised us a bit with the way he won first time out as he's from a staying chasing family. He'll go over hurdles now and I couldn't have been more pleased with his racecourse debut. 04-10-23

runners.name: New Found Fame
runners.comment: Won two of his last three (new headgear both times); contender if in the right mood
runners.spotlight: Scored in first-time cheekpieces at Bangor (2m3f, soft) in December and put a lesser run behind him when winning in first-time blinkers there (2m1f, soft) in February; it's hard to predict how well he'll perform in refitted cheekpieces but the forecast good ground won't be a problem.

quotes.race: White Lion At Weston Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very nice debut from New Found Fame and he's a very well-bred horse. He's showed us all the right signs at home and we knew he needed soft ground. He's a little bit delicate so I wanted to come to a lower key meeting and give him a nice experience. He did it really nicely and I hope he'll be a three-mile chaser - Kerry Lee, trainer.

runners.name: Come On Nia
runners.comment: Eased in grade after very respectable fifth in Grade 2 novices' handicap last month
runners.spotlight: Won twice over about 2m in early part of this season and gave very good account when fifth in Grade 2 mares' novices' handicap at Newbury (2m4f, good) last month; eased in grade; respected.

runners.name: El Curamach
runners.comment: Made all in modest 2m maiden last spring; makes handicap debut after 345-day absence
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who made all in a modest Warwick maiden (2m, good) last spring; makes handicap debut after 345-day absence and in a much stronger race but probably still has potential.

runners.name: Let Me Go Boys
runners.comment: Fourth in two 2m soft-ground maidens in late 2024; open to improvement in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who shaped with significant promise when fourth in two soft-ground 2m maidens towards end of last year; open to significant improvement on handicap debut if this trip-and-ground combinations suits.

runners.name: Another Fine Mess
runners.comment: Opened account with 2m win in February and could easily improve again over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at fifth attempt, in Warwick handicap (2m, soft) two months ago; not yet tested on ground quicker than good to soft but could easily have more to offer over today's longer trip.

runners.name: The Grey Man
runners.comment: Below form last time but made good start to handicap career in winter; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Scored on handicap debut at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) in January and was creditable third at Bangor (2m, soft) the following month; reportedly not suited by 2m on good ground when below form last time, but could still have untapped potential over this sort of trip; any rain will aid his cause.

runners.name: Speiriuil
runners.comment: Looked as good as ever when placed at Bangor last month; considered each-way
runners.spotlight: 9lb higher than when opening account at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) in November, but looked as good as ever when third at Bangor (2m3f, good) last month and has obvious each-way claims.

runners.name: The Magus
runners.comment: Improved form when second in Hereford maiden last month; makes handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Safely held on first two hurdling starts, but last month's clear second at Hereford (2m3f, good) was quite a bit better; almost certainly needs to improve again on this handicap debut but has the potential.

runners.name: See The Green
runners.comment: Won a juvenile hurdle in November but recent AW form is uninspiring
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who won against own age-group on stable/hurdle debut at Ludlow (2m, good) in November; not disgraced on next two hurdling starts but recent AW form is uninspiring; upped in trip for this handicap hurdle debut; others appeal more.

1:49.race_name: Tip Top Thunder Throne Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Deep Purple
runners.comment: Third of four at Ludlow (2m5f, good) against two talented principals; absent 165 days
runners.spotlight: 3m point winner and won a good-ground bumper in October; made a positive start over hurdles when third of four at Ludlow (2m5f, good) against two talented principals; absent since early November but should improve and that would put him firmly in the picture.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper in the autumn and ran well enough on his first hurdles start at Ludlow, softening himself up by chasing the odds-on winner. I think he wants slightly slower ground. 12-11-24

runners.name: Gaelic Rambler
runners.comment: Showed significant ability and promise in a C&D maiden despite tiring into last of three
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in both his Irish points; sold for 80,000euros last May and had wind surgery in September; tongue tied when the clear outsider in C&D maiden (good) five weeks ago and he showed significant ability and promise despite tiring into last of three; should be a leading contender.

runners.name: Gasmani
runners.comment: From a staying family but marked improvement is needed on this first run since November
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner who's finished fourth on all three starts over hurdles, on latest holding every chance at the final flight when fourth of 11 on handicap debut at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft); from a staying family but marked improvement is needed on this first run since November.

runners.name: Glance Of Glory
runners.comment: Â£3,000 3yo; second foal; half-brother to a bumper winner; dam point/2m3f-3m1f chase winner
runners.spotlight: Â£3,000 3yo; second foal; half-brother to bumper winner Teeceethree; dam point/2m3f-3m1f chase winner, out of twice-raced sister to 2m4f/2m6f chase winner Lambrini Mist; needs to be pretty useful to win on this debut.

runners.name: Jakar Du Moulin
runners.comment: Â£175,000 buy who's run at 2m4f over hurdles; tongue-tie now; can improve, which is needed
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point last February before his Â£175,000 sale; second at Leicester (good to soft) in November and fourth of nine at Ffos Las (heavy) in December, both over about 2m4f, and he'll probably stay 3m; a tongue-tie is added and he can still improve, which is needed.

stable_tour.quote: He's one I really like. He was bought after winning a four-runner Irish maiden point-to-point at Belharbour in February, the race in which Fact To File made a winning debut two years previously. He jumps well, goes straight over hurdles and will run in a maiden imminently. 04-11-24

runners.name: Pragnell
runners.comment: This longer trip may well suit and he brings potential, as well as some of the best form
runners.spotlight: Absent for 692 days after a winning point debut in 2023; ran twice over an extended 2m3f (soft) over hurdles this February, making most when second here last time and he stuck to his task very well; this longer trip may well suit and he brings potential, as well as some of the best form.

runners.name: Steal The Moves
runners.comment: Upped in trip and back on better ground but no appeal just yet
runners.spotlight: Second and first in two point bumpers last May, but he's met with heavy defeats this year in a bumper and two heavy-ground races over hurdles; upped in trip and back on better ground but no appeal just yet.

2:24.race_name: Tip Top Duel Flush Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Inside Man
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant
runners.comment: 2-7 over hurdles; back in a novice after good second in recent Exeter handicap
runners.spotlight: 2-7 over hurdles; has hefty 12lb penalty to shoulder here but returned from break with good second in Exeter handicap (2m, good) this month and ought to play a significant role.

quotes.race: DragonBet Oncourse Service Online Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inside Man can be a bit busy and needs to learn to settle, switch off and come with a run, which he did here. He's a Manatee and they tend to want soft ground. He's a chaser in the long term - Jane Williams, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Making the running wouldn't have suited him at Taunton last time but he was still able to win. He's shown plenty in two starts, having only just been beaten by Liari on his debut at Wincanton. The Triumph trial at Cheltenham this month is a possibility for him. He'd learn nothing in another junior or juvenile hurdle under a penalty, whereas if he goes up in grade he will be running against proper horses and a good gallop, which would suit him. 11-01-24

runners.name: Sage Green
runners.comment: Caused 40-1 surprise on hurdle debut at Warwick and goes on the shortlist here
