runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who left his disappointing bumper debut a long way behind when causing 40-1 surprise in Warwick novice hurdle (2m, good; first-time hood) six weeks ago; that form is quite tricky to evaluate but, nevertheless, he goes on the shortlist here.

quotes.race: JCB Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't really a surprise, to be honest. I rode Sage Green a few weeks ago at Chepstow and made the running that day, and he ran his race a little bit in the preliminaries and down at the start. I said I wouldn't be too despondent on the bare place he's finished, as he ran a nice race on bad ground. I was delighted they put a hood on him today and they said just change tactics, drop him in, and teach him how to race correctly. I didn't know turning in if we'd be good enough but he's done it quite nicely - James Best, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Blackijo Dagrostis
runners.comment: Ran well for a long way in recent Stratford seller but needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer; ran well for a long way in Stratford selling hurdle (2m2f, good) last month, his second start under rules, but finished weakly there and needs significant improvement.

runners.name: Cuillin Ridge
runners.comment: Did not look straightforward and showed only minor promise in his two bumpers
runners.spotlight: Did not look straightforward and showed only minor promise in his two bumpers; best watched on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: Ifan Full Pelt
runners.comment: Well beaten before falling at third-last flight on recent hurdling debut at Ffos Las
runners.spotlight: Well beaten before falling at third-last flight on hurdling debut at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) two weeks ago; can't be recommended.

runners.name: Portcammon
runners.comment: Won Irish bumper in 2023 but has made a low-key start to his hurdling career
runners.spotlight: Comfortably won Rosocommon bumper on debut for Willie Mullins in summer 2023 but left that stable after rather underwhelming hurdle debut in September and did not get seriously competitive on his first two starts for Neil Mulholland.

runners.name: Zaochen Enki
runners.comment: Won very comfortably on last month's British debut at Wincanton and makes obvious appeal
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in France last summer and won very comfortably when reappearing for Paul Nicholls at Wincanton (1m7f, good; first-time hood) last month; could easily have a lot more to offer and makes obvious appeal.

quotes.race: Andy Mcdonald's 70th Birthday "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zaochen Enki came over from France just before Christmas very light and lean and we didn't think we'd get a run into him this season as it also took a while to get him to settle down and relax. This his will have done him an awful lot of good and he'll remain a novice until December 1st - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A late summer arrival, he'd shown promise on his only run over hurdles in the French provinces. He should be out after Christmas. 04-11-24

runners.name: Golden Echo
runners.comment: Won on the Flat last summer and made quite promising stable/hurdle debut in February
runners.spotlight: Won a low-grade Flat handicap last summer (1m3f, good to soft; RPR 64) and made quite promising stable/hurdle debut when fourth at Southwell (2m, good to soft) in February; not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Another Lifetime
runners.comment: Showed significant ability on second of his two Flat runs; makes stable/hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut on the Flat in Ireland in September, but kept on for very respectable third in Southwell novice (1m3f, AW; RPR 71) in December; now with another new stable for hurdling career; market may guide.

runners.name: Conniemak
runners.comment: Ran okay in C&D junior hurdle on debut but safely held on next outing
runners.spotlight: Made fairly encouraging debut when third of six in C&D (heavy) junior hurdle in January, but was safely held on good ground at Taunton last month; others in this line-up look much stronger.

4:44.race_name: Tip Top Sensational Shower Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Impecunious
runners.comment: Landed a gamble over extended 2m3f here (good) 16 days ago, wandering and with head high
runners.spotlight: Found it tough in handicaps until landing a gamble in ten-runner race over the extended 2m3f here (good) 16 days ago under Callum Pritchard, despite wandering and carrying his head high; back up 4lb in a larger field and tries a new trip, but he has to be considered.

runners.name: Ri Na Cuirte
runners.comment: Back-to-form second over C&D last month; has a 4lb rise but looks a leading contender
runners.spotlight: Off the mark by a nose at Fontwell (3m2f) and close third at Ascot (3m, also on good) later in November; cheekpieces (tried once last term) returned over C&D last month and he was back to form in second of ten to an unexposed favourite; has a 4lb rise but looks a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He was very in and out last season. He won on his seasonal reappearance at Fontwell and then ran really well at Ascot, with the form working out nicely. He schooled well over fences at home but he hated it when we sent him chasing at Taunton. We've since found he's got a kissing spine, so we're keeping him to hurdles. He ran in a novice handicap hurdle at Exeter on Friday, finishing seventh. He wants decent ground, so he'll run deep into the spring. 12-03-25

runners.name: Hawk Stone
runners.comment: It's not happened for him this term, with cheekpieces on latest, so new trip is given a go
runners.spotlight: Last season ended with front-running win (2m, heavy) and he's on the same mark today; it's not happened for him in his three starts (2m1f, 2m5f and 2m) this term, tried in cheekpieces on latest, so new trip is given a go.

runners.name: Lough Owel
runners.comment: Latest start (third for yard) was a step back in right direction; tongue tied first time
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point and showed promise in the mud for Gordon Elliott in bumpers and maiden hurdles, at up to 3m, before ending up out of form with him last spring; latest start (third for new yard) was a step back in the right direction but he needs plenty more today with tongue tied first time.

stable_tour.quote: I have a feeling this is a nice Hillstar gelding. He won his point well and the second horse has since won a maiden hurdle for Emmet Mullins. 24-10-23

runners.name: Mattie Ross

prev_owners.owner: L & J Perkins, N Freeman, R & P Scott

runners.comment: Won off this mark last June (3m, good); disappointing since and now tries first headgear
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles with a clearcut success at Market Rasen (3m, good) last June and has the same mark today, but she was pulled up on her next outing and returned from a break with another three disappointing runs this year; wears headgear first time.

runners.name: My Louise
runners.comment: Hasn't offered that much since winning two bumpers last season; up in trip again
runners.spotlight: Hasn't offered that much since winning two bumpers last season (good/AW) and beaten 18l into fifth of 12 on handicap debut at Stratford (extended 2m6f, good; 13-2) last time; moves up in trip again.

runners.name: Lightonthewing
runners.comment: Made all at 33-1 here (3m, soft) this February; well beaten since, including Saturday
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins at 3m+ last spring on ground ranging from good to heavy; made all at 33-1 over hurdles here (3m, soft) this February but well beaten in all three starts since, latest at Newton Abbot on Saturday.

runners.name: Tom Taggle
runners.comment: While again shaping as if could be a stayer, 32l margin of defeat last time is a concern
runners.spotlight: No match for the first three when fourth of ten as well-backed favourite on handicap debut at Taunton (2m3f, soft); again shaped as if he could be a stayer when trying 2m5f at Ludlow (soft) later in February but the margin of his defeat (32l) is a concern.

runners.name: Quite The Getaway
runners.comment: Finished vastly closer when fifth of 13 at Stratford (near 2m7f) on latest start
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in bumpers and 0-6 over hurdles but she finished vastly closer when fifth of 13 at Stratford (near 2m7f, good to soft) on latest start, in her third handicap; has the same mark today but she also looked worth a crack at today's longer trip.

runners.name: Penthouse Poppet
runners.comment: Faded to go down by 20l at Stratford (2m, good; 12-1) last month on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who is 0-11 in points and 0-9 as a hurdler; faded to go down by 20l at Stratford (2m, good; 12-1) last month on debut for new yard and there's now a rethink on trip.

runners.name: Fantomas
runners.comment: Respected on form last spring; needs major revival with his tongue tied for the first time
runners.spotlight: Respected on form last spring, including his win off 2lb higher in a big field at Hereford (3m2f, good to soft); however, pulled up last June and soundly beaten in his two starts this winter, so needs a major revival with his tongue tied for the first time.

runners.name: Gorcombe Moonshine
runners.comment: Often thereabouts over hurdles, upped to an extended 2m4f at Plumpton 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over fences in late 2023; he's often thereabouts over hurdles, including when upped to an extended 2m4f at Plumpton 18 days ago but that was below his best 2024 efforts over shorter.

runners.name: Watchoutitscookie
runners.comment: Fell heavily in a chase last time; cheekpieces are enlisted for this return to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Won over the extended 2m7f in a chase at Newcastle in December and stays 3m1f, but easily the best of his three runs since saw him take a heavy fall two out on latest outing; cheekpieces are enlisted for this return to hurdling (he's 1-15 in this sphere) and he needs to be at his best.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Lyndsey Lane From Brunel Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I didn't really want to make the running. Watchoutitscookie has a tendency to go to his right, but as long as you don't fight him, he's pretty straightforward that way. So I made the running on him, he's jumped well, and he's done it well - Lorcan Murtagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Newt In Somerset Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Watchoutitscookie has been quite difficult. He's been keen and the hood has helped. It was a good run last time and he was the one today. I think he wants a bit of cut in the ground and he's in at Exeter tomorrow, but we'll see how he is in the morning. I think he'll build on this because he has been difficult and keen. With horses like that, why fight them? He's taught himself to settle if you like - Nigel Hawke, trainer.

runners.name: Dom Bosco
runners.comment: 13-race maiden who was pulled up on last four starts, back over hurdles on last three
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who was pulled up on last four starts, back over hurdles on last three (after a lengthy layoff); wore cheekpieces on last two outings and absent since New Year's Eve.

runners.name: Sawpit Samantha
runners.comment: 3rd when up to 3m at Taunton latest, staying on well from the rear; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden (11 over hurdles) but she did finish third on the first and latest of her four starts this season, latterly when upped to 3m at Taunton (good) and staying on well from the rear; each-way claims again.

runners.name: Elfride
runners.comment: Sole win (21 races) was over an extended 2m7f at Uttoxeter in May 2023 off 2lb lower
runners.spotlight: Sole win (21 races) was over an extended 2m7f at Uttoxeter in May 2023 off 2lb lower; has generally struggled since but, from 2lb wrong today, at least she is not so far out of the handicap as on latest outing.

5:19.race_name: Tip Top Portable Event Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Sinchi Roca
runners.comment: Created pretty good impression when ready winner at Taunton in February; respected
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground point on debut in December and created good impression when ready winner of heavy-ground Taunton bumper for new stable in February; has penalty to carry but still commands respect.

runners.name: Kiss Gold
runners.comment: Half-brother to a French Flat winner; stable runs two; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to French 1m4f winner Jolly Gold (RPR 74); dam unplaced on Flat in France; market strength interesting, particularly in relation to stablemate Can You Hear Me.

runners.name: Old Park Star
runners.comment: Placed in bumpers at Sandown and Kempton; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Brother to smart Irish jumper Chosen Mate; placed in bumpers at Sandown (good to soft) and Kempton (soft) on first two outings; likely to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Pink Pony Club
runners.comment: Dam unplaced in points, half-sister to smart jumper Across The Bay; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unplaced in points, half-sister to smart bumper/jumps winner Across The Bay; has fairly good standard to reach on debut; probably best watched.

runners.name: Romany King
runners.comment: Bought for Â£45,000 after making all on Irish point debut in December; rules debut
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; brother to 2m4f hurdle winner Wonderweasle, half-brother to useful hurdler Silver Sheen and two others jumps winners; dam bumper/hurdle winner; made all in 15-runner Irish point on debut in December (soft ground) and was bought for Â£45,000 the following month; interesting recruit.

runners.name: Gone Girl
runners.comment: Soundly beaten when 40-1 for debut at Warwick (soft) in February
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten when 40-1 for debut at Warwick (soft) in February; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Can You Hear Me
runners.comment: Shaped with significant promise when sixth of 13 at Kempton last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Out of unraced sister to Irish Oaks/Yorkshire Oaks winner Pure Grain; shaped with significant promise and was beaten under 4l when sixth of 13 at Kempton (good) last month; enters calculations.

runners.name: Crown Khov
runners.comment: Behind Can You Hear Me when well down the field at Kempton on last month's debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to smart jumper Magnanimity but was behind Can You Hear Me when well down the field at Kempton (good) on last month's debut.

runners.name: River Glance
runners.comment: Not disgraced on last month's debut at Huntingdon but makes very limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when a big-priced outsider for last month's debut at Huntingdon (good to soft) but makes very limited appeal.

runners.name: Dreamfyre Dancer
runners.owner: The Cant Take It With You Syndicate
runners.comment: First foal from a low-grade 2m4f chase winner; probably one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: First foal from a low-grade 2m4f chase winner, half-sister to 2m7f hurdle winner So Ladylike; probably one for further down the line.

5:55.race_name: Tip Top Portable Event Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Duel Au Soleil
runners.breeder: Earl De Cordelles & Earl La Dariole
runners.comment: Placed in two Irish points in late 2024 and made quite promising rules debut last month
runners.spotlight: Placed in two Irish points towards end of last year and made quite promising rules debut when fourth of 14 at Huntingdon (good to soft) last month; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Manalishi
runners.comment: Â£20,000 3yo; has bumper winners in pedigree and trainer does quite well in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Â£20,000 3yo; third foal; half-brother to bumper/fair hurdle winner River Walk; dam unraced half-sister to useful bumper/hurdle winners Stoney Mountain and Great Try; trainer does quite well in bumpers.

runners.name: Zamek
runners.comment: Half-brother to a smart French Flat racer; cost 160,000euros; represents a top stable
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-brother to five winners including French jumper Zarisk and smart French Flat racer Zyzzyva; dam unraced half-sister to smart South African/UAE Flat winner Zanzamar; cost 160,000euros as a 3yo and represents a top stable; high on the list.

runners.name: Clemcos Revenge
runners.comment: Out of a mare who was well beaten in a bumper; others appeal much more on paper
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; dam well beaten in a bumper, half-sister to a low-grade hurdle winner; others have much more obvious claims on paper.

runners.name: Limerick Lass
runners.comment: Just a respectable fourth at Exeter in January but stable usually does well in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to smart jumper Allart; just a respectable fourth of seven on debut at Exeter (soft) in January, but that form has been well advertised by the winner since and her stable usually does well in bumpers; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Moonlight Stride
runners.comment: Half-sister to smart jumper Senior Chief; no surprise if she features on debut
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to smart jumper Senior Chief, fairly useful chaser Lermoos Legend and a bumper winner; dam once-raced half-sister to smart bumper/jumps winner Bob Bob Bobbin; no surprise if she features.

runners.name: Another Dram
runners.comment: Half-brother to owner-trainer's bumper/hurdle winner Bertie B; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to owner-trainer's bumper/hurdle winner Bertie B; dam bumper/useful hurdle winner; market support will bring him into the equation.

runners.name: Lazare Combo
runners.comment: Won cosily on last month's Irish point debut and evidently has ability
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed over jumps in France, sister to useful jumper Organdi; won cosily on last month's Irish point debut (good to yielding) and evidently has ability.

runners.name: The Mullet
runners.comment: 25,000euros 3yo; out of a well-connected mare; stable has healthy strike-rate in bumpers
runners.spotlight: 25,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to smart bumper/jumps winner Regal Encore and useful bumper/hurdle winner The Organist; stable has healthy strike-rate in bumpers (13%).

runners.name: Diamond Koda
runners.comment: 0-11 but he he has form figures of 3322 in handicaps; big player eased in grade
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but he's finished runner-up eight times and has form figures of 3322 in handicaps; made some mistakes when beaten 15l at Haydock (2m3f, good) last time but that was behind an improver and this looks a good opportunity on this drop back in grade.

runners.name: Police Academy
runners.comment: Triple hurdle winner who has claims on her best form last year; needs close look on return
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins in 2023, with latest off 2lb higher at Ludlow (2m5f, good); well held in final two runs during a light campaign last year but she was runner-up at Worcester last August and that was right up there with her best form; needs close look back from 199 days off.

runners.name: Victoria Milano
runners.comment: Has mixed record in handicaps and was well held back over hurdles latest; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Won two novice hurdles (2m/2m5f) on slow ground but has mixed record in handicaps and was well held back in this sphere at Ludlow (3m, soft) in February; mark continues to fall and she now drops back in trip but others are more convincing; cheekpieces added.

stable_tour.quote: She hasn't found her form this season and she's going for a wind op as we just felt she was missing something. She ran well at Uttoxeter and then travelled very well at Bangor last time, but didn't get home. She had been very consistent, but we've been missing that Sandown form from last season. If we can get her back she's definitely one to keep on side. 19-02-25

runners.name: Doc Mccoy

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

runners.comment: Has struggled over fences this season and needs a major revival back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Won a point in 2022 and maiden hurdle in 2023, but he's struggled in chase handicaps at up to 2m5f this season; still unexposed over hurdles but he needs a major revival back in this sphere; blinkers removed and cheekpieces return.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.name: Reforme

prev_owners.owner: T Rees And Mrs J Green

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden who was pulled up at Ayr last time and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Ex-Lucinda Russell; returned to form when runner-up in Caterick handicap (2m3f, soft) in January but he was pulled up at Ayr last month and that took his overall record to 0-8; others preferred.

runners.name: Calvic
runners.comment: On workable mark but he's not easy to predict and still has stamina to prove at this trip
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb higher than for his Worcester win (2m4f, good; first-time cheekpieces) last June but has mixed record since and was well held on Fontwell reappearance last month; may have needed that run but he still has stamina to prove at this trip and others are preferred.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The drying ground is the important thing. We may step Calvic up in trip on the back at that, especially on that ground - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: To Be Sure
runners.breeder: Mrs Tessa Greatrex & Mr D Futter
runners.comment: Had a near-miss at Exeter last month and is a big player if he can recapture that form
runners.spotlight: His last chase win was two years ago and he failed to complete in two of his last three starts but he split those two runs with a near-miss over fences at Exeter (3m, good) last month; only 2lb higher here and he's a big player if he can recapture that form.

runners.name: Ronnies Reflection
runners.comment: 7yo who is 2-5 over fences and he's open to more progress back up in trip; key player
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo, who made it 2-5 over fences when finishing well to land a Leicester handicap (2m7f, heavy) in February; that was a narrow success but a 3lb rise looks fair and he's open to more progress back up in trip; strongly respected.

runners.name: Cloudy Wednesday
runners.comment: Last year's winner and has claims if he can bounce back after a tame effort at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has won three times over fences including on good ground in this race last year; couldn't hang in there at Southwell last Tuesday but that was after three placed efforts in a row and he has possibilities if he can get back near best.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Cloudy Wednesday likes this ground and it's done nothing but rain until now. He's had a busy time so I might give him a break after that - Caroline Fryer, trainer.

runners.name: Chateau Du Lys
runners.comment: Still unexposed but he needs a transformation on this big step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a 2m4f point last spring but he didn't show much in three hurdle runs during the winter and was well held on handicap/chase debut at Bangor (2m1f, good) last month; still unexposed but he needs a transformation on this big step up in trip.

runners.name: Scottsdale

prev_owners.owner: A Barnes, P W O'Mara & P Winks
P W O'Mara, P Winks & R H Lee

runners.comment: 0-23 over fences and his only hurdle win was in 2019; opposable from out of weights
runners.spotlight: Bounced back with a respectable fourth of six at Sedgefield (3m2f, good) last time but that took his chase record to 0-23 and his only hurdle win was in 2019; opposable from out of the weights.

3:23.race_name: Cecil & Sheila Buttifant Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Saisissante

prev_owners.owner: Agv Karwin Stud, Chauvigny Global Equine Sasu Et Al

runners.comment: Has not progressed in handicap hurdles and needs to raise her game with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins early in 2023 and another at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) that November on second start over hurdles; back from a year off with creditable third on handicap hurdle debut at Hereford in the autumn but she's not gone on from that and was only third of four at Market Rasen last month; mark continues to fall but she's now 1-7 over hurdles and others are more convincing; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Milajess

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Nicholas Kelly

runners.comment: Made her belated breakthrough at Sedgefield last time; up 9lb but she's a big player again
runners.spotlight: In-form 8yo who made her belated breakthrough (26th attempt) when scoring in good style at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) 18 days ago; up 9lb but her confidence should be boosted after that success and she remains feasibly treated on her best form; key player.

runners.name: Graecia
runners.comment: Unexposed over hurdles and is a possible improver now switched to a handicap; watch market
runners.spotlight: Signed off for John Butler with 7f Flat win in October (RPR 80); never involved in three hurdles runs for current yard but she has shown some encouraging signs and this is more realistic now switched to a handicap; possible improver, particularly if she can settle a bit better.

runners.name: Kenmya
runners.comment: Still early days over hurdles but she needs a transformation on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner in France/Spain but she struggled in four hurdle runs for Dan Skelton late last year; still unexposed over hurdles and now goes handicapping back in trip but she needs a transformation.

runners.name: Sawpit Sienna
runners.breeder: D A Hunt And A T Huckfield
runners.comment: Dual course winner who is on dangerous mark and was runner-up at Ludlow latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner, with first two at this track (2m4f, good) and last two at Taunton (2m, soft); her last success was 15 months ago but that was off 8lb higher and she rallied well to finish second at Ludlow (2m, good) 19 days ago; respected in first-time visor.

runners.name: Auntie Maggie
runners.comment: Front-running second at Stratford last Sunday and she's a big player back in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but she made a bold bid and was only just caught by an odds-on rival at Stratford (2m2f, good) last Sunday; was out of the weights that day and she's an interesting contender off 2lb lower on this drop back in trip.

runners.name: Hello Sweety
runners.comment: 0-11 under both codes and pulled up on handicap hurdle debut latest
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden under both codes and she pulled hard before being pulled up on handicap hurdle debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft; 14-1) last month; now drops back in trip but she makes little appeal; hood reapplied.

2:13.race_name: Bruce Towers & Sons Mechanical Engineers Claiming Chase

runners.name: Champagnesuperover
runners.comment: Won at Hereford latest; this match is on unfavourable terms but his rival has lost his way
runners.spotlight: 10yo who was useful in his prime; has unseated twice this winter but he capitalised on a reduced mark when justifying favouritism at Hereford (3m1f, soft) in February; concedes plenty of weight to a rival with the same official rating but he's in form after that smooth win, while Stormin Crossgales has lost his way.

quotes.race: Star Sports Veterans' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought Champagnesuperover would win the last day and he unseated. He's not the force of old but he'd come back down to a mark where he could be competitive and he's still genuine and still has an appetite for racing, when plenty of older horses don't. He's come back down to a grade where he can be competitive and I wasn't surprised to see him win. He had a tendon injury which put him out for 18 months and a lot of horses don't come back the same from that - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He really got back on track over his last two runs and seems in very good form. It took a while to work out his trip but he's a real staying type. He pulled two front shoes off last time and it was a race to just put a line through, but he'll target some nice handicap chases over two miles and six furlongs or thereabouts. 27-10-22

runners.name: Stormin Crossgales
runners.comment: Has lost his way but this is a good opportunity on these terms if he can get back on track
runners.spotlight: Made pretty much all to win back-to-back handicaps at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) and Southwell (2m4f, soft) this winter, the latter in a small field but by 35l; has lost his way since, including with two pulled-up efforts, but this is a good opportunity on these terms if he can get back on track.

quotes.race: Jordan Road Planning Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was brilliant - if Noel Fehily doesn't send us a horse now, he never will! We got Stormin Crossgales for 5,000GBP from Doncaster Sales, and it's taken a bit of time to get to know him. I kept the headgear on for a while as that's what he had on before, but taking it off has really worked. His jumping is key, and that's what wins races for him. To jump and stay 2m4f on that ground is unbelievable - Adam Pogson, joint trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales just needed a bit of confidence. He had a hood and a tongue strap and we've taken the whole lot off. You've got to ride him positively and he's a strong stayer over two miles. It takes some winning round here, making the running like that - Adam Pogson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The whole race was working out perfectly, I was settled and Stormin Crossgales was jumping great but the saddle just went completely sideways and I couldn't get my right leg out. I thought for a second I was coming off him. Somehow I slipped my right foot out and we were still in front, which was the main thing. He stayed straight thankfully, if he jinked or anything I was a goner - Jack Hogan, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

quotes.race: Colin Lewis Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales is not an easy ride and wouldn't settle in his bumpers. He's a lovely horse who is only a frame of a horse - you won't see the best of him until next year. We thought we'd be hurdling now and chasing this time next year, but we kicked on and he's an out-and-out chaser. He'll get bigger and stronger as he gets older. He's a big baby who likes nice ground, but he will cope with slower ground when he gets older - Dave Crosse, owners' representative.

2:48.race_name: Fairfax & Favor Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Dambuster
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat and was runner-up on hurdle debut at Stratford last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Useful dual Flat winner (1m2f) for Andrew Balding; back from a break on hurdling/stable debut at Stratford (2m, good) last month but he rallied well to finish runner-up behind a 1-5 shot; that was a promising effort and he could have a good future in this sphere.

runners.name: Like Magic
runners.comment: Two Flat wins in Germany but he's struggled in both hurdle runs; had wind op
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on the Flat (1m/1m1f) in Germany, but he's struggled in two hurdle runs for new yard including when pulled up at Stratford (150-1) last month; had wind surgery since but he needs a transformation back in trip.

runners.name: Popa Rich
runners.comment: Has shown some ability over hurdles but will be more interesting in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability in four hurdle runs but he was only fourth of six at Hexham (2m, good) last Monday and this looks another tough task on the figures; remains best watched for now.

runners.name: Pottersmattyeeehaa
runners.comment: Struggled in four Flat runs last year and is best watched on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices and beaten at least 12l in four Flat runs (1m-1m4f) on AW last year; now switches to hurdling after 168 days off and is best watched.

runners.name: Under The Sun
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat but he's been well held in two hurdle runs this year; down the list
runners.spotlight: Useful on Flat for Hugo Palmer, with peak effort when fifth in Sandown Classic Trial last spring; changed hands for 52,000gns in October but he's been well held in two hurdle runs this year including a 40l defeat at Huntingdon last month; down the list.

stable_tour.quote: I've rated him highly since he first arrived and he looks the best of our juveniles from what I've seen so far. He has finished runner-up in both of his two starts, and the latter when beaten a neck at Ascot was a very decent effort. He has some fancy entries, including the Champagne Stakes at Doncaster, although I'd think something like the Autumn Stakes might be his race as he's a late-developing juvenile who is doing very well physically, so we're not rushing him. It's possible he'll go to Newbury on Saturday. I'd suggest readers look out for him . 17-08-23

runners.name: Wind River
runners.comment: Fairly useful on Flat and he looks interesting now switched to hurdling for Dan Skelton
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat, but he finished runner-up in a Newcastle handicap (1m) and Southwell novice (7f) in final two runs for Ed Dunlop; now switches to jumps after five months off but he's a half-brother to a hurdle winner and needs a close look on first run for Dan Skelton; has been gelded and tongue-tie is added.

runners.name: Zenato

prev_owners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners

runners.comment: 1m2f Flat winner but he's not progressed over hurdles so far; needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough on the Flat in minor handicap at Nottingham (1m2f, soft) in October; came from off the pace to finish third on hurdling/stable debut at Taunton (2m, good to soft) in December but he's not gone on from that in two runs since; still early days in this sphere but he needs improvement back in a maiden.

5:08.race_name: Fisher Electrical Contractors Mares' Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 3 Elimination) (GBB)

runners.name: Claim Du Brizais
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Magouet
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Claim Du
runners.comment: Disappointing when favourite at Warwick but she could bounce back after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Bought for Â£130,000 after finishing second in Irish point last February; eyecatching third on bumper/stable debut at Aintree (good) in the autumn but was a well-held third when favourite at Warwick (soft) in February; bit to prove after another break but she's had wind surgery and could bounce back with a big run back on quicker ground; tongue-tie added.

stable_tour.quote: She was second in a point-to-point and then went to Aintree for us first time up, where she finished third in a good race after travelling very well - the winner was the best stayer on the day. I can't wait to get her over hurdles next year, but we'll look after her. 12-11-24

She finished second in a point and the form is working out nicely. She's going well at home and will start off in the mares' bumper at Aintree on Sunday. We'll be looking after her this season as she'll be a lovely five-year-old to go hurdling with next season. She's a smart filly. 24-10-24

runners.name: Eastern Shores
runners.comment: Bought for Â£70,000 after Irish point win last spring; needs close look on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Slipped up in her first Irish point but she won the second one last April and was bought for Â£70,000 the following month; out of a half-sister to bumper/smart hurdle winner Alpha Ridge and she needs a close look now switched to rules on her comeback; tongue-tie on.

runners.name: Indigo Sky
runners.comment: 33-1 on Huntingdon debut (2m, good to soft) last month and was tailed off
runners.spotlight: 33-1 on Huntingdon debut (2m, good to soft) last month and she never got involved before finishing tailed off.

runners.name: Jack N Jones
runners.comment: Point winner who was runner-up on comeback at Plumpton and sets standard on that form
runners.spotlight: Won her sole Irish point (3m, good) in March 2023; back from long absence at Plumpton (2m1f, good) 15 days ago but she was well backed and gave it a good shot from the front before finishing second of nine; sets the standard on that form and she's strongly respected.

stable_tour.quote: Has been given time to mature and strengthen since she won in March last year. She'll also start out in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 06-11-24
She was a cosy winner of her point-to-point and looks a more than useful prospect, especially when she goes over hurdles, but a bumper run will come first. 28-09-23

runners.name: Lapointe
runners.comment: Out the back on Southwell debut last summer; opposable back from 321 days off
runners.spotlight: Always in rear when a well-held eighth of nine on Southwell debut (2m, good to soft; 20-1) last summer; opposable back from 321 days off.

runners.name: Last Note
runners.comment: Half-sister to five winners but she could be one for later on
runners.spotlight: Twelfth foal; half-sister to five winners including Sir Note (useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase), Niagara L'Amandour (French 2m hurdle) and Absainte (3m1f hunter chase); dam French 2m5f chase winner, out of 1m7f-2m3f hurdle/chase winner; yard 0-3 in bumpers in recent seasons and she could be on for later on.

runners.name: Miss Tinkerbell
runners.comment: Some promise on debut but she failed to build on that at Southwell; blinkers back on
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise when 12l fourth on Wincanton debut (1m7f, heavy) in January but she failed to build on that on good ground at Southwell (seventh of ten) last month; blinkers now return but others are preferred.

runners.name: For Love Of Beauty
runners.comment: 1,200gns 2yo; this looks a tough starting point and she's probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 1,200gns 2yo; fifth foal; dam 7f AW winner (RPR 78), half-sister to French 6.5f AW Listed winner Fond Words, out of 7f-1m2f Listed winner; this looks a tough starting point and she's probably best watched; tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Mcflo
runners.comment: Has fair standard to aim at on debut and others look more likely; cheekpieces applied
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to 2m3f hurdle winner Fricka; dam bumper winner, is granddaughter of German Oaks third Santina; has fair standard to aim at on debut and others look more likely; cheekpieces applied.

2:35.race_name: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Chase Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Jpr One
runners.comment: Classy customer who made a bad mistake two out in a handicap at Cheltenham last time
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 novice winner last season; tongue tied this campaign and, after winning the Haldon Gold Cup on reappearance, he ran respectably in the Grade 1 Tingle Creek and Grade 2 Game Spirit; looked interesting back in handicap company at Cheltenham (2m) but a bad mistake two out put paid to his chance; highly respected.

quotes.race: BetMGM Haldon Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: JPR One is a really good horse. He is my future and he could go right to the top, but I won't run him lots of times. The second half of last season he never really got his ground - it was as simple as that. He will have an entry in the Tingle Creek. Today was what we were thinking about though. He has won over two and a half miles over hurdles, but I don't think we need to think about that just yet - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Racing App Now Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Today was the best we've seen JPR One and it was quite a comfortable watch because he travelled great and he's got a fair bit about him on his day. We've always held him in really high regard. Had he not had that stumble at Cheltenham, he was going to look majorly impressive, and the ground took its toll in the Henry VIII at Sandown. He's only a novice for one year and he's beaten the best of the English novices today, so we'll have a crack at it (Arkle) - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Reg' As The November) (GBB)
quotes.quote: That's racing. Luckily the horse and Brendan are alright and JPR One looked like he was going to win very impressively. He jumped from fence to fence and jumped the last well but just crumpled a little bit. We know we've got a horse to go to war with. This was the lovely next step and he didn't come down five out leaving us without knowing more. He was about to put up a proper performance, I've no doubt about that, and these things happen. I half thought about the Henry VIII but I might need to give him a confidence boost so we'll see - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll start off in the Haldon Gold Cup, which has always been the target. We think he's a Graded horse, so he should be very competitive in a handicap off 149. He's done everything right since he's come back in and looks a million dollars. He didn't get his ground in the second half of the season, he travelled well enough in the Arkle but he didn't get up the hill. He's better than that and he should've won three last season if he'd have stood up in the Grade 2 at Cheltenham in November. After Exeter we'll see whether we step up in grade or trip. We'll find out more but on his day he's a very talented horse. 07-11-24

He's in great form and schooled pleasingly last week. He's set for the Lightning Novices' Chase at Lingfield on Friday and a dry forecast is good for him. I felt in the Henry VIII, he travelled like the best horse everywhere, but didn't get home and I think he was just struggling on the testing ground when he made a mistake two out. I wasn't massively disappointed with that, but he does have a good action and skips off the ground. Hopefully we'll have a strong spring campaign with him and he'll be entered in the Arkle. 18-01-24

runners.name: Martator
runners.comment: Another quiet run at Cheltenham; opposable, despite the handicapper offering some respite
runners.spotlight: Completed a five-timer at Ascot in November (2m1f, good) but he couldn't keep winning and his subsequent struggles continued in the Grand Annual; remains opposable, despite the handicapper offering some respite.

quotes.race: Byrne Group Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Martator is one of the few horses I'm happy to run on this sort of ground. He's very small, usually the smallest in any race he's in, and he's light on his feet. He ran on similar ground back here in the spring and obviously enjoyed it. He's probably improved for his summer break and needed to, because this was a step up again. He's an extraordinary horse and a bit of a character. When I walk out into the field back home I can guarantee you he's always the first horse to come out of the pack to say good morning. He's really inquisitive and I think that's why the cheekpieces help as it gives him less opportunity to be interested in what's going on around him! - Venetia Williams, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: LK Bennett Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were slightly concerned dropping back in trip for Martator but it worked out great making the running and it was lovely to see him really pick up going to the line. That's the first time he's run on good ground and, assuming he's okay afterwards, it still gives us an option for something else in April - Venetia Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a fantastic season last term, running eight times, never finishing outside the first three and ending with three straight wins. He's very enthusiastic and two or two and a half miles come the same to him. He's only seven, is versatile when it comes to the ground and hopefully he can pick up where he left off last season. 23-10-24

runners.name: Westport Cove
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Front-runner and solid efforts in beginners' chases; big player if avoiding mistakes
runners.spotlight: Very useful hurdler who has come up short in four beginners' chases in Ireland but it's all strong form and late errors cost him dear when he succumbed at the death to a respected rival at Wexford (2m, yielding) last time; will need his wits about him to avoid mistakes around here and competition for the lead is assured; still respected as a Mullins raider making his handicap debut in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: A nice, big horse who just got a bit tired at Tipperary on Friday. He should come forward nicely for that and we'll look for another beginners' chase for him next. 25-11-24
He was a comfortable winner of his only race, a Fairyhouse bumper in January when there was plenty of cut. He hasn't run since but would be one to consider. 08-03-23

runners.name: Matterhorn
runners.comment: Won his first four over fences but it's all gone pear shaped; ran no race last month
runners.spotlight: Won his first four starts over fences last May-July, all small-field handicaps (2m-2m1f; good or good to firm); however, it's all gone pear shaped since and he ran no race at Newbury last month when back from a break.

quotes.race: John Murtagh 60th Birthday Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matterhorn is going the right way very rapidly and we've got 12 months with him as a novice as well. His jumping is fantastic and that'll put him in good stead in the handicaps or novice chases. What we might do, subject to a discussion with Johnny [de la Hey, owner], is go for a 25,000GBP chase in August. We might then give him a break and try to pick up a nice early October novice chase if the ground is fast - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing To School Bridgwater College Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Matterhorn is a smart horse, sadly he struggles a fraction with his breathing. Hence flat track good ground is made for him. I think there's another race two weeks today in a National Hunt novices' hurdle he can run in with a 10lb penalty, and then I dare say we'll go chasing with him, because after December 1 he's not a novice any longer - Paul Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't always had much time for summer jumping, but this year I kept a small team going at Highbridge, our second yard, and really enjoyed training them, tweaking their routine and doing a few things differently. We were rewarded with 20 winners, with Matterhorn the undoubted star. He has struggled all his life with his breathing, but bounced back from a third bout of corrective surgery at the start of the year and took instantly to chasing. Fences seem to help him breathe easier and he was on fire, winning four novice handicaps before a bad error at Newton Abbot halted the sequence; you can put a line through that. He returned at Ascot on Saturday where he was again below his best and was found to have bled, something he'd never done before. Having been on the go all summer he's now due a break and will be off until the spring. Needs two miles, a flat track and decent ground. 04-11-24

runners.name: Fringill Dike
runners.comment: Classier contests find him out, as was the case in the Grand Annual (33-1) last time
runners.spotlight: Has won half of his ten starts over fences but classier contests find him out, as was the case in the Grand Annual (33-1); others much preferred.

quotes.race: Make Your Home A Happy Haus Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blinkers have been the making of Fringill Dike. For some reason over hurdles he just lost his confidence a little bit, he didn't like being crowded. The instant we put blinkers on, he was just a different horse. Life is going to get tougher now as his mark is getting towards 130 and the better jumpers will be coming out before too long. There's a race at the first meeting at Wetherby that may suit as long as the ground hasn't gone too slow by then - Jedd O'Keefe, trainer.

runners.name: Sans Bruit
runners.comment: Made all in Aintree's Red Rum and sure to try something similar; up 9lb but they claim 5lb
runners.spotlight: Smacks of a spring horse and recently won Aintree's Red Rum Chase (2m, good to soft) for the second successive season under a superb front-running ride from Harry Cobden; handicapper came down hard with a 9lb rise but Jay Tidball claims 5lb and this 7yo will take some reeling in if in similar form.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sans Bruit ran very well on good ground earlier in the season, but in the winter he hated that heavy ground. When he ran at Windsor, Cobby [Harry Cobden, jockey] said, 'we'll just get him right in the spring and he'll take all the beating in this race', and that's what we've done. He managed to run off with Freddie [Gingell] the other day at Chepstow, but the biggest thing is that he looks amazing now, this is his time of year, he's come in his coat in his sunshine, he's relaxed and we had him really, really right - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Red Rum Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Last time was a sign of Sans Bruit coming to himself and he had been too keen in the first couple of races here. He took a long time to acclimatise to racing in this country. He's just coming right now and could even go to Ayr and Sandown. I wouldn't be afraid to put him in the Celebration Chase - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's gone up in the handicap since winning the Red Rum but has run some solid races this season. He's a good, fun horse who always runs his race. He'll have a Grand Annual entry but is more likely to go to Aintree again. 9-2-25

runners.name: Asta La Pasta
runners.comment: Gifted an easy lead at Ayr and made the most of it; this might not pan out so favourably
runners.spotlight: Stays further but he went from the front back over 2m at Ayr ten days ago and was never headed, coming home 37l clear having been left in isolation late on; would have won anyway and it's hard to grumble with the 5lb rise; whether this will pan out quite so favourably looks highly questionable.

quotes.race: Seko Logistics Scotland Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race never really materialised and I'll have a think about whether to run Asta La Pasta tomorrow - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been looking like he's not quite staying over two and a half miles, so it might be that we drop back in trip for the Grand Annual. He's had plenty of experience for a novice, so that shouldn't be a concern.  10-2-24

runners.name: Teddy Blue
runners.comment: Lost little in defeat when the hat-trick bid came up shy at Newbury; can run well again
runners.spotlight: Only his second run over fences when winning easily at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) and he followed up at Kempton (2m2f, good) when left clear late on; no match for the winner when running off this mark at Newbury last time but he was conceding plenty of weight and some scruffy jumping didn't help; off a low weight he's by no means dismissed.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: If I'd gotten any more detached I probably would have given up hope too, but I was never that far back that I was going to have to pull up. Teddy Blue stayed and once he turned for home he knew the stables were ahead, and he duly took off. I think the hardest part was getting on him and getting him down to the start. He takes a bit of knowing and Harry and Paul O'Brien told me all about him, so it's a lot of thanks to them for the help - Brendan Powell, jockey.

runners.name: Aucunrisque
runners.breeder: L Lafitte, H Barus & P Lafitte
runners.comment: Best known for hurdling exploits; hasn't been seen over fences since late 2023
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-5 over fences but last seen in this discipline pulling up at Cheltenham in late 2023; has since gone 1-10 over hurdles, the win coming at Ascot earlier in November off 1lb lower (1m7f, good); encouraging run last time but he returns to fences in a hot contest.

quotes.race: LK Bennett Autumn Collection Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went off like the clappers to start off with and I was the first off the bridle. Aucunrisque always puts in a good race and he's a good, tough horse - Freddie Gordon, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Hurdle (Handicap) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll go for the Grand Annual with him now. Aucunrisque is a wonderful, tough, consistent horse who gives me no issues at all. It makes life so easier when he's straightforward. I thought about going for the Lightning Novices' Chase at Doncaster, but I didn't want to pick up a couple more pounds in the handicap - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing On Sky 415 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was just a huge relief as Aucunrisque was a bit unlucky to get beaten last time and it was very painful. We thought we'd keep it simple and pop out in front. He's very straightforward. He's a good jumper but he's not the biggest in the world. He might jump a fence but if he doesn't he'll be a smashing hurdler. He's got solid form all the way through and backed it up - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His long-term plan had been the Graduation Chase at Carlisle but it was called off due to the weather, so his run at Ascot was a back-up option. He seems in good form and it's great to contest some valuable races with him, but his handicap mark makes things tricky. He's a better-ground horse and he's not very big, so he's largely kept to hurdles, and he just showed his novicey side on Saturday over fences. He finished well though and two miles is probably his trip, so we just need to harden him up a little bit. I think we'll keep him over fences for now as Rex [Dingle] thinks there's very much a chaser in there. 27-11-23

I'd love to go up to Kelso with him for the Morebattle Hurdle on Saturday but we'd need the ground to dry up for him. He's a good-ground horse and conditions went against him at Newbury last time. If he doesn't go to Kelso, we might just have a day out at Cheltenham for a bit of fun - he's entered in the County Hurdle. He's effective on good ground or quicker and I think the Sussex Champion Hurdle at Plumpton in April would be a good aim. He won it three years ago. 26-02-25

runners.name: Coastguard Station
runners.comment: Ascot winner 22 days ago but 6lb higher now and that demands a career-best performance
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to floor an in-form rival at Ascot (2m1f, good) three weeks ago, taking his chasing strike-rate to 4-14; 2lb wrong here, so he's now 6lb higher and that surely demands a career-best performance at the age of nine.

quotes.race: LK Bennett Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Coastguard Station is quite a quirky individual, hence why he has the headgear on. Even though he's keen, he can often get there and think he's done enough - Henry Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'd given Coastguard Station a little break as he's quite a free individual and can flatten himself out. He's come back fresh and well and that was ideal. We'll see what's about and see how he is. He likes a fast run race and could go up in trip with a run behind him - Henry Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: More Than A Flake Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Henry (Brooke) gave Coastguard Station a proper educational ride. He has loads of experience and he's very underrated as he was more than capable of getting the job done and we were pleased to have him on board. I don't think he wants the ground too extreme, so we might look for something this side of Christmas before then looking at nicer racing in the spring - Henry Oliver, trainer.

3:45.race_name: Southern Cranes Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Mr Escobar
runners.comment: Had no excuses when second here yesterday after enjoying an easy lead
runners.spotlight: Useful stayer on the Flat; odds-on winner of a Sedgefield novice hurdle (2m1f, good) but had no excuses when second here yesterday after enjoying an easy lead.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Proud To Support British Racing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Escobar wouldn't have been good enough to win a maiden hurdle in Ireland, so Patrick and Willie thought they might as well come here and try to win a maiden. He's a bit quirky. He didn't jump round one day at Killarney, he ran out before the [first] hurdle, so that's in the back of your mind going down to the first. I just thought the best of the ground was out wide, but it didn't matter and he would have still won anyway. It was nice to get it done. The track suited him, it kept him interested, and I was delighted with the way he jumped - Brian Hayes, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Excelero
runners.comment: Narrow winner of his last two novices; needs further progress to defy this high a mark
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on his handicap debut but that was a strong race at Newbury and he's since won novices at Bangor (2m, soft) and Exeter (2m2f, good to soft), both by narrow margins having made all; needs further progress to defy this high a mark.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Approved And Reviewed Trades People EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: From three-out Excelero was very tough and it's one of his hallmarks. He stayed the trip well and it was a very gutsy and good performance. We didn't have the hood on last time as we didn't think we needed it, but over this trip we thought it was important he could relax enough to get home. I think it made the difference. Chester Williams - assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Neo Business Finance Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Excelero was giving the hurdles plenty of air early and he's probably a chaser really - connections have that in mind for him. He probably wouldn't want the ground as bad as that but he copes with it - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He finished a good second to Salver on his only start at Warwick in November. Salver has gone on to better things and I keep being asked on the racecourse about Excelero given that run, so I'm hoping the form is as good as it looks! He's a long-term horse, an exceptional jumper and a chaser in time. He has a tendency to be a bit keen so we held him up on his debut and he ran really well. We'll mind him slightly but he should be running at the end of January and he'll go on soft ground. A junior hurdle at Newbury on January 23 is an option, as is the Triumph trial at Cheltenham on January 27. The latter is a race we've done well in - we've won it twice in the last ten years from not many runners. 11-01-24

runners.name: Ambion View
runners.owner: O C R Wynne & Mrs S J Wynne
runners.comment: Maiden winner; he does have a blunder in him but brings potential into handicaps
runners.spotlight: Exeter 2m2f maiden winner (good to soft) who has held his own under a penalty and wouldn't have been far away but for a bad late mistake back there last time; he does have a blunder in him but brings potential into handicaps.

stable_tour.quote: He'd caught the eye over the summer, so we were chuffed when he won at Exeter first time out last month. There were some nice horses in that race and he did it nicely so it was a pretty good performance. There's more to come from him, he'll get two and a half miles and we might try and win another novice under a penalty. 07-11-24

He's a lovely big baby and his owners are happy to be patient with him this season. He took a big step forward at Wincanton last time and James Tudor said he had a job to pull him up. We'll probably run him in another bumper and then he'll be turned away before coming back as what I hope is a smashing novice hurdler next autumn. 18-01-24

runners.name: Escapologist
runners.comment: His latest conqueror is progressive but this mark still looks challenging
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up in novices since winning a Fakenham maiden in January (2m4f, good); his latest conqueror is progressive but this mark still looks challenging.

runners.name: Elysian Knight
runners.comment: Holds Authentic Legacy on their latest clash; an improving first-season hurdler
runners.spotlight: The only real blip in his career was when pulled up in the EBF Final at Sandown and that's always a tough race; redeemed himself when making light work of Authentic Legacy in a Fontwell novice (2m5f, good) and he's better off at the weights with that rival; there are others to worry about but he's respected.

quotes.race: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Elysian Knight ran well at Plumpton, his first time over hurdles, I don't think there is massive improvement really. He ran well in his bumpers. We always thought he was a nice horse - Neil Mulholland, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Wicked Thoughts
runners.comment: Professional all round when making all in a four-runner maiden at Ascot
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; he wasn't progressing as hoped over hurdles but was very professional all round when making all in a four-runner maiden at Ascot (2m3f, good) three weeks ago; it's questionable what he achieved but hopefully onwards and upwards.

quotes.race: Howden Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wicked Thoughts liked that back down in trip and, like a few of ours, he wasn't quite right before, but he looked great in his coat. He's not a big, heavy horse, but he skipped off that ground and he loved it. He jumped really well. His form at Exeter on fast ground, when he gave weight away to Nicky's [Henderson's] horse [Kingston Pride], who was actually all right, it made me think he'd have a good chance - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We went quietly with him in bumpers last season, giving him more time to mature. He made a promising start to his hurdling career when just run out of it at Southwell last month, and I'll be looking for him to step up on that when he reappears. He's a decent, fun horse. 04-11-24

runners.name: Authentic Legacy
runners.comment: Beaten by Elysian Knight in a novice last time and not weighted to reverse those placings
runners.spotlight: Back at 2m when beating five rivals for breakthrough success in a Newbury handicap (soft) but no match for Elysian Knight in a Fontwell novice last time (2m5f, good) and not weighted to reverse those placings.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It all went wrong at Sandown the other day when we tried Authentic Legacy over two and a half miles. I put cheekpieces on him, but he was far too keen and the headgear overdid it. He always looks like he needs to go further, so you start to wonder if he's tripless. He's a chaser in the making and I do hold him in reasonable regard. He's got the size and scope, and he's very athletic, and he should take to a fence - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very green last season and has taken time to mature but seems to have done well through the summer. We'll see how he runs on his comeback at Fakenham on Wednesday but he might need a bit of racing to help him grow up this season. He should stay two and a half miles and is a nice type. 29-10-24

runners.name: Illegal Dainay
runners.comment: Course winner; he doesn't look ahead of his mark but he's not had a lot of racing
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m maiden on good ground here last May and ran another good race to be fourth on handicap debut at Windsor three months ago (2m4f, soft); he doesn't look ahead of his mark but he's not had a lot of racing.

runners.name: Star Of Affinity
runners.comment: Likeably consistent but others may be better treated after three wins already this season
runners.spotlight: It could have been the soft ground but more than likely a raised handicap mark that contributed to his 16l third at Newbury last time (2m4f); likeably consistent but others may be better treated.

runners.name: As The Fella Says
runners.comment: Interesting to gauge the confidence behind him on handicap debut after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Won in his third Irish point; a beaten favourite in all his qualifying races over hurdles (2m-2m5f), the latest when 14l behind Excelero at Exeter (2m2f, good to soft); it will be interesting to gauge the confidence behind him on handicap debut after wind surgery.

stable_tour.quote: A new member to the team, he was bought in the spring after he won a point-to-point in Ireland and he looks a promising sort. We will almost certainly start him over hurdles and he's a very exciting prospect. 22-10-24

runners.name: Confinentic
runners.breeder: Mrs Marie Merienne & Mr Julien Merienne
runners.comment: 2-2 here, the last time in a handicap; should have better days ahead of him
runners.spotlight: Sharp improvement to win a 2m novice here on good to soft and saw this longer trip out well when following up here in his first handicap (soft); 4lb rise is fair for one who should have better days ahead of him.

stable_tour.quote: His first hurdle run at Fontwell in November was very solid. I've got Electric Mason, who won it, and he goes for the Martin Pipe, and the runner-up and the third both won novice hurdles next time. He was sitting there in fourth and stumbled badly on the bottom bend, but what's great is that he came out and won a little maiden at Plumpton and then backed it up by winning a handicap there off a mark of 110. The ground went against him that day - it got pretty testing and he was a tired horse - so I said to the owners that we'd freshen him up. We'll have a little go at something, maybe in April. 26-02-25

runners.name: Mostly Sunny

prev_owners.owner: Desk Till Dawn And Wetumpka Racing

runners.comment: Has mostly struggled since winning twice last summer; 7lb above his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Has mostly struggled since winning twice last summer and yet remains 7lb higher than his last winning mark; the returning cheekpieces haven't done wonders for him in the past.

2:00.race_name: Cappagh Browne Utilities Ltd Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Press Your Luck
runners.comment: Poor in two runs after an absence but getting away from soft ground will be preferable
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 5-18 as a hurdler but he's a 10yo now and has shown little in two runs (both over 3m) following a long absence; on the plus side, getting away from soft ground will be preferable.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Newbury Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Press Your Luck won over fences at Chepstow in October but then lost his bottle. He went to Wetherby and he didn't want to know; he whipped round at the start. His jumping was appalling next time at Exeter and, for whatever reason, the horse got his confidence back today and loved that. He'll stay over hurdles for the time being and I think he enjoyed the small field. He's a good horse when things go right - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Tom Malone Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I questioned if Press Your Luck would enjoy it today, he's a very sensitive horse. We tried him in cheekpieces once and he downed tools so things have to go his way. He had been much more comfortable when we'd schooled him and he's got the scope. He really enjoyed it today and we'll go back and work out where to go. He's a real nice prospect and I'll imagine he'll stay well - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've been a bit obsessed with Press Your Luck and a small field, so I wanted Jamie to give him plenty of space on the outside, which he's done beautifully. That's more of the horse I see at home. I put cheekpieces on him in the Lanzarote and he sulked. He took exception to them, so we've taken them off and gone back to square one. He got his confidence back at Wincanton. There might be something at Aintree, but I'm keen to give him a run over fences as soon as the new season starts and before he goes out in the field. He's happier on good ground - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from Donnacha having won a point-to-point in Ireland 12 months ago. He had his first run for us at Kempton in the spring, where he was given an ideal introduction in a 2m bumper. He learned a lot from that race and then enjoyed a long summer off. He has a very likeable attitude and I felt his work had been encouraging enough to expect a good run on his hurdling debut at Newton Abbot last month. He did not let us down, winning nicely and is clearly going the right way. There is a 2m1f novice hurdle at Fontwell that would be a nice next race for him and I would be hopeful of him stepping up again on that effort as he still very inexperienced. 11-11-20

runners.name: Warranty
runners.breeder: S C E A Des Bissons
runners.comment: Only narrowly denied with the front two clear over C&D (good) two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Ex-Gary Moore for whom he won races; two Flat wins for this yard and he was only narrowly denied with the front two clear over C&D (good) two weeks ago; must have a good chance.

stable_tour.quote: We have a nice team of juveniles and this one looks the part. He won at Beverley in July, beating Frankenstella, who has since won three. He appears to have a bit of class and I like him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Ken Roy
runners.comment: Pulled up the last twice but it's still quite early days and his yard is bang in form
runners.spotlight: Second in a maiden here (2m4f) in December, since which he's been pulled up in a maiden at Cheltenham and the EBF Final (handicap) at Sandown; doesn't look on that good a mark but it's still quite early days and his yard is bang in form.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed from his first outing to his second in bumpers, having run green on his debut. He puts me in the mind of Emailandy, who showed promise in one of his bumpers before improving masses when switching to novice hurdles. He'll benefit from a step up in trip. 04-11-24

runners.name: Kaituna River
runners.comment: Second at Uttoxeter on return to hurdling; suited by good ground, so watch the weather
runners.spotlight: Went backwards over fences but appreciated the return to hurdling and cheekpieces when runner-up over a slightly shorter trip than this at Uttoxeter (good); suited by good ground, so watch the weather.

runners.name: Kells Priory
runners.comment: Ran better here yesterday in the finale but they went no pace
runners.spotlight: Out of form since winning an Irish handicap last summer (2m4f, good) and although he ran better here yesterday they went no pace; looks vulnerable.

runners.name: Copshill Lad
runners.comment: Endured a hard race when a weary fifth on slow ground on Saturday; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Only 3lb above the mark he defied on stable debut earlier in the season (2m6f, soft) but he endured a hard race when a weary fifth on slow ground at Newton Abbot on Saturday; non-runner.

stable_tour.quote: He runs in the famous colours of Middleham Park Racing and made a winning debut when landing a Stratford bumper in May. We have tinkered with his wind over the summer, and he is now back in full work. He should be ready to resume next month with a view to tackling National Hunt novice hurdles. 13-10-22

runners.name: Gwennie May Star
runners.breeder: Sc Racing Investment Society Ecurie Ris
runners.comment: Extended 2m3f when winning easily at Bangor; big player if he can see out this trip
runners.spotlight: 2-4 in handicaps; beaten a long way in the two defeats but appeared sweetened up by the new cheekpieces when coasting home in front at Bangor (extended 2m3f, good) nine days ago and a 7lb rise could have been worse; the big question mark hangs over today's much longer trip, but he's clearly a strong contender if he can see it out.

runners.name: La Dolce Dolly
runners.comment: Has won both her races since raised in distance and is looking progressive
runners.spotlight: Has won both her races since raised in distance, the first over C&D and then beating the one other finisher at Wincanton (again on good ground); raised another 4lb but should be on the scene.

quotes.race: Wincanton Fireworks On Sale Now Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: La Dolce Dolly is very willing and we're really happy with her. She might have one more run at Plumpton on Easter Monday and we're hoping she'll make up into a good staying chaser next season. She doesn't want the ground too soft - Andy Irvine, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: All Authorized
runners.comment: It wasn't a bad run over fences last time but he's unproven over this far
runners.spotlight: Odds-on winner at Fontwell in a bumper on soft and a maiden on good; chasing this season (after wind surgery) and his latest effort was much the best of those; however, he returns to hurdles over a trip that could stretch him (unraced beyond an extended 2m4f).

stable_tour.quote: He was consistent over hurdles last season and it was great to get him off the mark at Fontwell. He's a bit behind the majority of them, having had a wind operation, but he's done well physically and will probably go over fences this season. He might not be out until the new year but hopefully he can progress as a chaser. 29-10-24

5:35.race_name: BetGoodwin Free Bet On Nose Losers Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
5:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Jefe Triunfo
runners.comment: Won a weak race on debut and was well beaten under his penalty after a layoff
runners.spotlight: Won a weak four-runner race at Worcester in May 2023 and not seen again until last month when well beaten under a penalty at Huntingdon; stable looks to have better chances.

quotes.race: Every Horse Turned Out Daily richardnewlandracing.com Open NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Chris (Gordon) said he quite liked Jefe Triunfo beforehand. I think he's probably too nice to keep going right the way through the summer - Harry Cobden, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Kajikia
runners.comment: Tailed off in a Listed race last time; had beaten a useful horse on debut at Ascot
runners.spotlight: The hood worn for his first two races is removed; won narrowly from off the pace at Ascot (good) but then finished tailed off in a Listed race there when 33-1 (good to soft); respected on that initial effort as the second is a useful horse; perhaps unwise to read too much into Harry Cobden riding for an outside yard as Jay Tidball has been aboard for this gelding's first two runs.

runners.name: Emerald Lad
runners.breeder: S A Sullivan Bloodstock Ltd Et Al
runners.comment: Interesting newcomer for a yard with a good strike-rate in these races
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to point winner Kap D'Attente; dam achieved little but half-sister to winners Pur De Sivola (useful 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase), Wicklow Gold (2m5f hurdle) and R Rien De Sivola (2m-2m4f hurdle/chase); interesting newcomer for a yard with a good strike-rate in these races.

runners.name: Emerald Poet
runners.comment: Newcomer from the Mullins yard and he's from a good jumping family
runners.spotlight: Third foal out of an unraced mare and half-sister to 1m4f winner Eight Up, the granddaughter of a half-sister to good jumpers Galmoy, Youlneverwalkalone and Dance Beat; as a representative of Willie Mullins he's clearly a feasible winner.

runners.name: Fortune Timmy
runners.comment: Bought for Â£40,000 after finishing second in a 3m soft-ground Irish point in January
runners.spotlight: Bought for Â£40,000 after finishing second in a 3m soft-ground Irish point in January; the third has since won a bumper in Britain; one of three runners for Chris Gordon.

runners.name: General Briar
runners.comment: Second at Fontwell behind one who wasn't disgraced in a Grade 2 at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Placed in both his Irish points and again on bumper debut at Fontwell, when chasing home one who wasn't disgraced in a Grade 2 at Aintree this month; solid chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's one to keep an eye out for. He ran at Fontwell on Sunday in his first bumper and came second. It was a lovely run after a long time off. We'll probably be looking for something at the end of March and see if we can pick up a bumper somewhere. I'm very pleased with him. 26-02-25

runners.name: Roi Du Risk
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Narrow Fontwell winner; penalised in what should be a stronger race
runners.spotlight: Never settled on debut but was much improved to win by a narrow margin at Fontwell (soft; front pair clear) in January; penalised in what should be a stronger race.

runners.name: Le Beau Madrik
runners.comment: Skelton-trained 4yo receiving weight from all his rivals and has to be feared
runners.spotlight: 35,000euros 3yo; third foal; dam French 2m hurdle/2m1f chase winner, half-sister to winners One Big Bang (2m7f/3m hurdle) and Cool Park (2m4f hurdle); Skelton-trained 4yo receiving weight from all his rivals and has to be feared.

4:19.race_name: Gordon And Angela Ashdown Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
