4:19.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Lady Jago
runners.comment: Easy winner of her last two races and could be well in with her penalty
runners.spotlight: No great shakes in her first three chases but has won her last two, beating last week's Cheltenham winner Minniemum at Wincanton (3m1f) and then bolting up at long odds-on at Warwick last week (2m4f; again good ground); given those RPRs she looks well in with a penalty.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden very well and has been second since to two nice horses. She'll go into handicaps, where she'll continue to pay her way, and she'll jump a fence in time. 12-11-24

runners.name: Sea Invasion
runners.comment: Not bred for this far but all he did was plod on when beaten favourite over 2m3f at Exeter
runners.spotlight: Not bred for this far but all he did was plod on when a beaten favourite over 2m3f (good) at Exeter last time and the winner has gone in again since; two new forms of headgear are applied this afternoon and he has obvious claims, provided he stays.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse. He ran nicely at Cheltenham last time and he'd want slightly slower ground. We'll go novice handicap chasing and he jumps really well. I'm really positive about him this season. He'll want somewhere between two and a quarter and two and a half miles, and he could be another one for the novice handicap chase at the Cheltenham Festival. 14-11-24

runners.name: Onethreefivenotout
runners.comment: Could yet come good over fences despite heavy defeats in his first two chases
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo; potentially well handicapped on the form he showed over hurdles and could yet come good over fences despite heavy defeats in his first two chases, both handicaps (2m and 3m).

stable_tour.quote: Considering he's so fragile it was amazing he stood so much racing last season. As he'd been off the best part of two years he was understandably green, but we eventually found a winning opening at Wincanton. Following a wind op he'll have one run in a handicap hurdle, then we might try chasing. 04-11-24

runners.name: Lyrical Genius

prev_owners.owner: The Boundary Stables Partnership ( C Barber)

runners.comment: Beat just two other finishers for breakthrough win as a chaser at Fakenham two months ago
runners.spotlight: Jumping left was no great hardship around Fakenham two months ago and he beat two other finishers to register his first success as a chaser (1-16); only 3lb higher but promoted to a Class 4 this time.

quotes.race: Cadbury Flake 99 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lyrical Genius is a lovely youngster. He'll be a three-mile chaser and he's a lovely horse to have but we will not push hard this season. He'll probably step up to three miles at some stage - Charlie Longsdon, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Dreamland Bedding Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've made no bones to the boys that I've always liked Lyrical Genius. He's not a bumper horse and we'll probably go hurdling now. I've always liked him, he's got a lovely attitude and as he's only four we won't be rushing him - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came to us having won a point-to-point last April and has done nothing but please me. He won his first start in a Warwick bumper and followed up with a dogged win on his hurdling debut. He's still very green and showed plenty of that trait at Huntingdon on Boxing Day. He ran at Musselburgh last weekend with cheekpieces but was well beaten again. The reason behind this addition to his tack was because he has been giving himself a harder race than necessary. 09-02-22

4:55.race_name: BetGoodwin Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Aggagio
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Michel Sardou
runners.comment: Capable of running well off this mark but he's not one for maximum faith
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner on Flat and over hurdles; won by a comfortable 3l at Warwick two runs back (2m, good) but rather typically ran below that level at Southwell latest; capable of running well off this mark but he's not one for maximum faith.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: All credit for this goes to Josh (Moore), he was adamant we should come up here with Aggagio today. He gave me my instructions, to pop him out and be very positive on him, and it's worked - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

quotes.race: Royal Sussex Regiment Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't know if there's another race back here for Aggagio. If there was he might come back, but the ground would have to be soft enough. Otherwise, he'll go jumping because his handicap mark is what it is now. He wouldn't want it bottomless over jumps - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Sussex Roof Garden Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: Aggagio is a lovely horse. We didn't know he'd get the trip, but he's done really well. I was a bit worried about the ground if it was soft, which Goshen wants and we don't really. Gary Moore will place him where he wants and Aidan said he might get slightly further - Gary Robinson, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He did a bit of damage when he fell over fences at Plumpton in April. He's had a couple of runs back, including a spin on the Flat, and shaped okay at Wincanton over hurdles a couple of weeks ago. We'll stick over hurdles and, providing we can get his confidence back, he should do okay on slow ground. 29-10-24

runners.name: Hes A Latchico
runners.comment: His third win at Fontwell ten days ago when 7lb lower; in form but unraced here
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner and winning for a third time over hurdles when coming 5l clear at Fontwell (2m1f, good) on his second start after an absence; raised 7lb for that and, although particularly effective at Fontwell, he's unraced here.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip has helped He's A Latchico he hits a flat spot but stayed on well in the straight when I got a nice split - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey.

runners.name: Byzantium
runners.comment: Easy to back when disappointing on handicap debut; should be capable of better
runners.spotlight: 1m5f winner on good ground in France; runner-up in his early hurdle races despite racing freely but he was weak in the betting when fitted with this headgear for handicap debut on Boxing Day and disappointed; connections respected but he returns with questions to answer.

stable_tour.quote: I was glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale as he's a novice hurdle winner waiting to happen, judged on his one run for us at Taunton in March. He's had a wind op and should be ready from the middle of this month. 04-11-24

runners.name: Synchronist
runners.comment: 2lb higher than when a clear second at Sedgefield last time and seems to be improving
runners.spotlight: Went up a harsh-looking 8lb for his rallying win at Southwell (2m, good to soft) but improved again to finish second at Sedgefield where Inferno Sacree was back in fifth; up another 2lb here but seems to be improving.

runners.name: Moonshine Man
runners.comment: Might be on a high mark unless improving for a wind operation
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 11l in his one handicap, after which he was close up in a Southwell maiden (2m, good to soft); might be on a high mark unless improving for a wind operation.

runners.name: Inferno Sacree
runners.comment: Front-runner who has become hard to win with but he does run this track well
runners.spotlight: An exposed front-runner who has become hard to win with but he does run this track well; has each-way claims.

runners.name: Little Soiree
runners.comment: Chance judged on her second here in February and perhaps didn't take to Fakenham last time
runners.spotlight: Came within a head of shedding her maiden status in a C&D handicap (soft) in February, caught only late on after making most; perhaps didn't take to Fakenham last time.

stable_tour.quote: She got beaten a head at Plumpton last week when she got collared on the line by one of Anthony Honeyball's with a 10lb claimer. She made a bad mistake at the last down the back, which probably cost her the race. That was painful but it was good to see her back in form. I want to find her an ideal race, a 0-100 handicap over 2m on better ground, and fingers crossed she should be thereabouts. 26-02-25

runners.name: Public Enemy
runners.comment: The handicapper doesn't appear to have taken any chances but he's an unexposed 4yo
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in France; still very lightly raced; probably didn't have to improve on his Taunton third to make all in a C&D maiden (good) in which the favourite gave himself no chance; the handicapper doesn't appear to have taken any chances but he's an unexposed 4yo with the weight allowance.

runners.name: Dickens
runners.breeder: Chapel Lane Farm L T D
runners.comment: Back from a break to win well at Hexham; raised 7lb and this is a higher grade
runners.spotlight: 9.4f AW winner; granted time after his fall at Uttoxeter in December and returned with a clearcut win at Hexham (2m, good to soft); handicapper hit back with a 7lb rise and this is a higher grade, but respected nonetheless.

stable_tour.quote: He missed last season but he's back working well and is just about ready to start, although he'll probably want a run to take the fizz out of him. He's got a very workable handicap mark over hurdles and I'd like to think he can do some damage off that. 25-10-24

He missed last season but he's back working well and was a promising fifth on his return at Chepstow, a run that should take the fizz out of him. He's got a very workable handicap mark over hurdles and I'd like to think he can do some damage off that. 07-11-24

runners.name: Cusano
runners.comment: Maiden jumper with ability; betting could be informative after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner in France; not beaten far in maiden and handicap company over hurdles at about 2m; had wind surgery since a backward step in a handicap last time (September) and the betting could be informative after a break.

runners.name: Sgian Dubh
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden who was tailed off in a maiden at Fontwell after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who was tailed off in a maiden at Fontwell last month after wind surgery; blinkers worn the last twice are replaced by cheekpieces.

3:10.race_name: Roy Reeve Memorial "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places on Hurdle course (GoingStick: Chase 7.3, Hurdle 6.8) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.00 -13yds, 2.35 +99yds, 3.10 & 4.55 -8yds, 3.45 & 5.35 -11yds and 4.19 +148yds)

runners.name: Norn Iron
runners.comment: Has run three good races in 2m-2m3f handicaps and should be extremely hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Has run three good races in 2m-2m3f handicaps, last time only narrowly failing to justify favouritism in a Class 3 at Newbury (good; fine on softer); a repeat of that will see him extremely hard to beat.

runners.name: Now I Know
runners.comment: Hasn't shown much at all and he refused to race at Wincanton when 80-1
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much at all and he refused to race at Wincanton four weeks ago when 80-1.

runners.name: Roman Roy

prev_owners.owner: The Brooks Family And J Kyle

runners.comment: Hasn't progressed since wind surgery but has ability
runners.spotlight: His best form is when pushing a classy horse close on bumper debut and he was later runner-up in a C&D novice; hasn't improved for wind surgery and was tailed off in an ordinary 2m4f handicap here last time; lots to prove now but this maiden race has no depth to it.

stable_tour.quote: He was tongue-tied for his bumper debut last season, when he ran green but showed promise, and he made a noise when fading next time. So he had corrective surgery on his wind in the spring and that should help now he's novice hurdling. But he was still very green and backward when a close third at Plumpton last month. He'll keep improving with further experience. 04-11-24

runners.name: Start Again
runners.comment: Showed more in bumpers than in points but it was still modest fare; hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Minor form in Irish points but showed more in his two Worcester bumpers, especially first time when runner-up on good ground; that's still modest fare and he'll need to improve to make a winning start over hurdles.

runners.name: Ballyhealy Diamond
runners.comment: Tailed off in all her completed starts and has no form claims
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in all completed starts and has no form claims.

4:15.race_name: Marske Fabrication & Engineering Handicap (Marske Fabrication & Engineering Straight Mile Qual)
4:15.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Rhythm Master
runners.comment: Back to form (well backed) when 2nd at Thirsk recently; 3lb higher but still a key player
runners.spotlight: It's been a long time since his last win but he retains ability and would have gone even closer at Thirsk nine days ago (7f, good; well backed) but for having to wait for a gap at a crucial stage; 3lb rise for that effort asks a tougher question but returning to a mile should be fine and he's one to take seriously.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Handicap
quotes.quote: Rhythm Master has been a bit of a rogue. We had to relieve him of his manhood, we tried the visor today and it made the world of difference - John Dance, owner.

runners.name: Crimson Road
runners.comment: Two 1m2f wins for the Crisfords in 2024; well-beaten 40-1 shot on stable debut; down to 1m
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m2f on fast ground for the Crisfords in 2024; 40-1 and dropped right away on last month's stable debut at Doncaster; needs more back at a mile.

runners.name: Cadarn
runners.comment: Drops in trip for h'cap debut; beaten fav last twice; interesting to see if backers return
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; started out in a bumper in October before going down narrowly at Newcastle (1m2f) on Flat debut a fortnight later; beaten favourite both runs since (1m4f and 1m2f); drops in trip for his handicap debut but he's an exuberant sort and could benefit from it; interesting to see if his backers return.

stable_tour.quote: I've yet to run him on turf, but his work has been pretty good this spring and I hope he's now matured and we'll see the best of him. His form slightly dipped on his last start and I hope we can get him in the winner's circle before long. 07-04-25

runners.name: Barley
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark and shaped as though in need of the run here two weeks ago; contender
runners.spotlight: Not prolific in recent years but 1m on fast ground holds no terrors and he's 2lb lower than for a good third in a big-field Class 2 handicap at York last October; looked as though the run would bring him on when fifth over C&D two weeks ago on his return to action; one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Jeffrey King Memorial Race Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Barley probably needed the run at Doncaster, not from a fitness point of view but to wake him up as he's very laid-back. We got a really soft lead today and were able to dictate. He's a lovely-looking horse and has a good attitude. He'll stay further and be better in a better race, where I think he'd be able to show his full potential - Rob Hornby, jockey.

runners.name: Grabajabba
runners.breeder: North Cheshire Trading And Storage Ltd
runners.comment: Two AW wins in December (7f) and ran well over that trip at Doncaster last month; 1m the ?
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins (7f) in December; well beaten on first two handicap runs (1m, Tapeta) but beaten under one length into third at Doncaster three weeks ago (7f, good); 2lb higher mark to deal with today and still to prove he wants this far.

runners.name: Boy Douglas
runners.comment: Ended 2024 quietly but returns on a good mark as a consequence; one to take seriously
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early last year, winning at Ayr either side of runner-up finishes at Thirsk and York; ended 2024 quietly but he returns to action on a good mark as a consequence; stable won this race in 2013 and 2014.

runners.name: Reidh
runners.comment: Two 7f wins last summer; dangerous mark but it was a low-key return here two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Won second time out last season before going on to win a handicap at the Galway festival (both 7f); stable has had a couple of winners in this race since 2016 but his reappearance effort two weeks ago will need leaving well behind.

runners.name: Yaaser
runners.owner: Michele Craig And David D Smith
runners.comment: No history of going well fresh and looks best watched on his return
runners.spotlight: Capable on his day but he's still 2lb higher than for his last success and he has no history of going well fresh.

quotes.race: Musselburgh Windsor FC Celebrating 70 Years Handicap
quotes.quote: The race didn't set up the way we thought as Joe (Fanning) got to the front and slowed up a bit but Yaaser did it well, he ran as straight as a gun-barrel up the straight. The last time here we probably played too early and we've learnt from that, the more you take him back the more he comes back on the bit. I think you could even play him later as he has a good turn of foot - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Ayr two starts ago and was fourth there on Tuesday in an apprentice race back over a mile. He's off 71 but won off 73 last year, so he's still on a reasonable mark. 02-10-24

3:40.race_name: Flat Is Back On Racing TV Handicap
3:40.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Circe
runners.owner: Pineapple Stud And Miss C Douglas
runners.comment: Promising return to action at Doncaster last month; dropped 1lb and should go well
runners.spotlight: 1m win at Newbury last summer; pleasing return to action when fourth at Doncaster three weeks ago (7f, good) and dropped 1lb since; should remain competitive.

quotes.race: Coopers Marquees EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Circe ran in a quality race at Sandown, she was beaten by two horses with experience. I thought she'd step forward and she has. She's a big horse with plenty of scope and she'll make a nice three-year-old - Sean Levey, jockey.

runners.name: Cruyff Turn
runners.comment: Good run after a break here two weeks ago (1m); three C&D wins on his record; big chance
runners.spotlight: Three of his eight wins have come over C&D; has no great record fresh so it was encouraging that he could run so well over 1m here two weeks ago, his first outing since November; major player back down in trip.

quotes.race: Host & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Cruyff Turn was eliminated from the Buckingham Palace Handicap at Royal Ascot so we came here as he likes the track and good ground. I hope this will give him a bit of confidence and we could aim him at the mile handicap at the Ebor meeting he won two years ago - William Easterby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Clipper Logistics Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We swerved races at Ascot and Goodwood as Cruyff Turn loves fast ground. He's always been a lovely horse, he's a big horse who has just taken time - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's training well and we're very happy with him. He's just as good over seven furlongs and a mile, and he likes good ground and doesn't want it too heavy. 23-04-24

runners.name: Woodstock
runners.comment: Three 7f wins for this yard last year; sharper for last month's return; considered
runners.spotlight: Well suited by 7f on a sound surface last year, his first season with Ruth Carr; may have needed last month's return to action at Doncaster and better is expected with that behind him.

stable_tour.quote: He's a likeable sort of horse and is very straightforward. Formerly with Jack Channon, he ran well first time out for us at Newcastle and then won over 7f at Wolverhampton two weeks ago. There might be more to come from him and he's quite exciting. His form has been on the all-weather but he hasn't had many opportunities on turf. While the weather stays wet we'll probably stick on the all-weather for a bit but then go on the grass when we get a bit of decent ground. 17-04-24

A 7f specialist who won twice at Newbury last year, in July and August. He came from Jack Channon's in March last year and quickly settled in at Mowbray because he won at Wolverhampton after only a month here. He might go back to Newbury on Saturday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Al Muqdad
runners.comment: Made good progress in 7f handicaps last year; may improve again this year; no headgear
runners.spotlight: AW win last March but his form took off on turf in the summer, adding 7f handicaps at Ayr (twice) and Doncaster to his tally in midsummer; ended 2024 with another career-best RPR when second at Ayr (7f, good to firm); likely to progress again this year but he goes without the cheekpieces he wore on his most recent start now back from seven months off.

quotes.race: Kimberly Wyatt @ Scottish Sun Ladies Night Handicap
quotes.quote: They went very hard and I thought the pace was always going to collapse and it helped the closers like me. Al Muqdad has been very consistent and good, quicker ground is probably his thing. Seven furlongs is probably his best trip - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Lerwick
runners.comment: Competitive off this sort of mark on AW; needs to step up on last month's stable debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off similar marks twice this winter when trained by Ed Bethell; weakened in the closing stages on last month's stable debut and he'll need a clear personal best back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: He showed plenty of promise last year in three runs over a mile, finishing second twice. First time out this year at Haydock, he was probably a bit fresh and finished fourth of the 14 runners over a mile, but he's much better than that. I would suggest readers keep on the right side of him as I think he's on a very decent mark. He's fine over a mile but I can see him doing all right over 1m2f. 01-06-23

runners.name: Master Richard
runners.owner: T S Ingham & Mrs Liz Ingham
runners.comment: Down in the weights and had a wind op since last seen; others still look safer though
runners.spotlight: Getting on for two years since the last of his four wins but he ran some good races in the second half of 2024; had a wind op since last seen; down in the weights but others appeal more.

runners.name: The Green Man
runners.comment: On a lowly mark but hopes appear to rest on a wind op/return to 7f sparking a revival
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on 2023 form but he had a quiet year in 2024 and neither run for his new stable has suggested he's ready to strike; the return to 7f and a wind op since last seen will offer encouragement to his potential supporters.

quotes.race: Clean Up With PPS Handicap
quotes.quote: The Green Man did that easily enough and he's in good order with himself, he hasn't moved as well as this in a long time. He's flourishing. He's a big horse and he's just fully maturing - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.name: Project Black
runners.comment: Promising 2yo; absent since two poor runs in spring 2023; gelded; risky after layoff
runners.spotlight: Looked a good prospect as a 2yo, winning a 6f novice here (soft) either side of placed efforts at York and Newcastle; bitterly disappointing in two handicaps in the spring of 2023, after which he was gelded; absent for 713 days but makes his stable debut (same owner) off a reduced mark; betting to guide now tackling 7f for the first time.

runners.name: Livio Milo
runners.comment: Well backed on recent stable debut but struggled in a race not run to suit; can do better
runners.spotlight: 7f winner for Dermot Weld; attracted support on recent stable debut (1m, good) but never featured in a race in which those held up were disadvantaged; up in class today; interesting to see if his backers return.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: LIVIO MILO deserved it, he's very consistent and was second on his last three runs. He probably is better over a mile and that's why the plan was to push on and get first run. He battled hard and got a good ride. He is very versatile and that's his level - Dermot Weld, trainer.

3:05.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Media Mogul
runners.breeder: Forenaghts Stud Farm Ltd & Sam Mencoff
runners.comment: Turf debut; hung badly left when challenging for 1m4f win last time but he's progressing
runners.spotlight: Went close when favourite for a Newcastle handicap last month and went one better with cheekpieces added at Wolverhampton (again 1m4f on AW) three weeks later; makes turf debut over a trip that looks plausible; hung badly left when challenging last time and is now up 4lb but he's progressing.

stable_tour.quote: He's a great big horse who's taken a long time to come to hand and is still very green. He progressed well through the winter and won over 1m4f at Wolverhampton last month in first-time cheekpieces. I hope he can keep winning and I'm sure he'll stay much further in due course. 16-04-25

runners.name: Gastronomy
runners.comment: C&D winner; reappears but has a competitive mark and he started last season well
runners.spotlight: 24 races for two wins (last April and July) and the second of those was from the rear over C&D; off since December but has a competitive mark and usually ran with credit last term, starting the season well.

runners.name: Ribba Hill
runners.comment: Taking fourth in his last two AW handicaps (1m4f/1m6f) this term wasn't that persuasive
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Newcastle last May; consistent rather than progressive and taking fourth in his last two handicaps (1m4f/1m6f) this term wasn't that persuasive; also a bit to prove on this second turf start.

runners.name: Marbuzet
runners.comment: Won at Doncaster (14.5f) last July off this mark; major question to answer first time out
runners.spotlight: 5-33 overall, with last season's win at Doncaster (14.5f) in July off today's mark; ended last term on a low note and there's a major question to be answered today first time out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand little staying horse. He goes on quick ground and progressed well last year. He's tough and the idea is that he could go for the Chester Cup reserve race. 23-04-24

runners.name: Trojan Sun
runners.comment: Might be open to improvement in this second campaign, but 1m6f may be shorter than ideal
runners.spotlight: Won at Musselburgh (2m2f, good) last August in second-time cheekpieces, which was followed by two solid thirds (2m/1m7f); presumably needed the race when last of five on recent return and might be open to improvement in this second campaign, but 1m6f may be shorter than ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Musselburgh over 2m2f in late August and has finished third the last twice- at Chester and Ayr on Tuesday. He's probably going to have another couple of runs this autumn as he seems to handle soft ground. He's a young horse who's improving. He ran on good ground at Ayr on Tuesday and it would be good if we can get another run with him on soft ground before the end of the season. I doubt we'll run him on the all-weather this winter and we'll probably wait until next year with him. 02-10-24

1:25.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Romieu
runners.comment: Promising in 2 runs on testing ground in France; tongue tied for yard debut; check market
runners.spotlight: Unextended to win a 1m newcomers' maiden at Compiegne last May (heavy; front two pulled a long way clear); gelded afterwards; no match for a useful sort at Chantilly (1m, very soft) in October and sold out of Andre Fabre's stable for 18,000gns in October; faster ground/penalty to contend with on his stable debut and a tongue tie is now fitted; betting instructive.

runners.name: Earthwatch
runners.comment: 88,000gns half-brother to a 6f AW winner out of a 1m1f winner in France; newcomer of note
runners.spotlight: 38,000gns foal, 88,000gns yearling; third foal; half-brother to 6f AW 2yo winner Expeditious (RPR 72); dam French 1m1f AW 2yo winner (78); powerful stable in good form and he's a newcomer of note.

runners.name: Obito
runners.comment: 150,000gns breeze-up 2yo; promising 5th at Newcastle last month; 1m should suit; hood off
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns at the Breeze Ups last April; 14-1 for his Newcastle debut three weeks ago (7f; wore a hood) and kept on steadily for fifth, beaten over 11l at the finish; could take a big step forward with that run behind him and tackling an extra furlong; hood off today.

stable_tour.quote: A big scopey horse who made his debut last month. He tends to be a bit keen, so we rode him cold and he encountered traffic problems. He has the potential to win his maiden and be a decent horse later in the season. 14-04-25

runners.name: Fallons First
runners.comment: 80-1, green and well beaten on her Doncaster debut three weeks ago (7f, good)
runners.spotlight: 80-1, green and well beaten on her Doncaster debut three weeks ago (7f, good); likely one for the longer term.

runners.name: Jenubiyah
runners.comment: Green on Kempton debut in December (7f) but showed some promise; 1m should suit
runners.spotlight: Bare form of her Kempton debut in December (7f) nothing to write home about but she was green and should be suited by the longer trip; Newmarket stable's only runner on the card.

1:55.race_name: Celebrating 60 Years Of Cleveland Mountain Rescue Handicap (Div I)
1:55.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Mrs Trump
runners.owner: R Chapman, G J Daly & R J Parks
runners.comment: 2-2 at Redcar; shaped quite nicely at Pontefract on her return to action; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, two of them at this venue; shaped better than the result on her Pontefract return 13 days ago, losing her position before halfway (hampered) but running on at the finish; drops in grade and should make a bold bid to retain her unbeaten course record.

stable_tour.quote: She's a low-grade filly but is a little angel and could easily have won three of her last four starts. Last winter we didn't know whether to keep her in training for this season. There was probably no-one more surprised than me when she won at Redcar in May. I thought she won at Leicester at the start of the month with a little bit more up her sleeve, and to be fair to her if she'd been drawn in the middle of them at Nottingham last time she'd have won there too. She ended up on the stands' rail and didn't quite get there. I'd like to think she'll progress a little bit more, although at a low level. 28-06-24

runners.name: Garifullina
runners.comment: Two wins, including C&D, last summer; returns on a fair mark but six-month absence a query
runners.spotlight: Won minor handicaps at Catterick and C&D last July; pulled hard over 7f when last seen in October (AW); not handicapped out of things but she was well beaten on last season's reappearance.

runners.name: Lady Of The Garr
runners.comment: Best form at 5f but effective over C&D and running quite well when last seen; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: Stays 6f but her best form, and sole success, came over 5f; returns from an 11-week break but on a feasible mark and she's more appealing than many.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a very unlucky little filly. We love her to bits but she just hasn't had the rub of the green. She was drawn on the wing last week in the race at Redcar that Jamie's Choice won and she always goes right-handed a little bit, so that didn't help. She reared and ducked right at the start, giving away a lot of ground early on. But she caught up to the main pack and beat a few home - she wasn't beaten that far at the line. The time before she had a bad bump at Newcastle at the start and it just scared her a bit, so she was a bit slow coming out. She finished third behind Dc Flyer, beaten only a length, and I think once she gets a bit more luck she'll win a race or two. She was unbelievably close at Catterick in June, getting touched off by Secret Command close home. She may go to Redcar on Saturday. 22-08-24

runners.name: Little Muddy
runners.comment: Best run for some time when midfield at Doncaster last month; down in class; considered
runners.spotlight: Major player on her 2023 form but she went the wrong way last year; there was more encouragement in her midfield finish in a 0-72 handicap at Doncaster three weeks ago (5f, good), however, and she's considered back in these calmer waters.

quotes.race: Groundstaff Appreciation Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Little Muddy had been going well at home. I didn't think she'd be race-fit but she's done it well - Seb Spencer, trainer.

runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.comment: Chance on her AW best and shaped OK after break last time; first realistic chance on turf
runners.spotlight: Successful in a 6f handicap at Southwell in November but that hasn't been a springboard to better things; missed the break and then met trouble in running when ninth at Wolverhampton two weeks ago on her return from 100 days off; still to prove herself on turf but this her first realistic opportunity.

runners.name: Kranjcar
runners.comment: Expensive to follow but return to sprinting may help; not ruled out in a weak race
runners.spotlight: Well supported in his first three starts this year and placed in two of them; given a wind op after finishing third at Wolverhampton in January; didn't stay 1m at Yarmouth 16 days ago; becoming frustrating but could still have a bigger effort in him and this is weak; blinkers back on after one run in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Posh Maisie
runners.comment: Exposed maiden; not beaten far latest (bled from the nose) but not sure to build on it
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden; offered a bit more returned to turf at Catterick 12 days ago (5f, good) but she reportedly bled from the nose; not sure to build on that effort and opposable once more.

runners.name: Ustath
runners.comment: More prolific on AW but ran okay back on turf last time and Tom Marquand a good booking
runners.spotlight: The bulk of his winning has been on AW but he is effective on turf and ran okay over 5f at Catterick 12 days ago; this isn't a strong race and he's not ruled out with Tom Marquand booked.

quotes.race: Follow @thirskraces On Twitter For Ticketing News Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ustath has not shown anything on turf but he ran last week at Catterick over five and wasn't quick enough, so we said that we would put him on a flat track over six and let him bowl. He enjoyed it and dug deeply - Ben Sanderson, jockey.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ustath did it quite well. He bounced out, travelled great and found plenty - Tyler Heard, jockey.

runners.name: Irish Dancer
runners.comment: 16-race maiden; ended 2024 in good form on AW but opposable back from a break
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden; ended 2024 with some good runs at Southwell but others have more persuasive claims today.

runners.name: Birdie Bowers
runners.comment: Looks on the downgrade and the addition of cheekpieces isn't enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Looks on the downgrade and the addition of cheekpieces isn't enough to tempt now returned to turf.

4:50.race_name: Marske Fabrication & Engineering Handicap (Marske Fabrication & Engineeriing Straight Mile Qual)
4:50.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Treble Winners
runners.comment: 3rd here in a 7f maiden; well beaten on handicap debut (soft) last August; cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on handicap debut at Carlisle (7f, soft) last August and off since; however, promising third here (7f, good) in the second of his three maiden races and, with cheekpieces enlisted, he is not ruled out.

runners.name: Mwafaq
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Late foal; this move up to 1m for handicap debut may well make him a more potent force
runners.spotlight: Late foal who ran over 6f twice last autumn, on good to soft/soft; gelded before finishing markedly closer on reappearance at Southwell (5f, AW) 13 days ago, when always behind but it's not hard to think that being moved up to 1m for handicap debut will make him a more potent force.

runners.name: Flamborough Head
runners.comment: Came from second last to first in 11-runner race over C&D (good) two weeks ago; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Third at Newcastle (7f, AW) in his second handicap and he broke the ice when coming from second last to first in 11-runner race over C&D (good) two weeks ago; up 5lb but could have more to offer.

runners.name: Homeland
runners.comment: Probably yet to show his hand, so needs a check on this seasonal/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 12l on all three starts (6f/1m) last July-September; gelded since and he has a useful pedigree; probably yet to show his hand, so needs a check on this seasonal/handicap debut.

runners.name: Triple Double A
runners.comment: Gelded and cheekpieces for this seasonal/handicap debut and he needs a market check
runners.spotlight: He did not beat many in his three qualifying runs over 7f/1m on AW last November/December but there was some late headway when tongue tied last time; gelded since; cheekpieces are also now enlisted for this seasonal/handicap debut and he needs a market check.

runners.name: Groundhog
runners.comment: Still headstrong but made most and hung on well for a close C&D third to Flamborough Head
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort even when hooded on seasonal/handicap debut over C&D (good) two weeks ago but he made most and hung on well for a close third of 11 to Flamborough Head; has an unchanged mark and place claims again but that failure to settle is offputting.

runners.name: Ottoman
runners.comment: Best Irish form gives him a shot; echo of that when fourth to Flamborough Head over C&D
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Ireland last year; best form gives him a shot at this, however, and there was an echo of that when fourth of 11 to Flamborough Head over C&D (16-1; prominent long way) on seasonal debut for new connections; considered.

runners.name: Wondrous Ways
runners.comment: Needs to find extra and steps up from 6f but her dam was a 1m2f winner
runners.spotlight: 5f Catterick win last July in the first of seven handicaps and there have been two close calls since, including in February on penultimate outing; needs to find extra and steps up from 6f but her dam was a 1m2f winner.

runners.name: Hurricane Bea
runners.comment: Nothing solid from his three qualifying races (6f/7f); useful pedigree is more for speed
runners.spotlight: There's nothing solid to latch on to from his three qualifying races (6f/7f) and his useful pedigree is more for speed, but the same owner and trainer's 200-1 winner at Newcastle last Friday ensures that he is not written off on this handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: We got him at the breeze-up sales. He's had only one run, at Redcar, where he missed the break slightly and just needed a bit further. That was over 6f but he's in the 7f Convivial Maiden at York on Friday. 22-08-24

runners.name: I Can Boogy
runners.comment: Won by a head from off pace at Southwell (upped to 1m, AW) 13 days ago, front two clear
runners.spotlight: Improved when second at Newcastle (7f, AW) last month and did so again to win by a head from off the pace in ten-runner race at Southwell (upped to 1m, AW) 13 days ago; the front two drew clear last time and she's far from ruled out by 5lb rise if proving as effective back on turf.

runners.name: Magic Topissima
runners.breeder: E Lemaitre, C Lemaitre & Mme C Lemaitre
runners.comment: One of her better efforts was here last time but not crying out for a drop back from 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Her three handicaps have been this year over 7f, 1m4f and 1m2f; returned to turf here (1m2f, good) last time and it was one of her better efforts in fourth of nine, although not entirely on an even keel (hung left over 1f out) and not crying out for this drop back in trip.

runners.name: Mission In Malton
runners.comment: 6-1 when he reappeared for fourth of ten to I Can Boogy at Southwell (1m) 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Three heavy defeats last summer but just 6-1 when he reappeared for fourth of ten to I Can Boogy on AW/handicap debut at Southwell (1m) 13 days ago, never able to challenge from off pace; might have more to give.

5:30.race_name: Watch Race Replays At racingtv.com Handicap
5:30.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: City Of Strangers
runners.comment: Modest form thus far but no surprise to see her take a step forward on this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices and ran to just a modest level in three qualifying runs; was returning from 204 days off when midfield at Newcastle (7f; stable debut) 11 days ago; betting useful back at 6f for her handicap debut.

runners.name: Perfidia
runners.comment: Better than ever when 2nd at Pontefract last week; major player with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Placed twice as a 2yo, notably when third in a 0-65 at Thirsk last September (6f, good to soft; cheekpieces first time); improved effort when finishing off well for second at Pontefract last week (6f, good; Sanbona back in fourth); solid contender.

runners.name: Mayday Mayday
runners.comment: Not live up to market expectation in 3 AW runs in February/March; visored for h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to market expectation in three AW novice/maiden runs in February and March but did show some ability; makes her handicap debut at a low level and with a visor added; one to consider.

runners.name: Unthinkable
runners.comment: Won Beverley claimer (5f, soft) for G Boughey last May; in and out for new yard afterwards
runners.spotlight: Won a Beverley claimer (5f, soft) for George Boughey last May; generally struggled for this yard afterwards and although she is down in the weights, she carries risk back from five months off.

runners.name: Lady Diesel
runners.comment: Didn't progress for Tom Ward; sold 2,000gns last month; new yard drops her back to 6f
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on her debut effort in four subsequent runs for Tom Ward; bought for 2,000gns last month by new connections and quickly dropped back to 6f; one to note for market confidence.

runners.name: Andalseeyagraham
runners.comment: Sprung 125-1 surprise at Newcastle in December (6f); fair 4th at Southwell one week later
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 125-1 surprise at Newcastle in December (6f), finishing with a flourish; confirmed it wasn't a fluke when a close fourth at Southwell one week later; still has time to do better.

runners.name: Sanbona
runners.comment: Best effort so far when 4th dropped to 6f last week; races off 5lb lower today; big chance
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress as a 2yo and he was well beaten on his reappearance here two weeks ago (1m, good); dropped back to 6f and tried in a visor at Pontefract last week and he showed good speed, having most of the field off the bridle over 2f out; tired in the closing stages, eventually finishing fourth, but it suggested sprinting was his forte and he is able to race off 5lb lower today; solid claims.

runners.name: College Witch
runners.comment: Easy to swerve on the balance of her form
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far at Southwell in February but she finished behind Martha Costello on that occasion and has been well beaten twice since.

runners.name: Hardlass
runners.comment: Well beaten over 7f latest but previous 5f efforts weren't without hope; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Hinted at better in two 5f Tapeta runs to start her 3yo campaign; well beaten upped to 7f last time; tempting mark returned to turf and this could be her trip.

runners.name: Crimson Lad
runners.owner: Steel A Win And Miss J Macey
runners.comment: Attracted support on handicap debut (7f, AW) but finished down the field; blinkers on now
runners.spotlight: Well held in three sprint runs as a 2yo; attracted support on his handicap/AW debut at Newcastle last month (7f) but finished well beaten; blinkers added now back sprinting; interesting to see if his backers return.

runners.name: Martha Costello
runners.comment: Not beaten far on February's handicap debut but that form is nothing special; more needed
runners.spotlight: Consistent rather than progressive so far; not beaten far at Southwell in February on her handicap debut (6f) but that form doesn't look anything special; may do better but such progress is needed.

runners.name: Crackinthunder
runners.comment: Likely improver now making his handicap/turf debut; betting should guide
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three 6f novices at Newcastle in late 2024; not easily recommended on that evidence but the latest effort did offer hope of better at some point; betting to guide now making handicap/turf debut.

runners.name: Fregola
runners.comment: Not easily recommended but her return wasn't too bad and Tom Marquand takes over today
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress as a 2yo and it was just modest form when third of six at Bath on her return 17 days ago; interesting that top yard is persevering with her and Tom Marquand takes over in the saddle today.

runners.name: Arias Dream
runners.comment: 66-1 second at Newcastle in October; absent since poor run the following month; now hooded
runners.spotlight: First signs of promise when a 66-1 second at Newcastle (6f) on her second nursery run; failed to back it up at the same track one month later; hooded for her return to action; risky.

runners.name: Zivas Star
runners.comment: Appeared to show much-improved form at Pontefract last week; has to back it up; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: Showed little on her first four starts but much more to take from last week's Pontefract fifth (6f, good; fillies' novice), racing wide but only losing third late on; likely she'll be getting a hike up the weights for that and she's open to further progress; not ruled out.

runners.name: Diamond Dude
runners.comment: Poor AW form in late 2024; this more suitable but hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three 6f runs at Newcastle in late 2024; more realistic task here but hard to recommend.

2:30.race_name: Celebrating 60 Years Of Cleveland Mountain Rescue Handicap (Div II)
2:30.stalls: Straight course - Stands' side; Round course - Inside

runners.name: Wiggins B
runners.breeder: Gary And Mary West Stables Inc
runners.comment: Makes his handicap debut at a low level and bred to do better at some point; interesting
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous in three runs last year but there was some promise in his latest run at Doncaster (6f, soft) nine months ago; bred to do better at some point and he's a potential improver now handicapping at a low level; interesting, especially if backed.

runners.name: Brian The Snail
runners.owner: The Brian The Snail Racing Club
runners.comment: Better on AW but handicapped accordingly and plugged on for third at Nottingham latest
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is better on AW than turf; that is reflected in his mark though and he was third at Nottingham nine days ago on his return to the grass (5f, good); was going nowhere at halfway there but plugged on late and the return to 6f won't hurt; considered in a weak race.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is an old boy who knows the game. Sometimes he breaks out a bit slow - like he's done today - but he thrives being hung onto and it's paid off - Ryan Kavanagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Handicap
quotes.quote: We got a good tow and Brian The Snail battled all the way to the line. On his day he is very good and proved that tonight - Jack Garrity, jockey

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a horse with a lot of ability, but he only ever does it every now and again. His work at home is better than what he shows in the afternoon, but when he puts his best foot forward he's a nice horse - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Owlerton Greyhound Stadium Sheffield Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail had a wind operation during the winter but his first run back was inconclusive as he didn't handle the track at Epsom. He might get into the Wokingham now - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Westow Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was too bad to be true, Brian The Snail never ran a race - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Anywhere Available Now Handicap
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Brian The Snail is quite chunky so we wanted to get a run into him. I've made no secret, we do like him and there is a race at Ascot on May 3 for three-year-olds for him. We have the Commonwealth Cup in mind - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: catterickbridge.co.uk Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a good horse. I was a bit worried about the trip -  5f on a sharp track like this - but he's done it well. He'll be a sprinter - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Book Your 17th October totepool Package Median Auction Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a grand, laid back horse and it took Tony (Hamilton) a while to pull him up there. He had done everything very easily at home and he had a really good blow so he will come on plenty for that. He is a horse we like a lot and it will be a surprise if he doesn't go on to better things - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Dunnington Lad

prev_owners.owner: Chris Kiely Racing Ltd & J Stokes

runners.comment: Two 5f wins at Ripon last year; behind Stroxx on recent return; something to prove at 6f
runners.spotlight: Two 5f wins at Ripon last season, the second of them off today's mark; never in the hunt behind Stroxx at Catterick on his return 12 days ago; more to prove at 6f.

runners.name: Stroxx
runners.comment: Two 5f wins this year, digging deep at Catterick 12 days ago; more to prove at this trip
runners.spotlight: Took an age to get off the mark but he has won twice over 5f this year, digging deep at Catterick 12 days ago; 2lb rise less of a concern than the return to 6f (first crack at it since March 2023).

runners.name: Tickets
runners.comment: In good form on AW this winter; 10lb lower on turf but with some justification
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in five turf starts; capable sprinter on AW and he's been in good form this year; 10lb lower mark to exploit returned to grass but has too much to prove in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely young horse who runs in the well-known green colours of John Fretwell. He has only raced four times in his life, winning his penultimate start at Kempton. I thought his most recent run, when second in his first handicap was a lovely effort and hopefully we can get him out on the turf before the season ends, but he needs it on the soft side. He will continue through the winter on the all-weather as he is still progressing, and we can up him to 1m when the time is right. He is on a fair mark of 77 and I would be disappointed if he was not a nice bit better than that. 29-08-22

runners.name: Variety Island
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xvi And Partners
runners.comment: Capable at this level but may come on for this first run in 130 days
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but capable at this level and has run well at this track in the past (7f); suspicion he'll come on for this first outing since December though.

runners.name: Fast Flo
runners.comment: Chance if reproducing this year's best but she's an exposed 36-race maiden now
runners.spotlight: Chance if reproducing this year's best but she's now 0-36 and it is easy enough to look elsewhere for win purposes.

runners.name: John Kirkup
runners.comment: Infrequent winner nowadays; well held back on turf nine days ago; new headgear today
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has been an infrequent winner in recent seasons; not at his best on AW this year and no improvement for the return to turf nine days ago; visored for the first time.

quotes.race: Sam Hall Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup was due a win as he's been unlucky all season. He got his ground and he always shows his best - David Thompson, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit goracinginyorkshire.com Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup loves these conditions and it was a good idea to drop him back to five furlongs on this stiff track. He travelled into it well and got the splits at the right time - Connor Beasley, rider.

quotes.race: Tomrods Steel Stockholders Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: John Kirkup could be one for the Two-Year-Old Trophy at Redcar and he's likely to run in another nursery before then. He can go over five or six furlongs but wants give in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Edmundson Cabletech Carlisle Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup got shuffled back and to finish like he has is a fair effort particularly with his penalty. He won't run without a bit of cut in the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In HD Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: John Kirkup ran with the choke out first time at Ayr and we've brought him back to a stiff five furlongs and got him behind horses and he's dropped his head. He's quite a nice horse and has done it nicely on ground he has enjoyed - Michael Dods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another old warrior with a decent wins to runs ratio and he goes particularly well for Connor Beasley. The thing with John is that you can not have the ground soft enough for him. We took a gamble running him at Ayr last month as the rains were forecast, thankfully it arrived and he won for the eighth time. However, last time out at Thirsk it was good ground which is too quick for him. 10-08-21

runners.name: Hyrcanian

prev_owners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd XXXV & E Burke

runners.comment: Poor form for current stable last year; best watched back from a 175-day break
runners.spotlight: Poor form for current stable last year; best watched back from a 175-day break.

runners.name: Miss Rainbow
runners.comment: Exposed maiden; ended 2024 quietly and others bring more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden; ended 2024 quietly and others bring more pressing claims.

stable_tour.quote: She looked good as a two-year-old and she ran brilliantly on her final start last season when second behind the now 74-rated Moyola. However, I think we just bottomed her a bit by running her on heavy going on her first turf race of the season at Catterick in April when she was third behind Shelbourne. Although she ran really well, she's never run the same race since, but now she has chances off 46. She could go to Redcar on Saturday. 22-08-24

3:55.race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap

runners.name: Midnightattheoasis
runners.comment: Has won his last five starts on the AW, the latest when dead-heating with Recon Mission
runners.spotlight: Comes into this in red-hot form having won his last five starts on the AW, the latest when dead-heating with Recon Mission at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) 11 days ago; meets him on the same terms and has winning form over C&D, so hard to rule out despite a 7lb higher mark and rise in grade.

quotes.race: BetUK: It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Rossa [Ryan] has clicked with him and that was an unbelievable ride he gave Midnightattheoasis. I was worried about him going down the hill and that played out in the race, but luckily Rossa switched him inside round the bend and that galvanised him. The drop back to five has worked a treat. He travels very strongly and we ran him a lot over six furlongs but I'll hold my hands up and say that was trainer error. It was more by accident we popped him in at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but we've found the key to him now. He'll still only be off 61 [at Chelmsford next Thursday], and he was rated 70 at one point. We're lucky to have plenty of turnout and he won't have the tack on him until he goes to Chelmsford, which works well for these sprinters - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: Reigning Profit
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who was beaten a nose at Pontefract a week ago; races off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who failed by only a nose when back down to a Class 5 at Pontefract (5f, good) a week ago; races off the same mark and a solid chance of going one better; cheekpieces return.

quotes.race: Ripon Races Ladies Day 22nd June Handicap
quotes.quote: He did it well. Reigning Profit broke very quickly so I travelled strongly through the race and I think he was just getting a little tired near the line - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Future Stars Apprentice Handicap (Round 3)
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit is usually a good eater and he's a solid sprinter so I see no reason why he shouldn't go to Goodwood on Friday - Ruth Carr, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A solid sprinter who had a busy 2024 running 20 times, scoring at Wolverhampton and Hamilton and finishing runner-up four times. A turning track over 5f suits him best. There's a race for him at Pontefract on April 14. 09-04-25

runners.name: Rosenpur
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner at the start of the year and has mainly maintained his form here since
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner at the start of the year and has mainly maintained his form here since, going down by less than a length the last twice; up 1lb but still shouldn't be far away.

runners.name: Aces Wild
runners.comment: Three wins over C&D last year; 2lb above his last winning mark and not easily ruled out
runners.spotlight: Three wins over C&D last year and should appreciate the return here after failing to land a blow at Chelmsford (5f, Polytrack) on Friday; only 2lb above his last winning mark and not easily ruled out.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Aces Wild is a fast little horse and he's lightly raced and those kind of sprinters improve with age. We are hopeful he will keep the ball rolling - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Recon Mission
runners.comment: Dead-heated with Midnightattheoasis at Lingfield 11 days ago; may enjoy run of the race
runners.spotlight: The only one of these without a win over C&D, but managed to end a long losing run when dead-heating with Midnightattheoasis at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) 11 days ago (now 7lb higher but meets him on the same terms); may enjoy the run of the race in front.

quotes.race: Oxshott Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure (if I'd held on) but the second horse just gave me a nudge towards the line and with these older sprinters, it has probably helped me more than anything as he'd just got a little bit lonely in front. He was hanging left towards the stands and I just needed a bit of company towards the line - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Terry Mills Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission has been unlucky in a couple of runs, but the small field suited and he's won here before. He's had a long old season and you can't keep going with these horses, so he won't have too many more races before a break. He'll be back here next year for the Dash - Brian Millen, owner.

quotes.race: Epsom Downs Welcomes Back Owners Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission had run well here previously in the Dash and this was a step on the way back to that race. He'll probably go straight there now. We've run him over six furlongs and tried to hang on to him but he didn't enjoy it as he likes to roll - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Pavers Foundation Catherine Memorial Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission is a very talented horse who likes it in front. The ground is very important for him as he needs a bit of cut. There are options in France and Ireland and he could be one for the Ayr Gold Cup later in the season - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Become A Member At Fairyhouse Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse. There's another nursery for him in a few weeks but the handicapper might be hard enough on him after winning by three lengths. There is also a Listed race over 5f in a few weeks for him as well so we might go for that - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

runners.name: Buraback
runners.comment: Four wins over 5f/6f here and won at Chelmsford last time; not out of it after a 2lb rise
runners.spotlight: Four wins over 5f/6f here and comes into this off the back of a narrow success at Chelmsford (5f, Polytrack); not out of it after a 2lb rise; stable also runs Gustav Graves.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Coral Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked Buraback but he's had issues with the bend here in the past and I told John Egan to get something on his outer this time. He got a nice run up the straight and maybe we'll run him on a straighter track next time - John Best, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to the yard from Jessica Macey and has had just one run for us when down the field at Wolverhampton. He had a few small issues, which we have ironed out, and the plan is to go down the turf route now. Hopefully when he gets on the grass he'll start to find some improvement. 22-03-23

runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.comment: Loves it here, but not sure this race will be run ideally to suit his closing style
runners.spotlight: Loves it here, but is still 4lb higher than when gaining his sixth course success (over this trip) in January and not sure this race will be run ideally to suit his closing style.

3:20.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Court Drive
runners.comment: Little wiggle room off this mark and she'll need the breaks from the outside stall
runners.spotlight: Won on debut last spring (7f here) and followed suit on this year's comeback, when going in easily off 5lb lower at Kempton; there's little wiggle room off this mark and she'll need the breaks from the outside stall under 7lb claimer Andrea Pinna.

stable_tour.quote: She won at 50-1 on her first run at Wolverhampton, over 7f, in early April. I paid very little money for her but I just liked her as she was walking around the paddock. She had a little bit of an ugly right-handed ankle but that didn't bother me as I bought her off my own bat and turned her out for two months. She has very good owners in Premier Racing, who own 60 per cent of her with two of my other owners. They've had five horses with me and they've all won- three of them, including her, won first time out. The thing is that by winning first time out the handicapper will take a dim view of that, so my view, like my dad's, is that you're better off going to a decent fillies' race, so we ran her in a 6f Listed race at Chelmsford last week. 08-05-24

runners.name: Gogo Yubari

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gee's Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Will need to improve on her recent yard debut (over C&D) but this is a bit easier
runners.spotlight: Won five for Dylan Cunha in the early months of last year, latterly round here off a 2lb higher mark; will need to improve on her recent yard debut (over C&D) but this is a bit easier.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We paid five grand for Gogo Yubari at the mares' sale and we've won five races and had two places from ten starts in four months; it's been unreal - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

runners.name: Safanah
runners.comment: Didn't progress last backend; needs to improve if she's to take this back from a break
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress last backend, finishing well held in a couple of handicaps latterly; needs to improve if she's to take this back from four months off.

runners.name: Four Adaay
runners.comment: Down to a career-low mark following a patchy spell but others have stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner these days; is down to a career-low mark following a patchy spell on her preferred Polytrack but others have stronger claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a bit out of sorts but has become very well-handicapped. She was a very unlucky loser last month at Nottingham where she got in a bit of trouble, so she should pick up a few races between now and the end of the season. 11-07-24

runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.comment: Has had her moments at the stalls and there's little room for manoeuvre off this mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in the winter for Jack Doughty, who rides stablemate Gogo Yubari this afternoon; has had her moments at the stalls and there's little room for manoeuvre off this mark.

runners.name: Rogue Dancer
runners.comment: Finished last season on a high; there may well be more to come and she's shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Finished last season on a high, winning tidily off 5lb lower on her Southwell nursery debut; there may well be more to come and she's shortlisted.

runners.name: Psychodrama
runners.comment: Showed the right attitude for her third yard latest; needs more if she's to follow up
runners.spotlight: Failed to win for two previous yards but showed the right attitude, back in the hood, when getting up off a 2lb lower mark at Kempton (favourite Court Drive third); will need a bit more if she's to follow up.

runners.name: Elland Road Girl
runners.comment: Looks to be improving and a 5lb higher mark may well be within range; holds leading claims
runners.spotlight: Did well to finish fourth over C&D last month and built on that when seeing off a subsequent winner at Bath recently (both for Alfie Redman); looks to be improving and a 5lb higher mark may well be within range.

runners.name: Dark Sorceress
runners.comment: Found a weak Chelmsford handicap when going in on her comeback late last month; needs more
runners.spotlight: Had plenty of racing last year and was found a weak Chelmsford handicap when going in on her comeback late last month; will find this more competitive off a 3lb higher mark on her Tapeta debut.

1:35.race_name: Enjoy Spring Evening Racing April-June Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Acceptance
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Ecurie Melaine
runners.comment: 105,000euros yearling; stable has few 2yos go in first time out
runners.spotlight: April foal by Blue Point; 105,000euros yearling; first foal; dam French Listed-placed 1m/8.5f winner (including 2yo/AW; RPR 96), half-sister to French 5f 2yo Listed winner Pursuing The Dream, out of maiden half-sister to Listed winners Femme Fatale (6f) and Foodbroker Fancy (1m2f); stable has few 2yos go in first time out.

runners.name: Coul Jane
runners.comment: 26,000gns yearling; would be a rare winning 2yo newcomer from the yard
runners.spotlight: February foal by Coulsty; 26,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 5f winner (including AW 2yo; RPR 98), half-sister to winners Militry Decoration (7f-1m6f including 2yo) and Boy Charlton (German 6f-7.7f), out of maiden half-sister to US 1m Grade 3 winner Miss Vegas; would be a rare winning 2yo newcomer from the yard.

runners.name: Love Olivia
runners.comment: Stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out including this month; much respected
runners.spotlight: April foal by Havana Grey; 140,000gns yearling; dam unplaced 6f-8.6f AW (RPR 53), closely related to 5f Group 2 winner Stepper Point, half-sister to 5.5f Listed winner Lady In France, out of close relative of smart 5f-7f winner Indian Trail; stable has a fine record with 2yos first time out including so far this month; much respected on debut, especially if attracting support.

runners.name: Redditizio
runners.comment: Stable doesn't have many 2yos go in first time
runners.spotlight: March foal by Profitable; sister to 5f 2yo/6f AW winner Trouble Man (RPR 87), closely related to 6f/7.5f winner Napanook (including 2yo/Spain; 78), half-sister to two winners including Lir Speciale (6f/7f including AW; 100); dam well beaten 5f AW 2yo (30); stable doesn't have many 2yos go in first time.

runners.name: Senorita Vega
runners.comment: Bred to need further and that looked he case when fourth on her Bath debut
runners.spotlight: March foal by Lucky Vega; 28,000euros yearling; has experience on her side, but is bred to appreciate further and that looked to be the case when beaten 6l into fourth of nine on her Bath debut (5f, good to firm; 14-1) this month.

runners.name: Very Mindful
runners.comment: Showed good speed when second on her Kempton debut; going left-handed may help; big player
runners.spotlight: February foal by Havana Gold; 9,000gns foal; 20,000gns yearling; sent off 3-1 and made much of the running when second of six (clear of the third) on her Kempton debut (5f, Polytrack) 12 days ago; hung left there, so going this way around should help and she could take some catching if again ridden positively from the inside stall.

2:10.race_name: Advance Price Midweek Racing For Â£10 Handicap

runners.name: Boasty
runners.comment: Second of 11 in his only previous go over C&D; interesting back up in trip at this level
runners.spotlight: Handy sort; has done most of his winning at Chelmsford, but he does act here (244232172); hasn't had many goes over this far, but finished second of 11 in his only previous attempt over C&D; interesting back up in trip at this level.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a consistent type who is always in the firing line but only has two wins to show for his efforts. He joined me in March this year and after finishing second first time out he won nicely at Chelmsford by three lengths. That saw him raised 8lb which has been hard for him, but he has since run a second and two thirds. He never runs a bad race, but there is no doubt he is better on the all-weather. Looking at his runs this term he has not enjoyed too much luck with draws. We will keep him going over the winter months, particularly at Lingfield and Chelmsford where he enjoys the bends. There is more to come. 29-08-22

runners.name: Moon Over The Sea
runners.comment: Five-time course winner; this is probably his best trip and he should go well
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner including in a slowly run contest over 1m6f last month, but didn't get home when sixth of seven over the same distance here on Saturday; this is probably his best trip, though, and he may fare better if turning out again.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: There was no real pace on paper beforehand. I wasn't going quick where I was but if I'd been going any quicker I'd have taken Moon Over The Sea out of his comfort zone. He's seen the trip out well - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pysanka
runners.breeder: Sarl Baileys Haras Des Trois Chapelles
runners.comment: All four wins have come over C&D, but again underperformed here last month; best watched
runners.spotlight: All four wins have come over C&D, but despite having dropped to his last winning mark he again underperformed here last month; best watched for now; stable also runs Starfighter.

runners.name: Bella Veneta
runners.comment: Consistent in handicaps since last summer, but still to really prove her stamina
runners.spotlight: Missed the whole of 2023 but has been consistent in handicaps since last summer; didn't enjoy a clear run when third of six over C&D last month, but was still well held and that didn't really prove her stamina.

runners.name: Starfighter
runners.comment: Five wins here, four over this trip; may well get the true pace he needs; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Five wins here, four over this trip the latest of which was in January; still in a feasible mark and may well get the true pace he needs; one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter has been a slow burner since he joined us from Ed Walker's and it's just taken a bit of time to get him right. He was rated higher a few years back so hopefully there's bit more improvement there and he'll go on the turf - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Lester Brunt Wealth Management Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter deserved that he had been frustrating really. He has never really done much wrong, maybe he had been hitting the front a bit early or not quite getting home. Today he went through to the line and there was no doubting his temperament. He could step forward now - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Mohave Dancer
runners.comment: 0-7; plenty to prove upped in trip on stable/Tapeta debut after eight months off
runners.spotlight: Second of 12 on her second start for Charlie Fellowes at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) in November 2023, but showed nothing in five outings after reappearing a year ago; changed hands for 15,000gns in October and has plenty to prove upped in trip on stable/Tapeta debut after eight months off.

runners.name: Sea Of Charm

prev_owners.owner: The Turf Club & Mrs Harry Dunlop

runners.comment: 3-48, though two of her wins have come over C&D; no great surprise if she makes the frame
runners.spotlight: Just 3-48, though two of her wins have come over C&D, the latest last September; only 2lb higher and no great surprise if she makes the frame at least.

runners.name: Nevendon
runners.comment: 0-15 on the Flat and has a bit to prove after five months off
runners.spotlight: Mainly seen over fences last summer and is 0-15 on the Flat, though he did finish second of six here (1m6f) in October; has a bit to prove after five months off, though.

runners.name: Prince Hector
runners.comment: Prominent racer whose three wins have all come here; could go well if able to dominate
runners.spotlight: Prominent-racer whose three wins have all come here, the latest in a 0-50 classified event over this trip last month; didn't stay 1m6f back here a week later and should appreciate the return to this trip; could go well especially if able to dominate.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Prince Hector, he's taken a bit of getting to know but hopefully we can now keep his head in front - Jessica Bedi, trainer.

runners.name: Two Plus Two
runners.comment: Likes it here but is 1-24 and not straightforward; could go well again without winning
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m6f) and runner-up in three of his last four starts here, but he is 1-24 and not straightforward; could go well again without winning.

runners.name: Billy Bathgate
runners.comment: Needs further than this now; record of 1-40 under rules is another reason to be cautious
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a favourable mark, but he probably needs further than this now and his record of 1-40 under rules is another reason to be cautious.

runners.name: Walk The Moon
runners.comment: In the frame in four of his five starts over C&D this year, but is now 0-25
runners.spotlight: In the frame in four of his five starts over C&D this year, but is now 0-25 under rules; look elsewhere.

4:30.race_name: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Bold Suitor

prev_owners.owner: N T Heung Yee Kuk Syndicate

runners.comment: First and second over C&D in last two starts; better drawn than last time; major player
runners.spotlight: In good form since returning from 135 days off last month, finishing first (beating Ravenglass by a neck) and second over C&D in his last two starts; up another 2lb, but is much better drawn than last time and looks a major player.

runners.name: Monsieur Fantaisie

prev_owners.owner: Phil Hart And The Cross Racing Club

runners.comment: Won over 6f here last month; no problem with the return to this trip; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Won an amateur riders' event over 6f here last month and again ran well when fourth of 17 at Thirsk (6f, good) nine days ago; no problem with the return to this trip and holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Ravenglass
runners.comment: First and second over C&D last month, but disappointing over 8.6f last time; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Landed a 0-50 classified event over C&D last month and ran Bold Suitor close in a handicap over the same trip a week later; bit disappointing over 8.6f here last time (has won over that trip) and drawn wider than ideal.

runners.name: Fistral Beach
runners.comment: In good form on Tapeta elsewhere lately; drawn a bit wider than ideal but still considered
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in both previous starts over C&D, but in good form over this trip on Tapeta elsewhere lately, winning at Southwell and Newcastle last month; drawn a bit wider than ideal but still considered in current form.

runners.name: Mudlahhim
runners.comment: Two of his four wins have come over C&D, but current losing run is up to 17
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come over C&D, but current losing run is up to 17; likely find one or two too good again.

runners.name: Sams Hope
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.comment: 1-17; unfortunate not to finish closer at Southwell last time but others more convincing
runners.spotlight: Not for the first time, looked unfortunate not to finish closer at Southwell (7f, Tapeta; first-time visor) last time and has dropped 5lb lower than for her sole success in 17 starts; others are more convincing, though.

runners.name: American Star
runners.owner: Old Gilroyders And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: 15lb below last winning mark, but not running well enough to suggest can take advantage
runners.spotlight: Has dropped 15lb lower than when winning at Chester (7f, good to soft) last summer, but latest efforts raise serious doubts as to whether he can take advantage.

stable_tour.quote: Not much has gone right for him since he won at Chester in July of last year, but at least that means he's well handicapped. Ideally he wants a bit of give and a turning seven furlongs. He runs at Catterick on Wednesday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Coconut Bay
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner, but finished well behind a couple of these in a handicap here last month
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, the latest in a 0-50 classified event in February; has run well on turf the last twice, but finished well behind a couple of these in a handicap here last month.

runners.name: Outreach
runners.comment: All three wins have come over C&D; should appreciate the return here, but is drawn widest
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come over C&D, as when making making all and just holding on in a 0-50 classified event in February; should appreciate the return here but the draw hasn't been kind.

runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.comment: C&D winner, but losing run is up to 26 and he will need plenty of luck from stall 11
runners.spotlight: C&D winner, but losing run is up to 26 and he will need plenty of luck from stall 11.

runners.name: Blue Jay Way
runners.comment: Is now 0-17 and makes limited appeal
