runners.spotlight: Only beaten just over 2l into sixth of ten on his return from 142 days off here (8.6f) last month, but is now 0-17 and makes limited appeal.

runners.name: Marisitta
runners.comment: Has finished out of the frame in all 12 outings; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since the start of last year and has finished out of the frame in all 12 outings; look elsewhere.

2:45.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap

runners.name: Lady Mary
runners.breeder: Oakleaf Farm, Liz Wilson & Norman Wilson
runners.comment: Unexposed filly and she's a possible improver upped in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field in three novice/maiden events (7f, AW) but this is more realistic on handicap debut and she's a possible improver upped in trip; needs watching in market.

runners.name: What A Nation
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but he needs improvement back up in trip after a break
runners.spotlight: Well held in three qualifying runs at up to 1m2f, most recently when fifth of seventh at Lingfield (1m, AW) in January; gelded since and now goes handicapping but he needs improvement back up in trip after a break.

runners.name: Calibos

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: Five-race maiden who has not finished closer than 6l to a winner; needs more at new trip
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has not finished closer than 6l to a winner including in two handicaps; looks worth a try at this new trip but he needs to significantly raise his game on second run for current yard; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Synergism
runners.comment: Well-bred gelding and he could show a lot more now upped in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to winners Scoubidou (Italian 1m 2yo Group 3) and Sommelier (German 1m6f Listed); no show at huge odds in three runs (6f/7f) in October but he's been gelded since and could look a different proposition now upped in trip on handicap debut; interesting contender for notable yard.

runners.name: Sweet Cicely
runners.comment: 0-10 but was a close third at Newcastle latest and she's respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent ten-race maiden but she's dropped down the weights and was a close third of six in a Newcastle handicap (1m, Tapeta; first-time cheekpieces) last month; kept on well in that race and she's respected back up in trip.

runners.name: Captious Cantor
runners.comment: Well held in first three runs but she's open to progress now switched to a minor handicap
runners.spotlight: Big prices and was beaten around 12l in three runs (1m/8.6f) during the winter but this is more realistic and she's open to progress now handicapping off a lowly mark; one to keep an eye on back from 114 days off.

runners.name: Electric Bass
runners.comment: Progressive in his qualifying runs and he needs a close look on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of his three qualifying runs, most recently when a 5l third of seven at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) in January; looks on fair mark now switched to a handicap and he should have more to offer on this step up in trip; in the mix.

runners.name: Ballarat Bertie
runners.comment: C&D win on penultimate run and he could resume his progress back at this track; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the eighth attempt when landing a C&D handicap last month; never involved in follow-up bid at Southwell but the drop back to 1m looked against him and he could resume his progress back over this trip; dangerous.

runners.name: I Cant Believe
runners.comment: Did well here at the start of the year and should appreciate the return of the visor
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over 8.6f here in January and placed in both goes over C&D in the meantime; the switch to blinkers didn't have a positive effect last time but the return of a visor looks a positive; high on list.

runners.name: Strategic Fortune
runners.comment: All four AW wins have come over C&D including last time; outside stall makes things tricky
runners.spotlight: All four AW wins have come over C&D including when ending a 16-race losing run in returning cheekpieces a fortnight ago; 2lb rise not excessive but the outside stall makes things tricky.

quotes.race: CorkRacecourse.ie Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Strategic Fortune was on his last chance today because he's been disappointing but he has ability. The little ease in the ground seemed to help him. He's often slow out of the stalls but the blinkers we fitted him with at Dundalk last week seemed to sharpen him up a bit. He didn't seem to handle it there at all and broke slow here again but it seemed to help because they went hard up front. Over 7f here on that ground it takes a bit of getting and it just seemed to fall apart. I mostly pre-train and break yearlings, I don't have that many runners for the track - John O'Shea, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has been with us for just over a year and has done well. He managed to win back-to-back 1m1Â½f races at Wolverhampton in the spring and has been enjoying a summer break ahead of a winter campaign. He loves Wolverhampton but that's down to the trip of 1m1Â½f they race over. Few places have races over that distance and it's spot on for him. I expect him to add to his wins in the new all-weather season. 23-09-22

runners.name: City Escape
runners.comment: Consistent around here this year (3311244); capable of playing a part granted a solid pace
runners.spotlight: Consistent around here so far this year (3311244), the two wins making it five over C&D overall; just 2lb above her last winning mark and capable of playing a part if there's a solid pace.

runners.name: Life On The Rocks
runners.comment: Placed in last three starts and still 11lb below his last winning mark; should go well
runners.spotlight: 0-15 on the AW, but having dropped 12lb below his last winning mark he has been placed in his last three starts, including when second of 19 at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) last time; back up 1lb but should go well again.

runners.name: Star Delta
runners.comment: 0-5 and returns from eight months off; half-brother to two AW winners; watch market
runners.spotlight: Not within 7l of the winner in five starts over 7f-1m2f on turf last year; returns from eight months off having been gelded but he is a half-brother to two AW winners; interesting to see if there is money for him.

runners.name: River Alwen
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in November and a fair fourth over C&D a fortnight ago; frame material
runners.spotlight: Nothing like as good as he was but showed he could do it at the right level when successful at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) in November; fair fourth of ten (just behind Port Noir) over C&D recently; could make the frame.

quotes.race: Better Odds On Betfair Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: River Alwen did well. He benefited from Newbury, he needed that run and was a bit fresh. He was dropped 2lb for that and this was a winnable race. I think ten furlongs is his trip but he will get more adaptable to middle-distances as he goes along. He should progress and improve again - Jamie Spencer, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice colt who ran a good race behind Fancy Man in the Listed Ascendant Stakes at Haydock in September. He is set to run at Newbury (3.25) on Friday. I've got a lot of time for him and he could step into Group company down the line but there are a lot of good handicaps he could be aimed at beforehand 16-04-21

runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.comment: Has won three times this year including over C&D last time; one of the more likely winners
runners.spotlight: Not the most consistent but has won three times this year including in a first-time visor over C&D this month; 5lb higher and could have been better drawn but still one of the more likely winners.

runners.name: Desiderata
runners.comment: Sole win came over C&D and he ran well here last time, but he has refused to race; risky
runners.spotlight: Landed a 0-50 classified event over C&D (66-1) in January and finished third of ten behind Strategic Fortune in a handicap here a fortnight ago; starts have been an issue, though, and he refused to race at all on his penultimate outing; risky.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's Desiderata's first run for us. We worked him up in Lambourn in the week and he went very well with a 60-rated horse so we expected him to run a nice race - Thomas Faulkner, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Heretic

prev_owners.owner: Highclere Tbred Racing, C Fahy & Partner

runners.comment: 11lb lower than for his successful handicap debut early in 2023 but has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Has given the impression he can exploit his falling mark, 11lb lower than for his successful handicap debut at the start of 2023; has to prove his stamina over this far, though.

runners.name: Port Noir
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Six-time winner here; losing run now 12 but in the frame ten times; shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner over 6f-9.5f here; losing run up to 12 but in the frame in ten of those and shouldn't be far away again.

runners.name: Tarjamah
runners.comment: Made a winning debut here as a 2yo but has shown precious little since; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Sole win came here (8.6f) for the Gosdens as a 2yo but has shown precious little in 11 starts since then including twice for this yard since returning in February; look elsewhere.

5:05.race_name: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Galel
runners.comment: 0-9, but is 1lb lower than when beaten a head over C&D in November; interesting
runners.spotlight: 0-9 and well held in both starts over 6f on Tapeta this year, but is 1lb lower than when beaten a head over C&D in November; interesting, especially if backed.

runners.name: River Wharfe
runners.comment: Won off 2lb lower over C&D in January; could make an impact if getting a good pace
runners.spotlight: A bit in and out since winning off 2lb lower over C&D in January and the fitting of a visor (retained) made little difference last time; could make an impact if getting a good pace to aim at, though.

stable_tour.quote: He holds entries at Brighton in two classified events - the 0-50 mile event on Wednesday and the 0-50 7f contest on Thursday. He's run at Brighton three times this season with one win, a third and a fourth, so hopefully he can go well again. 07-08-24

runners.name: Heerathetrack
runners.comment: Very best form has come on Polytrack and he has it all to do from the widest stall.
runners.spotlight: Has run well over C&D, but his very best form has come on Polytrack and he has it all to do from the widest stall.

runners.name: Till It Shines

prev_owners.owner: Ms Caroline Instone & J S Moore

runners.comment: Won over C&D last month and badly drawn when well beaten a week later; could go well
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 12th attempt in a 0-50 classified event over C&D last month and his heavy defeat in a handicap back here a week later can be forgiven on account of the draw; better berthed this time and could go well.

stable_tour.quote: She's just lost her way a little bit at the minute. We gave her a little bit of a break. She's a big, strong filly. She has a nice page and she'll run probably in about a month's time. She has a little bit about her and we're treating her the right way because she still could be anything. I don't think she stayed at Brighton and I think she needs to come back in trip. The trip just found her out the last day but she'll have no problem winning. 04-07-24

runners.name: Match Anthem
runners.comment: Most consistent since November (114223324); his reliability counts for plenty
runners.spotlight: Most consistent since November (114223324) with his record over C&D in the same period reading 122; still 3lb above his last winning mark, but his reliability counts for plenty in this field; respected.

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: 3-49 though has won over C&D; 13lb below his last winning mark but opposable from his draw
runners.spotlight: Far from solid with a record of 3-49 albeit one of his wins came over C&D; 13lb below his last winning mark and has run well on turf the last twice, but still looks opposable from his draw.

runners.name: Letter Of The Law
runners.comment: 0-14 on the AW and failed to beat a rival over C&D five weeks ago; passed over
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner on turf, but 0-14 on the AW and failed to beat a rival over C&D five weeks ago; passed over.

runners.name: Lincolns Inn
runners.comment: 0-7 and looks on the downgrade, failing to beat a rival at Southwell last time
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and looks on the downgrade, failing to beat a rival on her return from another 138 days off at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) this month.

runners.name: Diamond Cottage
runners.comment: Returns to the AW for the first time since September 2023; off seven months; best watched
runners.spotlight: Returns to the AW (0-11) for the first time since September 2023 and has been off seven months; best watched.

runners.name: Stoic Syd
runners.comment: Still 4lb below his last winning mark, but another furlong may have been preferable
runners.spotlight: Won twice at around 1m on the AW early last year and, having dropped 4lb below his last winning mark, finished third of ten here (8.6f) last month; another furlong may have been preferable, though.

runners.name: Balmy Breese
runners.comment: In the frame in classified events, but well held back in  handicaps this month; now 0-28
runners.spotlight: Has run well in 0-50 classified events over 6f/7f here this year, but well held in two Southwell handicaps this month, the latest over 7f on Sunday; now 0-28.

runners.name: Red Walls
runners.comment: Five wins over 5f/6f here, but this trip and his wide draw make him hard to enthuse over
runners.spotlight: Five wins over 5f/6f here, but this trip and his wide draw make him hard to enthuse over.

5:00.race_name: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)

runners.name: Better Days Ahead
runners.comment: Third in the Brown Advisory, big burden for a novice, rider's 7lb claim a major asset
runners.spotlight: Won the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham last year, then third to Dancing City in 3m Grade 1 at Punchestown; 2-4 over fences, including Grade 2 at Navan over 3m on soft to heavy, when jumped notably well; on better ground, failed to confirm form with Stellar Story when third in the Brown Advisory; big burden for a novice, rider's 7lb claim a major asset.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Better Days Ahead wasn't doing a stroke in front. It wasn't ideal, he needs something to make it. He goes for the Brown Advisory - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Post Long Distance Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Better Days Ahead didn't lose much in defeat, probably more of a test will suit him. He was up just after the line. Even when he won the Martin Pipe in Cheltenham he looked like a real stayer. As he's named, there will be Better Days Ahead - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Race And Stay Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Better Days Ahead is entered in the Drinmore though that might just come a bit too soon. We will look at something probably around Christmas. He is a Martin Pipe winner and it is a race that good horses come out of - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Turning in I still had a bit to do. I knew going out Better Days Ahead would love the ground, and he's a lovely chaser to look forward to next year. He's just a big galloper, and at the back of the last when he met the hill, he found another leg. It was very messy down at the start, but I got a nice start and a good position, and I was probably just going a gear faster than I wanted to. I was switching out and switching in, and I got a lovely run up the rail turning in - thankfully it worked out. He's a fine, big horse and he loves that ground. He gallops for fun - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Better Days Ahead jumped great today and it was a good confidence booster after the last day. He would probably have to step up to one of those good staying novice hurdles now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I think the Brown Advisory is made for him. I've been thinking that all season. He's going to love that uphill climb to the line, just like he did last year in the Martin Pipe, and all he wants is something to aim at. He was left in the lead a long way from home when winning narrowly at Navan last time and he wasn't doing a stroke in front. He'll be a different horse when he gets something to aim at. 19-2-25

runners.name: Quai De Bourbon
runners.comment: Sole chase win over 2m4f, has suffered mishaps at Cheltenham and Aintree, not ideal prep
runners.spotlight: Third to Better Days Ahead in last season's Martin Pipe; 2m4f chase winner at Gowran Park in January; didn't get the chance to prove he stays 3m in the Brown Advisory at Cheltenham, made a bad mistake and unseated rider four out; making progress when brought down four out in the Mildmay at Aintree.

quotes.race: Munster Hurdle
quotes.quote: Quai De Bourbon is a good jumper but the hurdles are a bit small for him. It turned into a bit of a staying race on the testing ground. He is going to be a stayer - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: ALTO EQUINE Building Solutions Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Quai De Bourbon lacked a bit of concentration, when I gave him a slap and left him on to the last it was the best hurdle he jumped. He's a staying type - Paul Townend, rider

stable_tour.quote: This chap looks really nice. He won three out of four for us last season and the only time he was beaten was in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham. He was a real surprise package. I'm looking forward to getting him out over fences and he'll hopefully develop into a nice staying novice chaser. 25-11-24

runners.name: Johnnywho
runners.comment: Possibly in front too long when touched off by Daily Present in the Kim Muir, good chance
runners.spotlight: Chase debut win in three-runner novice at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft) in October; then campaigned in Graded races prior to handicap debut in the Kim Muir; travelled powerfully to lead nearing two out, perhaps much sooner than Derek O'Connor would have liked; lost out to Daily Present then but can be rated a strong contender.

quotes.race: Fulke Walwyn Kim Muir Challenge Cup Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Spon By Thames Materials) (GBB)
quotes.quote: You're always disappointed not to win but Johnnywho ran very well. He pulled two shoes off, which might not have helped, but that's the way it goes - Jonjo O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Lakes Estates Property Sales And Lettings Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Johnnywho warmed up to the task nicely. I think over two and a half [miles], he'd probably appreciate a bit slower ground. He'll hopefully have plenty of options - Jonjo O'Neill Jr, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Beaumont Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Johnnywho is a nice horse, he's done everything right so far. The second and third are probably decent yardsticks and it was a nice way to go about it - Jonjo O'Neill Jr, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in some hot races over hurdles last year and that experience will have done him well. He had a good summer and we always felt he was going to be a chaser. He was very good on his debut over fences at Carlisle and did exactly what we were hoping for. He jumped very well and travelled nicely, so we couldn't have been happier. There's a three-mile Listed novice chase at Cheltenham in a couple of weeks to consider, but if that comes too soon the John Francome over two and a half miles at Newbury at the end of the month is an option. He's come out of Carlisle fine and is an exciting prospect. 06-11-24

runners.name: Bioluminescence
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner at Limerick in December, has confirmed a high standard in smart company
runners.spotlight: Dominant winner of a 2m6f Grade 2 mares' novice at Limerick at Christmas; a month later finished a clear second behind Dancing City in 3m1f Grade 3 at Naas; another solid run behind the useful Spindleberry here last time; riding plans imply a high rank in stable estimation.

quotes.race: McMahons Builders Providers Irish EBF Dawn Run Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence's jumping is unbelievable. She's a big mare with a huge jump to match ? it's her forte. A trip on soft ground is her ideal. I rode her in her point-to-point and she was flawless that day, too. Gavin [Cromwell] has trained her exceptionally well, winning a Grade 3 over hurdles and now a Grade 2 over fences. It's a fair step to go into a Grade 2 first time over fences. She's a ferocious galloper, stayer and jumper and because she's so big, there's a little bit left there - Derek O'Connor, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Shannon Spray Mares Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence is a fine, big mare with lots to like about her. I was a bit anxious to try to get her rolling in the straight and she had two good jumps at the last two. By the look of her chasing will be her game - Simon Torrens, rider.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence is a galloper. She ploughed through that ground and is a three-mile chaser in the making - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big mare who has won two over hurdles, including a Grade 3 at Limerick. She's going chasing now and we're happy with her, but she won't start off until we have proper soft ground. 12-11-24
A lovely, big mare who won two over hurdles, including a Grade 3 at Limerick. She's going chasing now and we're happy with her, but she won't start off until we have proper soft ground. 13-11-24

runners.name: Harry Des Ongrais
runners.breeder: M Marc Trincot & Mme Odile Trincot
runners.owner: K Haughey & Laura Haughey & Kieran T Byrne
runners.comment: Has run only three times over fences, won over 2m4f at Gowran, possible stamina issues
runners.spotlight: Smart novice hurdler two seasons ago; has run only three times over fences and probably needed his first run back after a long absence; won over 2m4f at Gowran before outstayed behind Fun Fun Fun in 3m Grade 3 at Limerick; possible stamina issues.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: We had hoped Harry Des Ongrais would run well. He ran well at Fairyhouse and two miles is probably a bit sharp so the step up in trip suited him. He saw it out well and Rachael said he jumps brilliant. You have to have three runs for a handicap so we'll have to see - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good the other day at Wexford. He won nicely there and we'll be on the lookout for a novice handicap hurdle for him somewhere now. 14-11-22

runners.name: Duffle Coat
runners.comment: Unseated early in Grand National, suited by good ground, likely to find this too testing
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Galway Plate last July; sole chase win (from 14 attempts) was the Mayo National at Ballinrobe last May; running a big race when brought down two out in the 3m6f NH Chase at Cheltenham last month; unseated at the third in the Grand National; suited by good ground, likely to find this going too testing.

quotes.race: McHale Mayo National Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Duffle Coat has finished second a lot lately, so it's great for him to win a big pot. I've been reeled in on him before when I've sent him for home, so I waited as long as I could and the better ground helped him to see it out well this time - Sam Ewing, jockey.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was flat to the boards the whole way. To be fair Duffle Coat is really tenacious and a little terrier. From the top of the hill I gave him a little squeeze and he picked up underneath me. I wasn't overly concerned as I thought we had gone quick on genuine soft ground. His stamina is his forte - Robbie Power, jockey.

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3YO Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jack said it turned into a bit of a sprint and it didn't suit him. A faster gallop would have suited him. He won well at the line and he keeps winning so that's all that matters. There's a winners' of two at Down Royal and Punchestown and there's a Listed race at Wetherby as well - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Sanctuary Synthetics 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffle Coat had never been on grass and it's the first time he has worked properly. He was good. He has to be smart because he had nothing done. Keith said he'll improve stones - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He was just touched off in the Galway Plate and won the Mayo National before that. He revels in those big-field handicap chasers. 28-10-24

runners.name: Favori De Champdou
runners.comment: Placed in the Thyestes at Gowran and National Trial at Punchestown, very soft ground suits
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins last season came in Graded novices at Punchestown and Limerick on testing ground; solid form in competitive handicaps this term, notably third in both Thyestes at Gowran and 3m3f National Trial at Punchestown; took advantage of drop in class when landing a three-runner Down Royal conditions event five weeks ago; first-time blinkers.

quotes.race: Liam & Valerie Brennan Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou came on from the last day and we knew he had, but I thought that would be tougher. Jack said he stayed very well and jumped brilliant. It was a hot enough race and he's a nice horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Lyons Of Limerick Jaguar Land Rover Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou did it well. Jordan was happy the whole way. He jumped well and handled the ground and didn't do a whole lot in front. He's going the right way - Ian Amond, travelling head groom.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Favori De Champdou did everything right and Jack gave him a grand ride. He looked big in the ring but he jumped great. I would imagine he'll go chasing straight away after missing a year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be aimed at the big staying handicap chases and hopefully one might fall his way. He stays, jumps well and handles cut in the ground. His first few runs always seem to be better than his last few so maybe the first half of the season is the time to catch him. 28-10-24

runners.name: Search For Glory
runners.comment: Beat Sa Majeste at Galway last October, needs to jump better than at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Began his chasing career brightly with a defeat of Sa Majeste at Galway last October and ran well in small-field Graded races; disappointing on handicap debut at Leopardstown (2m5f, yielding) in February; needs to jump better than when beaten 20l in seventh in the Ultima at Cheltenham.

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Search For Glory did it well in the end, he just didn't enjoy being in front. He probably showed more gears than he every showed there - Jack Kennedy, rider

stable_tour.quote: You couldn't not be thrilled with the way he won his beginners' chase at Galway on Sunday. That has been a good race over the years and it looked a hot enough heat again this year. He hit the line really well and the further he went, the better he looked. The National Hunt Chase would look a nice fit for him. 28-10-24

runners.name: Sequestered
runners.comment: Good mid-winter form at Leopardstown, no impact in the Ultima at Cheltenham, up against it
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of 3m handicap chase at Leopardstown in December; ran well off revised mark when second  over 2m5f at same track at DRF; failed to make any impression in the Ultima at Cheltenham; up against it.

quotes.race: Ann Walsh Memorial Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sequestered did him a little favour by bringing him out to the better ground. I though the holding ground was the only thing that might beat him. He's a good horse and he will go for a novice hurdle at Cheltenham next month - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

runners.name: Desertmore House
runners.owner: O B P Carroll & Anthony Vaughan
runners.comment: No further success since winning the 2023 Kerry National, makes little appeal
runners.spotlight: No further success since winning the 2023 Kerry National; pulled up in his repeat bid last September; best run this season when third off his lower hurdles mark at Punchestown in November; makes little appeal.

quotes.race: Guinness Kerry National Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ricky gave him a fantastic ride. He was always in a good position, knowing that Desertmore House would not quicken for you in a hurry but stays very well. His jumping is very sound for a novice and it couldn't have gone any better. He's a lovely horse. He was bought originally by John Reddington for him to ride in bumpers, and John had a couple of great spins on him. But I always felt he would be at his best when he started going further and jumping fences. The Grand National might well end up being the long-term aim for him, we would have to start thinking about those sorts of races. I ran him in this for the experience, hoping he'd run well. He's passed a couple of tests out there today - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Ulster Carpets Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Desertmore House has a lot of bumper experience and he had plenty of schooling. He's a very laid-back horse and was jumping left the whole way and hopefully he can improve for that. He's a three-mile chaser down the line - Ricky Doyle, rider.

runners.name: Malina Girl
runners.comment: Best of the Irish when third in the Ultima, helps to give her trainer a strong hand
runners.spotlight: Most recent of four chase wins when scoring by 10l over an extended 3m3f on soft at Cheltenham in November 2023; ran creditably when second in 3m Listed mares' chase on heavy at Exeter in February; game display when best of the Irish in third behind Myretown in the Ultima at Cheltenham; helps to give her trainer a strong hand.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Malina Girl has been a great little mare. She is quite small, but she is very game and always tries very hard. She stumbled at the second and almost came down. It took her quite a while to get her confidence back, but she stayed on really well. It is not completely confirmed, but she might just go to stud now. She has been a brilliant mare and that might be the plan now - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stamina was never going to be an issue and Malina Girl always wears her heart on her sleeve. The Grand National hasn't yet been mentioned, but it looks like the mare could do it the way she has stayed there. She makes the jumping look easy, so who knows it could be a race she is aimed at - Louise Bodily, owner's spokeswoman.

quotes.race: Randox Ulster National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Malina Girl is a small mare but she jumps really well and I was confident the step up in trip would not be a problem to her. She travelled strong, enjoyed it and stayed well - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Sign Up Bet 10 Get 50 Irish EBF Mares Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Malina Girl ran a cracker at Cheltenham last day and she was great today. The soft ground brought her stamina into play and she is some mare to jump - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares' Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: I'm delighted to see Malina Girl get her head in front. She'd been banging on the door and was entitled to win that on her mark. She will go back in handicaps and I can't imagine the handicapper will do a lot as she was supposed to be winning that - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I put cheekpieces on Malina Girl because she hadn't travelled terribly well in her bumpers. She just got bumped around a bit and got lit up, probably travelled a bit too well, but on the whole she jumped well. There was a bit of a scare going into the second last but other than that it was pretty smooth. I'd imagine we'll look for a novice. It wasn't a very good race but it was still a nice performance and she's only a 4yo. She's not overly big but she's a nice filly - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Malina Girl was due to win and it's great that she did. I'll have a chat with the lads and I wouldn't rule out going for a winners bumper with her, but she will probably go for a maiden hurdle, we will see. She will be kept on the go now - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We might wait for the handicap chase at Cheltenham on New Year's Day that Stumptown won last year. She might also get an entry in the Grade 3 John And Chich Fowler Mares' Chase at Fairyhouse on New Year's Day. 21-12-24

runners.name: Panda Boy
runners.comment: Only chase win was in a beginners' event in 2022, fair third to Bushmans Pass at Naas
runners.spotlight: Only chase win was in a beginners' event at Punchestown in 2022; best handicap form represented by second placing in 27-runner Paddy Power at Leopardstown last season; disappointed when 7-1 chance in same event this season; much better when third to Bushmans Pass in the Leinster National.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: We only decided after Panda Boy ran here at the Festival to go chasing with him. I always felt he was a good-ground horse. His action always suggested to me that he wanted decent ground and chasing is his game. We may give him a little break now - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We think a lot of the horse. Panda Boy just needed distance and his ground - Martin Brassil, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Panda Boy is a big, weak horse and he is only starting to furnish. The more dry weather we were getting the more hopeful I was. His future is over fences but we will try and find a hurdle race before the end of the season - Martin Brassil, trainer.

runners.name: Yeah Man
runners.comment: Won last year's Grand National Trial at Haydock, dropped away from two out in the NH Chase
runners.spotlight: Won last season's Grand National Trial at Haydock (3m4f, heavy) and creditable third of 18 behind Stuzzikini in the Troytown at Navan (3m, yielding) in November; prominent when unseating at the 14th in this year's Haydock's Grand National Trial; dropped away from two out in the National Hunt Chase; first-time blinkered.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Yeah Man deserves that after a couple of defeats at Ascot. We weren't sure about the ground, but he got through it well. I'd say we'll go for the Irish National now. He wouldn't have got into it off his current mark but he will get in now - that's the target. I think we'll skip Cheltenham - he may have an entry in the Kim Muir but I'd say he's most likely to go for the Irish National - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He travelled well in the Irish National but I'd say a long season took its toll on him late on as he just didn't get home - he'd been to England three times, twice running well at Ascot and winning the Grand National Trial at Haydock. He was ready to start back in the Munster National but was taken out as the ground was a bit too lively for him. He's in the Troytown and he'll be entered in all those staying handicaps. 12-11-24

He travelled well in the Irish National but I'd say a long season took its toll on him late on as he just didn't get home. He was ready to start back in the Munster National but was taken out as the ground was a bit too lively for him. He's in the Troytown and he'll be entered in all those staying handicaps. 13-11-24

runners.name: Haiti Couleurs
runners.breeder: Dr V Simon, Mrs V Simon & Mr N Simon
runners.comment: Highly progressive sort, an emphatic winner at Cheltenham, big chance if handling ground
runners.spotlight: Has made an excellent transition to chasing, with handicap wins at Aintree (good) and Cheltenham (extended 3m1f, good to soft); kept ticking over with a hurdles run before landing the revamped National Hunt Chase at Cheltenham; won on testing ground as a hurdler, but at a fairly modest level; might not be ideally suited by this going.

quotes.race: Princess Royal National Hunt Challenge Cup Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs is such a tough horse. He wouldn't be overly speedy, he'll just gallop all day long. His jumping is so quick and accurate - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

quotes.race: Josh Wyke Birthday Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs had a nice novice season last term before he struck into his leg quite badly, so we had to take our time with him. He's slightly backward for his age but with racing he's just kept improving. I don't know where he'll end up really, I really fancied him for the National Hunt Chase, as he stays all day, but Sean says he's improving that much from his Aintree win to this that you wouldn't know if he would make the Brown Advisory. We'll be looking at both of those. We'll see what the handicapper does for his next race but he's a lovely prospect - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Haiti Couleurs has done that fairly easily, jumping and travelling well. He's a nice horse who's very versatile on the ground. I'd hope he'd be a Welsh National type for next season. It's nice they've changed the National Hunt Chase to a handicap, so maybe we'll look at something like that in the spring. He's relatively inexperienced and we'll see how he progresses - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was brilliant at Cheltenham and his form is looking good - Moon D'Orange was 18 lengths behind him in fourth and won back there on Trials day. We've had a hard decision thinking about where to go but the National Hunt Chase is the plan. I think it'll be the perfect race for him because I think the further he goes the better he'll be. We probably won't run before the festival to try to keep the mark of 135, although we have the option of a spin over hurdles. He's a really exciting horse as he keeps improving and is such a good jumper. He goes out in front, jumps aggressively and other horses find it hard to keep up. We'll go down the handicap route and if he ends up better than that we've got all that to look forward to. He'd be the best chaser we've had in a while. 10-02-25

runners.name: Now Is The Hour
runners.comment: Not far off Haiti Couleurs when falling at second-last at Cheltenham, suitable trip/ground
runners.spotlight: 2023 point winner; won a 3m Grade 2 novice hurdle on heavy at Haydock last season; shaped promisingly on fourth chase start, when not far off today's rival Kinturk Kalanisi and subsequent Scottish National winner Captain Cody at Navan; around two lengths off Haiti Couleurs when falling at the second-last at Cheltenham; a leading contender.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Prestige Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a big thing to Now Is The Hour as he really enjoys this type of ground. I've got into a nice rhythm and he's come home well. He's a nice prospect - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Grade 2 novice hurdle at Haydock last season in very testing ground. He took to fences well at Cork in March and is waiting on proper soft ground now. He'll be going over fences again and is a real stayer. 12-11-24

He won a Grade 2 novice hurdle at Haydock last season in very testing ground. He took to fences well at Cork in March and is waiting on proper soft ground now. He'll be going over fences again and is a real stayer. 13-11-24

runners.name: Shecouldbeanything
runners.comment: 4-8 over fences, creditable third at Cheltenham, this trip is a big step into the unknown
runners.spotlight: Started well over fences, winning four smallish-field races (at up to 2m4f) between late September and November (on ground ranging from soft to good); struggled in the Drinmore at this venue before finishing 9l third behind Bioluminescence at Limerick; creditable third behind Dinoblue in the Mares' Chase at Cheltenham; this trip is a big step into the unknown.

quotes.race: Mrs Paddy Power Mares' Chase (Registered As The Liberthine Mares' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything ran a great race again and I'm very happy. She does fall slightly short of those top mares, but she has loads of experience now. I thought she ran above herself and we will probably go to the Irish Grand National now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Mahon Falls Mares Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a clever and straightforward mare. She is genuine as you can get and jumps for fun - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: O'Dwyer Steel Dundrum Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is very tough and very genuine. She won going away at the line. I was after my one early but she finds so much I was never really too worried to be honest - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: Ballygarry Estate Hotel & Spa Mares Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it well. She's a tough mare, enjoyed the ground, and she jumped very well - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: Anglo Printers Remembering John H. Kierans Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went a really good gallop, so I had to bide my time and Shecouldbeanything stayed on gamely. She's a solid mare and today showed she will definitely stay further. She's very versatile ground-wise, ran well at Cheltenham on soft and, while she has form on all different types of ground, that nicer surface brings out the best in her - Sam Ewing, jockey.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it very well. We went a good gallop the whole way and she was probably just in her comfort zone where she was. As soon as we straightened up and I got after her, she picked up fierce well. She's decent and hopefully can keep progressing. She handled that ground fine as well - Jack Kennedy, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Easyclean Tourist Attraction Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything went a nice, even gallop and grinded it out really well. She found plenty and made my job a good bit easier - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Howden Insurance Brokers Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a good mare. She ran well in Cheltenham, probably did plenty and was keen enough so we said we'd have one run going to the last. She has a great attitude and she will definitely jump a fence. She won a point-to-point and winged from fence to fence so she will be grand.  We'll give her a break now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Goggin Buckley Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything was very good. She was keen and didn't help herself. I held onto her for as long as I could and she quickened away smartly - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She just keeps winning and she's now won three on the bounce. She won decisively at Clonmel on Thursday and we'll probably give her a break when the rain comes and the ground gets too testing. She's going to be a lovely mare to go to war with next spring. 28-10-24

runners.name: Sa Majeste
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Cap Orne & Yannick Fouin
runners.comment: Well held from the last when third behind Daily Present and Johnnywho in the Kim Muir
runners.spotlight: Useful 135-rated hurdler has done well over fences this term, with 2-5 record, the wins coming in small-field races over 2m7f/3m on soft/soft to heavy; prominent all the way but well held from the final fence when third behind Daily Present and Johnnywho in the Kim Muir.

stable_tour.quote: Looks a thorough stayer and did well to get up in the final stride at Tipperary on Friday. He saw out that trip really well and I would imagine he will be one for all those nice staying novices chases. He handles soft ground and hopefully a good season is in store. 25-11-24

runners.name: Any Second Now
runners.comment: Twice placed in the Grand National, second in this last year, faces tough task at 13
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in the Grand National; most recent win was in a Grade 2 chase at Navan two seasons ago; took time to find his form last season before being produced in fighting shape to finish a gallant second to Intense Raffles in this; could peak again now after two prep runs but no horse of his age has won this since Overshadow in 1953.

quotes.race: Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now did it nicely and didn't do any more than he had to. Denis was very happy with him. He popped away nicely, got under the last a bit, but when he grabbed hold of him after the last he quickened up well - Ted Walsh, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now is a great, consistent horse, he ran his heart and soul out. Mark said he missed the break a little bit and didn't get travelling as well as he normally does. But then he jumped well and travelled well and I thought at the last we might just get there - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Bobbyjo Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now is in good nick and he will go to Aintree in good nick. It was a tidy race and I'm delighted to have got a race into him six weeks from the National - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now was very unlucky, he very nearly got brought down at the third last and he's done great to finish third - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now is a smart horse and he showed at Naas last year that he is capable over two. I'd say that was a career best and it will send him to the Grand National in a good frame of mind. If he takes to the place, travels and jumps, and gets a bit of luck, he won't be far away - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: WhatOddsPaddy? Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Any Second Now travelled and jumped well. He stays well and things worked out well today and he was nicely treated. He'll go to Aintree with a good chance - Ted Walsh, trainer

quotes.race: Fulke Walwyn Kim Muir Challenge Cup Amateur Riders' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Ted gave me great encouragement to ride Any Second Now and everything worked out brilliantly. He'd been mixing it with good horses in Graded chases and relished the extra trip on that ground ? he really galloped all the way to the line - Derek O'Connor, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I was happy turning in that he was going to be third to two fair horses and when he picked up he did it well. It's a tight 2m around here and he was going as quick as he wanted to at times too. He cruised through Navan and he probably didn't learn a whole lot. He's a raw sort of horse but he could be a very good horse - Ted Walsh, trainer of Any Second Now

runners.name: Lord Lariat
runners.comment: 40-1 winner of this race in 2022, made pleasing comeback over hurdles but pulled up latest
runners.spotlight: 40-1 winner of this race in 2022; has run only five times since; returned from a two-year absence when encouraging fourth in a 2m4f handicap hurdle here in February; pulled up in a similar race 17 days later; hard to fancy against that background.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Our plan was to jump Lord Lariat out, but I was a bit concerned about getting the trip. We wanted to utilise his jumping as he is a good jumper. Paddy said he got plenty of breathers into him and it all worked out well - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Jackpot Is Back Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lord Lariat surprised me as I was a bit anxious carrying top-weight on that ground. He's won on proper good ground before. It's probably looser than we thought and he kept galloping. He's improving and maybe he's a bit stronger now to handle that ground - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Ladies Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lord Lariat stayed at it well and the girl used her head. He's been thereabouts for a while and deserved to get over the line. He likes that ground and there might be something for him at Leopardstown - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He's a big baby and he's going on his holidays now. He's only five and he'll grow into himself. He jumped super - Karl Thornton, trainer of Lord Lariat

quotes.race: Junction Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: He's just a big, raw horse and probably won't be a horse until next year. He's by Golden Lariat, a show jumping stallion who doesn't have many horses but everything he has is okay. He's a grand, fun horse. He'll come back here on Wednesday. He probably wants that nicer ground as well - Karl Thornton, trainer of Lord Lariat

stable_tour.quote: I think he'll go for the Porterstown Handicap Chase at Fairyhouse next month. He could have one run in the new year before we give him a break and it'll be all systems go for the Grand National at Aintree. He didn't run badly on his comeback at Punchestown ? it was a nice starting point in a small field. 20-11-22

runners.name: Stuzzikini
runners.owner: Vcs Versatile Coating Specialist Ltd & Francis Foran

prev_owners.owner: VCS Versatile Coating Specialist Ltd & Francis Foran
VCS Versatile Coating Specialist Ltd & Francis Foran
VCS Versatile Coating Specialist Ltd & Francis Foran

runners.comment: Troytown winner for this rider, down the field in the Thyestes and pulled up in NH Chase
runners.spotlight: Experienced chaser; took a major handicap prize when landing the 3m Troytown under this rider on yielding ground at Navan last November; down the field in the Thyestes and pulled up in the National Hunt Chase.

stable_tour.quote: He'd been showing us a lot more at home than he showed at Thurles. He disappointed me in a bumper that day but I'd be pretty sure he's better than that and we're looking forward to getting him back out and making amends. 18-10-22

runners.name: Tullybeg
runners.comment: Non runner
runners.spotlight: Non runner

quotes.race: McHale Mayo National Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: His jumping was perfect out there. Tullybeg got into a great rhythm and he got into the race without me pressing too many buttons. He did a great jump at the third-last and landed on the leaders' heels so I had to take him back a bit - Danny Gilligan, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Kehoe Agri & DIY Enniscorthy Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Tullybeg might go to Cheltenham in October but doesn't want it really soft - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Good Enuf 2 Eat Caterers At Gowran Park Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tullybeg put up a good performance under top-weight. He wants good ground and he'll get a break when it gets soft. He'll jump fences next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: BarOneRacing.com Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought after the last this horse could have got outbattled but in fairness to Tullybeg he stuck his head out and battled. We probably won't jump a fence with him this year because he lost his confidence that day in Punchestown. We'll just tip away and see where we go - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a grand horse and there should be plenty of fun to be had with him - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's taken well to chasing and has now won twice. There could be a nice staying handicap in him. 18-10-22

runners.name: Daily Present
runners.comment: Beat Johnnywho narrowly in the Kim Muir, could be in the mix again with help of 5lb claim.
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in this last year after finishing fifth in the Kim Muir; improved form this season, third in the Porterstown here on reappearance; same placing over a shorter trip at Punchestown; found plenty on the run-in to beat Johnnywho in the Kim Muir, the pair drawing clear of Sa Majeste; could be in the mix again with the help of Aidan Kelly's claim.

quotes.race: Fulke Walwyn Kim Muir Challenge Cup Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Spon By Thames Materials) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Daily Present is a stayer, but he was too free in the race last year. The ride that chap gave him was great as he never left the inside. He just had to try and keep on filling him. He was brilliant on him. I definitely thought Johnnywho was coming back, but I knew my lad would stay, however when I saw Derek (O'Connor) rallying I thought we were done. In fairness to this lad the last race he won at Down Royal he looked like he was going to be fourth, but he stayed on as if he wanted four miles. We are just so delighted. That was the lad's first ride in England. He is a super rider that is loaded with talent, and what a pair of hands he has. I just thought he was super on him - Paul Nolan, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Daily Present looks a fair horse, Sean thinks he's a proper one and I hope he's right. We'll take a look at Fairyhouse and Punchestown. He's only five and strengthening, and he'll probably get one more run - Paul Nolan, trainer

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Treo Eile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Daily Present had a lovely run at Naas where he galloped through the line. Sean said he had loads left today. He's a light-framed horse so we won't run too often. He'll have to step up now - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.name: Mint Boy
runners.comment: Unseated rider at 15th when 8-1 for the Kim Muir, renews rivalry with the first three
runners.spotlight: 2-6 over hurdles, rated 137; has reached the same mark over fences despite failing to win in five attempts; fair effort when third over 2m6f at Punchestown in February; among the leading fancies (8-1) for the Kim Muir, made a bad mistake at the 15th and unseated rider; renews rivalry with the first three home.

quotes.race: Golf Memberships At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mint Boy had a couple of good runs in bumpers last year. He was probably just a big, weak horse at Fairyhouse. It was a good performance and he got the hang of it jumping wise. He'll be a nice horse in time - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We were happy with his chase debut when third at Galway. He jumps well and won a point-to-point. You'd be hoping he'd be one for staying chases. I'm not sure he's good enough to be mixing it at Graded level but it was a positive start and he could go down the staying handicap route. 12-11-24

We were happy with his chase debut when third at Galway. He jumps well and won a point-to-point. You'd be hoping he'd be one for staying chases. I'm not sure he's good enough to be mixing it at Graded level but it was a positive start and he could go down the staying handicap route. 13-11-24

runners.name: Dunboyne
runners.comment: Long-priced winner on stable debut, maintained revival in form with Ulster National win
runners.spotlight: Beaten a short head in 2023 Thyestes; started last season brightly with Troytown fourth but pulled up in three big handicaps afterwards; surprise winner on debut for new yard in 2m4f Navan handicap hurdle early last month; maintained his revival with victory over Final Order in the 3m5f Ulster National; 8lb penalty makes this difficult.

quotes.race: Randox Ulster National Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Coming out of the back I wanted to nick a few lengths because Dunboyne kind of slowed up down the hill, he didn't like going down the hills. It's a great race to win, I had a double this day last year - James Smith, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We didn't know what to expect. Keith (O'Donoghue) just said ride Dunboyne handy so I did that, I kept him wide up the straight and he travelled lovely. He did it nicely - James Smith, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: The softer the better for this chap. It was really deep ground at Gowran the day he nearly won the Thyestes and he will head back there this year to try and go one better. 24-10-23

runners.name: Final Orders
runners.comment: Five-time chase winner, looked regressive last year, back to form on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner; looked regressive last year and low-key efforts this term until much more encouraging run early last month when clear third in good-class 2m6f Leopardstown handicap; continued return to form and proved his stamina when second to Dunboyne in the Ulster National.

quotes.race: Prizm Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Final Orders had a break since the jumps season and that was a nice pipe-opener for Galway. I thought he might be vulnerable over the trip but he did it well. He'll go for the Galway Plate - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cheltenham Fanzone Handicap Chase (Registered As The Sandyford Handicap Chase) (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Final Orders has massive scope, they are big fences around here but he just has so much scope. He loves it and is just thriving off it. He was off 140 there today and he's only 102 over hurdles so it's been a massive transformation - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: "Bet Through The Free Racing Post App" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders has been a revelation since he went chasing. He's only a small horse but loves jumping. He needs every yard of three miles over hurdles and but his jumping is so good over fences that he can operate at this trip. The Dan Moore Handicap Chase could be a race we might look at for him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Start Your Free Trial Now At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders is just so good and quick to jump. He wasn't in love with that ground, he might sneak into a good handicap off a low weight - Gacvin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: I wanted to make use of Final Orders because he stays well. I left him bowl away, used his jumping and he jumped well on the whole - they're probably the biggest fences he's jumped but he has loads of scope. The ground looks worse than it is and I wouldn't call it soft, it's only yielding - Keith Donoghue, rider.

quotes.race: tote Guarantee On All Irish & UK Races Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders jumped really well for his second run over fences, exceptionally good. He's really suited to the summer tracks. It wasn't a strong race - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Reddans Of Bettystown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Final Orders tends to hit a flat spot in his races but he stuck at it very well here. We might look for something at Listowel or he could go back on the Flat - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a busy enough summer so we let him off on a break but we'll probably bring him back in shortly. 12-11-24
He had a busy summer, so we let him off on a break and we'll probably bring him back in shortly. 13-11-24

runners.name: Kinturk Kalanisi
runners.comment: Promising in novice races, unseated rider two out at Naas when travelling well, respected
runners.spotlight: 126-rated hurdler, given 9lb higher chase mark after three starts; went close over 2m5f at this venue on second attempt, despite jumping indifferently and running in snatches; solid display against the smart Three Card Brag at Navan; travelling well when losing his rider two out in Leinster National won by Bushmans Pass; trainer bidding for third win in the race.

runners.name: Bushmans Pass
runners.comment: Progressive last season, flopped at Punchestown before Naas win in first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won three of his last four starts last season, culminating in a valuable novice handicap win at Navan; ran respectably without the benefit of a run when fifth in the Thyestes, weakening after a bad mistake two out; flopped when favourite for National Trial at Punchestown; redeemed himself with Leinster National win in first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Handicap Chase Final (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with Bushmans Pass. It was a good battle. I love a good battle when I win it, but I wouldn't like to be second in a battle like that! If the ground was soft at Punchestown there is a 3m6f race and he'd definitely go there. We're delighted with that. He's coming along, the handicapper wasn't easy on him early on - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

runners.name: Moonovercloon
runners.comment: 0-6 over fences, lacks a recent run and faces a massive task in a race of this standard
runners.spotlight: Two wins over hurdles; 0-6 over fences, runner-up three times, best effort when going very close in the Galway Blazers last August; lacks a recent run and faces a massive task in a race of this standard.

quotes.race: AJC Group Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Moonovercloon is a tricky horse. He didn't want to go today. James gave him a good ride because he never travelled for him. He has ability though - Matthew Smith, trainer.

runners.name: Hasthing
runners.comment: Non runner
runners.spotlight: Non runner

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hasthing was quite novicey. He has plenty to learn really but he's a good galloper and it was nice just to see him do it. He'd probably go on better ground. He's a big horse and it takes a little bit of time to get organised but he did it okay in the end. We thought we had a nice horse so hopefully he'll go on - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: His only real disappointment last season came at Sandown in March when he didn't find as much as we'd hoped. He'll go over fences this season and hopefully have more respect for them than he did his hurdles. There's plenty of options, and you'd like to think that if he jumped well there'd be a bit of mileage in him. 06-11-24

runners.name: Noble Birth
runners.comment: Won 2m6f novice chase on soft at this venue in January, stable has stronger candidates
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler for Gordon Elliott and Eric McNamara; respectable never-nearer third in Cork handicap chase last October on first run for Gavin Cromwell; placed over hurdles at Cheltenham in November; made almost all for 2m6f novice chase win on soft ground at this venue in January.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Noble Birth got a freebie in front but he jumped great. We'll see what the handicapper does, maybe the good novice handicap chase at Navan will be a race for him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been placed in a couple of bumpers and went over hurdles for the first time at Punchestown on Saturday. I didn't think he jumped well enough on the day but he'll be okay and probably needs a bit of a trip. 15-11-21

runners.name: Another Choice
runners.comment: Stuck to his task gamely when second in the Porterstown Chase over C&D
runners.spotlight: Stuck to his task gamely when second in the Porterstown Chase over C&D on yielding; good-ground winner last April at Downpatrick, beating Duffle Coat; deserves a shot but may find this going too testing.

quotes.race: BetVictor (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: ANOTHER CHOICE is a nice horse - Jamie (Codd, rider) was delighted with him. He was a little bit green when he joined the leader but once he got him out he quickened up well. Hopefully we'll have a bit of fun with him. We don't know whether he'll go for another bumper. He's been on the go for a while and will probably need a break at some stage. We'll see how he is after that and I'll have a chat with Jamie to see what he thinks - Matthew Smith, trainer

runners.name: Will Do
runners.comment: Has shown a liking for a thorough test of stamina in his last two races, worth considering
runners.spotlight: Has shown a liking for a thorough test of stamina in his last two outings, third in the National Trial at Punchestown, and same placing in the National Hunt Chase; each-way with Harry Sexton claiming 7lb.

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing Irish EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will Do is better the further he goes and that ground is probably as good as he wants it - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will Do is a good stayer. He loves galloping and he showed that when he won his bumper at Cork and although he looked beaten a few times there, he still managed to win it. He's a nice horse going forward and hopefully he will win plenty of races - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: It's nice to get one under the belt in bumpers. He is a good staying type and would strike you more as a staying chaser in time. John Gleeson - winning rider.

stable_tour.quote: Has looked a natural since we started schooling him over fences and he probably just needs a longer trip to show his true worth. He was just tapped for toe a bit at Galway on Saturday. 28-10-24

runners.name: Arch Empire
runners.comment: Well clear of 118-rated third when landing Ballinrobe maiden, so could be fairly treated
runners.spotlight: After a layoff, was fourth on stable debut at Navan (soft) last month and came forward from that to win at Ballinrobe (2m1f, good); was well clear of 118-rated third there so could be fairly treated under 7lb claimer.

runners.name: Whimsy
runners.comment: Won Gowran maiden by wide margin; up 3lb for that; third in 1m4f Curragh handicap since
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner finally off the mark over hurdles after a frustrating sequence when winning a Gowran maiden by a wide margin; up 3lb for that; staying-on third in 1m4f Curragh handicap since.

quotes.race: Lord Bagenal Hotel Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whimsy finally got there. A big thanks has to go to Paddy Hanlon and Paddy Graffan the last day as if she had gotten away with it, she mightn't have started today.  I went down to the start to make sure. We wanted to make the running, but it didn't work out. Oakley [Brown, jockey] said she found another leg once she turned in. She loves that ground, so I was glad to see all the rain coming. It's brilliant to get over the line over hurdles and I thought the handicapper was a wee bit harsh putting her up 3lb for the last day, but I suppose I'll have to eat my words now. I didn't know what way she'd go being out the back but she enjoyed it Oakley said. We might get something at Fairyhouse for her and if the ground is heavy, it would be ideal - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Major Barry
runners.comment: Two wins last summer; stable debut after a layoff and best form on better ground
runners.spotlight: Two wins from six hurdle starts last summer for John and Thomas Kiely including maiden over 2m5f and 2m1f Cork handicap; stable debut after a layoff and best form is on better ground.

runners.name: Wonleg
runners.comment: Roscommon maiden winner (2m, soft) last year; second won maiden lately from mark of 113
runners.spotlight: Won Roscommon maiden (2m, soft) on rules debut in September and runner-up won maiden lately off mark of 113; well beaten when third of four in useful 4yo contest at Naas in November; handicap debut.

runners.name: Putapoundinthejar
runners.comment: Down Royal maiden winner was never involved in Grade 2 novice at Kelso; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Listed bumper at four; off the mark on second start over hurdles when landing Down Royal maiden (2m1f, good to yielding) in January; tongue-tied when big price and never involved in Grade 2 novice at Kelso; handicap debut.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It has just taken a while for everything to fall into place. Putapoundinthejar is still relatively young and immature. Today's race turned into a great opportunity with Willie's not there. We always thought he was a nice young horse and we still do - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Kool One
runners.comment: Useful placed form; not out of contention when exiting at the second-last in Fred Winter
runners.spotlight: Low-grade Flat winner over 1m6f; placed behind smart horses on first three starts over hurdles including when second in Naas Grade 3; not out of contention when exiting at the second-last in the Fred Winter 4yo Handicap at Cheltenham.

runners.name: Stuntman Steve
runners.comment: Was poised to challenge when falling two out back over 2m on handicap debut at Thurles
runners.spotlight: Point winner and won Clonmel maiden (2m, good) on hurdles/yard debut in November; well held twice over longer trips but was poised to challenge when falling two out back over 2m on handicap debut at Thurles in January; off since.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The final hurdle was the winning of the race for Stuntman Steve and thankfully he came up for me. We have him six weeks and while he hadn't been away, we thought he was a nice horse so thought he'd go close - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had more letters than numbers in his point-to-point form but he's a grand horse. He won at Ballingarry in May and then made a winning start for us in a maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week when the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. I'm not sure where we go from here but he's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown. I suppose a rated novice could be next for him. 12-11-24

He's a grand horse who won his maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week and the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. He's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown and I suppose a rated novice could be next. 13-11-24

runners.name: Solsbury Hill
runners.comment: Creditable third on handicap debut at Wexford and first two home have both won since
runners.spotlight: Leopardstown maiden winner (2m, yielding) was creditable third on handicap debut at Wexford and the first two home have both won since.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We have eventually got it right with Solsbury Hill. We've tried everything - different trips, put a hood on him the last day and took it off today. In fairness to Charlie he was adamant that he wanted to drop him in and get him switched off down the inner, but it was fairly rough early on. There was a lot of hustle and bustle. He was probably a little bit further back than he wanted to be, but Charlie was adamant that once he switches off, he has plenty of pace. They went a strong pace and it all worked out well for him. He jumped super down the back and produced a nice turn of foot. He'll definitely go chasing next season as he jumps a fence super and is a nice one to look forward to - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

runners.name: Last Kingdom
runners.comment: Well held in three maiden starts for top yard but potential improver on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner in France has been well held in three maiden hurdle starts for top yard, including over 2m3f when last seen in February; potential improver on handicap debut.

runners.name: King In Love
runners.comment: Progressive this spring; 2m winner at Naas and narrowly beaten over 2m3f at same venue
runners.spotlight: Progressive since fitted with hood this spring; ready winner at Naas (2m, soft) and narrowly beaten on better ground over 2m3f at same venue; up 4lb for that.

runners.name: Aurea Fortuna
runners.comment: Placed over 3m and 2m4f in first two handicap starts; fourth over 2m4f here after a break
runners.spotlight: Placed over 3m and 2m4f in first two handicap hurdle starts, the latter effort when third of 23 in competitive  contest at Leopardstown over Christmas; first run since when well-held fourth over 2m4f here earlier this month; tongue-tie tried then stays on; sharper test for him here.

runners.name: Chosen Diamond
runners.comment: Been in good form over 2m4f on heavy including course win; drop back to 2m is the concern
runners.spotlight: Winning chaser last term; been in good form hurdling over 2m4f on heavy ground this spring, winning here and finishing second to the subsequent Ulster National winner Dunboyne at Navan; drop back to 2m is the concern.

quotes.race: Overlander Horseboxes Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Chosen Diamond is a horse I didn't think I would be waiting until now to win with. I never lost faith in him. We started schooling him a month ago and I though this was his game. He was very professional and is a natural jumper - Eddie Cawley, trainer

runners.name: Duty Bound
runners.comment: Chase winner needs to improve on hurdle efforts to date and probably needs further
runners.spotlight: Flat winner at three picked up a handicap chase at Wexford last summer; needs to improve on hurdle efforts to date and probably wants further; off since October.

runners.name: Kaptain Bay
runners.comment: Appreciated better ground when landing Bellewstown maiden; recent rain not in his favour
runners.spotlight: 4yo was placed twice in juvenile maidens last year; was pulled up here in a handicap on testing ground but appreciated better ground when landing Bellewstown maiden; all the recent rain not in his favour.

runners.name: Catchabird
runners.comment: Good third on handicap debut in mares' contest at Navan (2m, soft); open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Sister to smart jumper Getabird showed promise in maidens and good third on handicap debut in mares' contest at Navan (2m, soft); open to improvement.

runners.name: Read To Return
runners.comment: Generally runs over much further but was fair fourth in 2m2f hurdle last month
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer has won over fences but still a maiden in this sphere; generally runs over much further but was fair fourth in 2m2f hurdle last month; beaten when unseating rider over fences since.

runners.name: Aboy Joey
runners.comment: Maiden has been placed in three handicaps but needs to improve on latest two efforts
runners.spotlight: Maiden was twice runner-up in soft-ground handicaps this time last year; placed at Limerick over Christmas when headgear went on but needs to improve on latest two efforts; ground will suit.

runners.name: Teds Corner
runners.comment: Big prices and quiet runs in maidens, mild promise on first of them at Navan
runners.spotlight: Big prices and quiet runs in maidens, mild promise on first hurdles start at Navan in December; fourth runner for yard; 1lb wrong.

runners.name: Weston
runners.comment: Showed little in maiden hurdles and down the field in Irish Lincoln; 1lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Ran well off 96 in 1m6f handicap last year before losing form; showed little in maiden hurdles and down the field in Irish Lincoln last month; 1lb wrong for handicap debut.

runners.name: Blue Lemons
runners.owner: Sullivan Group Limited & Merriebelle Irish Farm Limited

prev_owners.owner: Sullivan Group Limited & Merriebelle Irish Farm Limited

runners.comment: Gowran winner was sent off only 12-1 for the Triumph Hurdle where jumping let him down
runners.spotlight: Useful 97-rated miler on Flat with Richard Hannon; won 16-runner maiden at Gowran Park (2m, soft) on hurdling debut in February, beating fair yardstick Kool One who is rated 120 now; was sent off only 12-1 for the Triumph Hurdle where jumping let him down and he was pulled up before the last; no surprise at all if he bounces back in this company.

quotes.race: Sea Moon & Jukebox Jury At Burgage Stud Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Blue Lemon did a lot right and there's plenty of improvement to come. He took his blow and ran on again. It's a different discipline to what he's used to but he took to it really well. I thought he could be very free coming from running over a mile but he did it very well. He saw out the trip well, which was an unknown. He will be a good dual purpose horse because with that attitude, you'll be able to mix it with him - Paul Townend, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I was very surprised the handicapper put him up 5lb for finishing sixth in a conditions race this month. He's a nice horse, but I thought that was unfair considering he's won one race in his life. He then did well when narrowly denied in the Esher Cup at Sandown last time. It's going to be hard for him off his mark, but I'm hopeful he can be a Britannia horse. 29-04-24

runners.name: Ephesus
runners.comment: Readily got off the mark at Limerick; rated 122 and may improve further; handles soft
runners.spotlight: Galileo gelding won 1m4f Curragh maiden for Ballydoyle last year; consistent over hurdles and readily got off the mark at Limerick earlier this month; rated 122 and may improve further; handles soft.

quotes.race: Fleetwood Paints Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Ephesus stays very well and he'll stay further than this, he's genuine. We'll look for a staying handicap, he'll have no problem going 1m6f - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Holy See
runners.comment: Third in Ballinrobe maiden last time; headgear back on but doesn't seem that progressive
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat winner in France; ran respectably in first three hurdle outings during the winter, was 2l behind Ephesus when sent off favourite at Naas in February; pulled up in the Fred Winter Hurdle at Cheltenham wearing cheekpieces; one-paced third in Ballinrobe maiden last time; headgear back on here but doesn't seem that progressive.

runners.name: Its Bilbo
runners.breeder: Mrs Nicole Capelli Dambrine Et Al
runners.comment: Narrowly beaten by former French winner Kurasso Blue at Limerick and that is useful form
runners.spotlight: Fourth over hurdles in France last spring and off the mark on Irish debut at Punchestown in November; beaten 10l in Leopardstown Grade 2 at Christmas; narrowly beaten by former French winner Kurasso Blue at Limerick last month and that is probably useful form; now rated 129.

quotes.race: Total Event Rental 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Its Bilbo ran a nice race in France in the spring and he's a fine horse. He won't be in a mad rush with him. He was a bit green but he was able to get stuck in at the end - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.name: Messerschmitt
runners.comment: Galway maiden winner hasn't jumped well when soundly beaten last twice; back from a break
runners.spotlight: Fair sort on the Flat, winning over 1m at two; won Galway maiden in October on first completed start over hurdles; hasn't jumped that well when soundly beaten in C&D Grade 3 and valuable handicap at Limerick; back from a break.
