quotes.race: Renvyle House Hotel 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Messerschmitt has been a very unlucky horse but I think he's a good horse. He stays well and he loves jumping, he's a good size and very athletic. I would imagine he will go on to the graded race at Fairyhouse - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a messy sort of race and I tried to keep things as smooth as I could. Messerschmitt is a lovely-moving horse and I think there'll be plenty of improvement on nicer ground - Ben Coen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Wendrock
runners.comment: Well held in Grade 1 company either side of good sixth under a big weight in Fred Winter
runners.spotlight: Leopardstown maiden winner at Christmas was good sixth under joint top-weight in Fred Winter at Cheltenham; well held in Grade 1 company either side of that, beaten 20l when fifth at Aintree; highest-rated of those with marks and respected but has been fairly busy this season.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran better than his finishing position [seventh of eight] suggests in the Grade 1 at Leopardstown. He probably made his move a bit early in the race and got tired. He's the sort of juvenile I could see running well in the Fred Winter.  19-2-25

runners.name: Preparations
runners.comment: Made all in fillies' maiden on hurdling debut at Limerick (good), beating 109-rated rival
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner at modest level on final Flat start at three; back from six months off when making all in fillies' maiden on hurdling debut at Limerick (good), beating 109-rated rival by two lengths; likeable but good bit more needed to contend in this company.

runners.name: Farmers Lodge
runners.comment: On a hat-trick; up another 10lb here but goes well fresh and could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced for his age; ready winner over 2m4f here in November and followed up over 2m3f at Punchestown; up another 10lb here but goes well fresh and could have more to offer.

quotes.race: Tote's Cheers To 2024 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Farmers Lodge is a quality horse. His chase form was good and he had a good mark over hurdles. He will mix and match between the two. I think there might be a good handicap chase in him somewhere - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Roganstown Hotel & Country Club 20th Anniversary Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Farmers Lodge has had his issues but he looked to have a nice mark over hurdles. We schooled him during the week and he was very slick. I think we will stay over hurdles for now, he looks versatile as to ground - Barry Connell, trainer

quotes.race: Fairyhouse For Fundraisers Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Farmers Lodge has not been simple, he has had a lot of little niggles. He is a natural to jump and the only question in my mind was how he would handle the heavy ground. We will get a mark and go for a handicap - Barry Connell, trainer.

runners.name: Oscars Brother
runners.comment: Fine effort when favourite on handicap debut over 3m1f at Navan, beaten fractions; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Progressive novice in the autumn and has won twice over 3m; fine effort when favourite on handicap debut in valuable 3m1f contest at Navan in December, beaten fractions; up 5lb for that; will handle soft ground.

runners.name: Win Some Lose Some
runners.comment: Didn't happen for him at Cheltenham when only 8-1 for Pertemps Final; four wins previously
runners.spotlight: Didn't happen for him at Cheltenham when only 8-1 for Pertemps Final but had won four of his previous seven starts over hurdles including Pertemps qualifier at Leopardstown over Christmas; 10lb higher mark than for that success; has done his winning on good to yielding ground.

quotes.race: Rathgormack Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground went against Win Some Lose Some the last day at Listowel, he hated it. These were ideal conditions. We went no gallop and it turned into a sprint. He takes time to warm into it, but he sparked up going down to the second-last. He's a good-ground horse - Mark Walsh, jockey.

runners.name: Lucky Lyreen
runners.comment: Good runs in pair of staying handicaps in February; tailed off in Pertemps Final
runners.spotlight: 2m4f winner here on heavy ground at last year's Easter meeting; hasn't added to that but good runs when claimer-ridden in staying handicaps at Leopardstown and Naas in February; tailed off in Pertemps Final and back in trip here.

quotes.race: SBK Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lucky Lyreen stays strong, idled in front but when something came to him he went on again. He lets you down a small bit with his jumping but I think he just loses concentration a little bit at a hurdle - Jack Kennedy, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won a competitive handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse over Easter and we might go novice chasing with him. Before then, there is a valuable staying handicap hurdle at Navan which we might have a look at. 28-10-24

runners.name: Clodders Dream
runners.comment: Not seen since winning on handicap debut at Tipperary (2m4f, yielding) in July; up 8lb
runners.spotlight: Dual winner last summer but not seen since winning on handicap debut at Tipperary (2m4f, yielding) in July; up 8lb and entitled to come on for the outing.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a nice prospect over hurdles as he only won his maiden hurdle in May. He was progressive through the summer and hopefully he can continue on an upward curve when he returns. 28-10-24

runners.name: Eagles Reign
runners.comment: Been a struggle for him since Listowel victory and well held over 2m4f/2m7f last twice
runners.spotlight: Useful 4yo form last year, second in Fred Winter and winner of the Lartigue at Listowel; been a struggle for him since that latest victory and well held over 2m4f/2m7f last twice.

quotes.race: Liam Healy Memorial Lartigue Hurdle (Listed Handicap)
quotes.quote: The plan has been to come back for this race and we gave Eagles Reign a prep run on the Flat three weeks ago to open the pipes. It was in the lap of the gods whether he would get his ground or not, as he grows a leg on soft ground. When the rain started yesterday it didn't stop ? you couldn't write it better. He ran such a great race at Cheltenham and was a bit flat at Aintree. Tommy [Ward, owner) suggested the Lartigue, and it made sense - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

quotes.race: Buy Festival 2024 Tickets Today Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eagles Reign will probably get a little bit further in time. He wasn't a superstar on the Flat, but he seems a more consistent and better horse jumping. He might win another little handicap - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Mordor
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux
runners.comment: Eighth in Martin Pipe over 2m4f when not quite seeing it out and good Flat run since
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer won twice over hurdles last summer and was second in 2m2f Ballinrobe handicap off 2lb higher; respectable eighth in Martin Pipe over 2m4f when not quite seeing it out and good Flat run since; handles soft but prefers better ground.

runners.name: Come Walk With Me
runners.comment: Plenty of promise in maidens; up in trip on handicap debut and local yard does well here
runners.spotlight: Has shown plenty of promise in maidens; second to a subsequent Grade 1 winner two runs back and chased home smart bumper horse Redemption Day over 2m3f when tried in tongue-tie (retained) last time; interesting up in trip on handicap debut and local yard does well here.

runners.name: Glen Kiln
runners.comment: Readily won 2m4f Navan handicap in December; fair run over 3m and scoped wrong last time
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner on heavy last year and readily won 2m4f Navan handicap (yielding to soft) in December; didn't quite see out the trip when running respectably over 3m at Leopardstown and had an excuse (scoped wrong) last time.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Kiln schooled last week over fences at Tipperary and we were going to go for a beginners chase but the ground was nicer here, he wants soft ground. All the conditions were right for him. We love him, he's a horse for the future - John Bowe, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Supporting Kill GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Kiln got a super ride. He galloped away and used his stamina. We told Carl not to let it turn into a sprint. He'll make a great chaser - Michael Bowe, owner

runners.name: Arion Soldier
runners.comment: Easy winner of soft-ground Cork maiden last April when stepping up to 3m; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of soft-ground Cork maiden last April when stepping up to 3m for the first time; tailed off over fences only start since; scratched several times lately due to good ground; will get his conditions here but stiff enough task.

quotes.race: Hibernian Hotel Mallow Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Arion Soldier had been working well. It was a big step up in trip but we thought that this would be his trip. After the last day we were hopeful. We won't rush him, he is worth minding - Eamon Courtney, trainer.

runners.name: Mywayofthinkin
runners.comment: Maiden winner over 2m; poor run on heavy when tried in a tongue-tie over 2m3f last time
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to last month's Gold Cup winner won 2m Punchestown maiden on decent ground last May; lame when pulled up in Grade 3 at Navan; poor run on heavy when tried in a tongue-tie in 2m3f rated novice back at Punchestown in January; bit to prove but still early days.

quotes.race: Tuesday Treat At Punchestown Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Mywayofthinkin is a big horse and we were glad to see the rain this morning. He was professional over the last two when it was needed. He'll be going out to grass shortly - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He got off the mark on his hurdles debut at Punchestown in May after a couple of good runs in bumpers. We're waiting on a bit of rain for him and we'll get him started in a rated novice, probably over two miles. He's a grand horse. 12-11-24

He got off the mark on his hurdles debut at Punchestown in May after a couple of good runs in bumpers. We're waiting on a bit of rain for him and we'll get him started in a rated novice, probably over two miles. He's a grand horse. 13-11-24

runners.name: Angostura
runners.comment: Landed 2m Gowran maiden on heavy over a year ago; nothing since, now trying a longer trip
runners.spotlight: Beat Tranquil Sea when landing 2m Gowran maiden on heavy over a year ago; nothing since then, tailed off when third at Clonmel on first run of the year and no show over 2m last time; trying a longer trip.

quotes.race: Golf Classics At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Angostura was a little bit green in front, but has done it very nicely. He's a nice horse and there should be plenty of days with him - Jack Kennedy, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had the look of quite a nice horse when he won his maiden hurdle at Gowran in the spring. It just didn't happen for him in a Grade 2 at Fairyhouse after that, but he should pay his way over fences. He has the makings of a nice handicap chaser. 28-10-24

runners.name: Redstone
runners.owner: Thomas Cox & Ralph Kelly & H Rogers
runners.comment: Didn't go on for Gavin Cromwell after 2m maiden win here; tailed off (3m) on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Didn't go on for Gavin Cromwell after beating the smart King Of Kingsfield in 2m maiden here on hurdling debut; after a layoff, was tailed off over 3m on recent stable debut.

quotes.race: 2nd To The SP Favourite At Novibet (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've always liked Redstone and he's going to be a very nice horse in time ? he's big too. It was nice to do that today and you wouldn't have thought the inside track here would be the ideal place for him as he's a big horse. He's not slow and travelled well but you could certainly see him going up in trip. You probably won't see the best of him until he goes over fences - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse who goes well at home. He made a winning start at Fairyhouse last month when he beat an odds-on favourite. We'll step him up in grade now and he'll probably go to Navan for the For Auction Hurdle or the Monksfield, depending on the ground. 10-11-23

runners.name: Hamsiyann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Won handicap over this trip at Cheltenham (good to soft) in November; two poor runs since
runners.spotlight: Useful stayer on the Flat and won handicap over this trip at Cheltenham (good to soft) in November; two poor runs since, over 3m at Musselburgh and when hampered early and never involved over 2m at Aintree earlier this month.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Intermediate Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All I wanted was for Hamsiyann to come back safe, it didn't matter whether he won or not. I was hoping he would avoid bad luck and have a bit of luck on his side. He was lucky that the horse who fell three out didn't bring him down. I gave a good bit of money for him a couple of years ago, but he's only coming to his milk now. That was sweet - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Idefix De Ciergues
runners.comment: Good second in 3m handicap hurdle at Cheltenham (soft) on New Year's Day; well held since
runners.spotlight: Welsh raider won 3m contests over fences and hurdles on good to soft ground in November and good second in 3m handicap hurdle at Cheltenham (soft) on New Year's Day; well held both starts since, including in Newbury chase last time.

quotes.race: Ice Cream Direct Members Hands & Heels Handicap Hurdle (Cond/Amateur) (Go North Brindisi Qual') (RE)
quotes.quote: We ran Idefix De Ciergues back over hurdles as he was just a bit sticky over fences so we just thought it'd be a confidence boost and it seems to have done the trick. We'll probably go back over fences next time - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's improved this season. We thought he'd be a nice novice chaser and, although he won over fences at Chepstow, his jumping let him down. It could be that we have a few more runs over hurdles and go back to another novice chase at some point. I gave him an Albert Bartlett entry just in case he did show a lot of improvement, but it's just an option. He was pulled up in very testing ground at Sandown last Saturday. 10-02-25

runners.name: Tranquil Sea
runners.comment: Placed in first three handicaps, all over 3m, but well held last twice; headgear now tried
runners.spotlight: 2m maiden winner at Cork on soft to heavy last March after chasing home Angostura at Gowran; placed in first three handicaps, all over 3m, but well held last twice; comes back in trip with headgear combination tried.

quotes.race: Dermot Casey Tree Care Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tranquil Sea was careful over those rubber hurdles but he got the job done and Sean said he had loads of horse going to the line. In time over a trip he could win a decent handicap - James Nolan, assistant trainer

runners.name: Petit King
runners.comment: Third over 2m here last Easter but has shown very little, mostly over fences, since
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over 2m3f on heavy; third over 2m here at the Easter meeting last year but has shown very little, mostly over fences, since; headgear returns.

runners.name: Beacon Edge
runners.comment: Seventh in the Coral Cup but then finished well behind Kopeck De Mee at Aintree
runners.spotlight: For an 11yo he ran a cracker to be seventh in the Coral Cup but then finished well behind Kopeck De Mee at Aintree; not hard to look elsewhere.

quotes.race: bet365 Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The West Yorkshire Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge is a lovely genuine horse, he runs his race every time and I couldn't have been more happy with the way he did it there.  Small-runner fields can get quite tactical, we picked it up turning into the straight and I didn't want to be too far away because I knew my lad stays. He's done it well - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: He'llberemembered Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge looked in trouble a long way out but he stuck at it and took off on the run to the last. There is going to be improvement fitness-wise so hopefully he can keep going the right way - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: BARONERACING.COM Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Like every one else, I thought we were struggling at halfway and we were looking like we weren't at the races. I don't think Denis could go any quicker but from three out I thought we were getting back into it. You'd have to think three miles is his trip and the three-mile race at Leopardstown over Christmas is the obvious next race for him. Beacon Edge has a bit of blood on his nose - I've never seem him bleed before but sometimes they can get that from up high (in his nostril) or sometimes it can happen when they hit a fence. It didn't stop him today anyway - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Ireland Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge had a colic at Christmas and spent nearly a week in Kildare (veterinary clinic). He was just wasn't himself in Naas last time, but he's a fair horse. I wondered about him getting the trip but he stays. He's a very nice horse. Michael (O'Leary) had it in his head that he'd go to the Aintree Hurdle but he's in the Stayers. We have Diol Ker as well and we'll see what turns up in it. He was meant to go over fences this year but when we thought about what was coming out over fences we said we might be as well staying where we are. We got it right the way it looks at the minute anyway. That was a nice prize today and a nice race to win - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Marlin Hotel Dublin, Supporting The National Breast Cancer Institute Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge can go now for the Hatton's Grace, that's the obvious race for him. I felt that when he went up in trip it would help, they didn't go much of a gallop there but he was cantering throughout - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Health Hurdle
quotes.quote: He couldn't have done it any easier. We'll have to talk with Eddie and Michael (O'Leary) about whether he goes over fences or stays over hurdles. I suppose we didn't learn a lot there other than the fact he is well and that he jumped brilliant. Sean said he didn't really handle the track that well and when he was in front he was a bit lairy. If he stays over hurdles he will go for those conditions hurdle races. I think two and a half (miles) might suit him better and I've felt that all along. He can be dragged into a race rather than sort of push it a bit over two miles - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Bangor-on-Dee Annual Members Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge disappointed me a little bit. I thought he would have travelled a little bit better and I thought he was a bit lairy when he was left on his own. I do think he's a very nice horse though - Noel Meade, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He might not be the horse he once was, but he's still running to a pretty high level and he ran well again at Cheltenham on Saturday. He's very consistent. 28-10-24

runners.name: Maxxum
runners.comment: Penalised for winning the Grade 2 Boyne Hurdle; has since disappointed at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: None too consistent and had an off-day when pulled up in the Coral Cup; however, he's very smart when on his game and it was bordering on a career best when easily winning the Grade 2 Boyne Hurdle at Navan the time before; could go well despite an unwelcome penalty, which he didn't have when falling in this last year (running well at the time).

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Maxxum had a good run at Gowran over 3m last time when he didn't get home. We thought dropping back to this trip would work well if he got a soft enough lead. Danny (Gilligan) was able to get a breather into him at the right time and he did it well. He'll go for the Coral Cup now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Race And Stay At Leopardstown Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Maxxum is a bit hot and cold and I thought the ground might have gone a bit soft for him. When you are in these handicaps you never know. We said we'd keep it simple, pop him out handy and see what happens - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Storm The Stars @ Coolagown Stud Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It was a bit sticky and Maxxum was getting in tight, it was slow and he had no momentum going in and was backing off a bit. In fairness when we went on a stride he jumped better. Danny (Mullins) missed the fourth last and I actually jumped it well and I knew my lad would say so I said I'd keep the pressure on. I wanted to be clear going to the last in case he was going to be slow at it. He pricked his ears going to the line, he was just doing enough - Keith Donoghue, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We thought Maxxum was well handicapped when he came to us. We're very happy with him - he was good today. He's going the right way so we'll see where we are. He shouldn't have much problem getting into the Pertemps Final now! He was probably a bit unlucky when beaten on his first start for us, and ours were all coming on for their runs at that stage. It was the inside track at Punchestown too that might just have been a bit tight - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tynan's Bridge House Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maxxum has a good race in him. We will have to think of something different next day - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Knocklofty Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maxxum is a nice horse. We'll give him one more run before we put him away - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's not far off Graded level over hurdles and we might see if he can develop in a nice staying hurdler this season. That was a hot race he won at Punchestown and he had a lot of weight, too. He's a very good horse on his day. 28-10-24

runners.name: Kopeck De Mee
runners.comment: Excellent second in an Aintree handicap; raised in grade but he's dangerously unexposed
runners.spotlight: Progressive in France (including on heavy ground); very disappointing favourite in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham but proved that form all wrong with an excellent effort in a 2m4f handicap at Aintree, where he was closing in on one who got first run; raised in grade but he's dangerously unexposed.

runners.name: Colonel Mustard
runners.owner: Mrs A Frost & P G Davies & R H Fowler

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A Frost & P G Davies
Mrs A Frost & R H Fowler

runners.comment: Ran his usual honest race to be fifth in the Coral Cup; sure to give his running
runners.spotlight: Has a poor strike-rate but he's been a grand servant to his connections and ran his usual honest race to be fifth in the Coral Cup; won't do down without a fight and testing ground doesn't faze him.

quotes.race: Corrib Oil Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We knew before the race we'd have to make the running and I wasn't really worried about that but it is a relief more than anything. There was so much expectation riding on Colonel Mustard to nail the maiden and get it done and he has. It will give him huge confidence and I think we now have a good bar from what he did last season. I hope we have a lot to look forward to now and I'd like to take him to Cheltenham in three weeks for the Supreme Novices Trial because I think it'll be good to get there and see how he travels - Lorna Fowler, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Racing Post App (Ladies Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: We think a lot of him. I'd imagine he was beaten by a very good one at Killarney [Purple Mountain], who runs on Friday. He came out of that race and just got it, it all sunk in and he knew exactly what he'd have to do next time. I wouldn't have run unless there was cut in the ground and I knew the rain was coming. I wanted yielding, but he loves a bit of cut in it. He's versatile and will run on anything from yielding to the other end. Aine [O'Connor] said he won it nicely and had plenty in hand at the end. He's a lovely horse and loves his racing. Personally, I'd like for him to go for a hurdle now. He's five and has done loads of schooling, as well as having run in two bumpers. That would be my gut feeling but I'll speak to the owners. I wanted to get him to the track a year ago but little things went against him, whether it be a stone bruise or tiny little things. We were all set to go and then had lockdown. He's been ready to go for a long time, but the time hasn't done him any bit of harm - Lorna Fowler, trainer of Colonel Mustard

runners.name: Eagle Fang
runners.comment: Useful gelding but likely placed at best here unless the blinkers can trigger something
runners.spotlight: Has only won a couple of minor hurdles but had raised his game in defeat this season until finishing only midfield in the Coral Cup; likely placed at best here unless the first-time blinkers can trigger something; the ground will be fine.

quotes.race: A.M. Transport Supporting Kill GAA Rated Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eagle Fang has bumped into some smart horses. He would want it soft and I would like to see some rain but the Boodles has been the plan for some time - Gary Bannon, assistant trainer

runners.name: Sandor Clegane
runners.owner: Mrs K Browne & Mrs Anne Coffey
runners.comment: Classy customer; ideally wants 3m but today's testing ground will help in that respect
runners.spotlight: Competitive in Grade 1s over hurdles and fences; ideally wants 3m and was found wanting for tactical speed when only tenth in the 2m5f Coral Cup at Cheltenham (his first handicap), but today's testing ground will help in that respect; blinkers worn in his last three races are removed.

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I know Sandor Clegane was beaten ten lengths but I thought he hit the line well and he jumped well. I would say he will go to Cheltenham now for one of the staying novice chases - Paul Nolan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough in the Galmoy and actually hit the line well, which he hadn't been doing, so I was happy to see that. He's in the Stayers' Hurdle and could go for that, but I'd love to see him have a crack at the Coral Cup ? that sort of race would suit him. If he got into a rhythm early, I could see him running a big race. 20-2-25

runners.name: Spread Boss Ted
runners.comment: Raw ability is much respected but this is a big ask after so long on the sidelines
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing fourth in what's turned out a good renewal of last season's Albert Bartlett (3m), which was a good effort for one whose pedigree hardly screams stamina; raw ability is much respected but this is a big ask after so long on the sidelines.

quotes.race: Easter Festival March 30th - April 1st Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spread Boss Ted just missed the last and was hard to get going again on that ground. He closed up well when I asked him and he would have been an impressive winner but for the last - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spread Boss Ted got under one or two hurdles but he sharpened up after that and we saw the improvement we would like to have seen from Naas - Danny Mullins, rider

runners.name: Staffordshire Knot
runners.comment: Has become lethargic in his recent races; in new blinkers when ninth in the Coral Cup
runners.spotlight: Bumper/maiden winner; has become rather disappointing given his initial promise and lethargic in recent races, running on all too late in the day when ninth in the Coral Cup last time (first-time blinkers); might not be good enough even if putting it all in.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Staffordshire Knot is a bit green, but I'd say he would be better in a better race. It was a nice performance and hopefully can progress. The ground is very dead, so it is testing. He went away through it and did it well - Jack Kennedy, rider

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed us in the second half of last season, but he's had surgery to sort out a kissing spine over the summer, so that will hopefully help get him back on the right track. He's going to go novice chasing and I could see him ending up over three miles. He should rank highly among our novice chasers. 28-10-24

runners.name: Kala Conti
runners.comment: Classy mare and admirably consistent until disappointing at the Cheltenham Festival
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over hurdles and admirably consistent until weakening out of contention behind Lossiemouth at Cheltenham last month (2m4f, good to soft; 16-1); she's better than that and needs considering with no ground/trip issues.

quotes.race: Eventsec Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kala Conti is not a bad filly and had graded form last year. I thought she might need the run today. She's a good filly - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Mercedes-Benz South Dublin Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Kala Conti didn't lose much in defeat at Fairyhouse. It was a good performance and she enjoys a good gallop as she stays very well - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kala Conti is a nice filly. We'll look at the graded race at Fairyhouse in two weeks time. She's pretty straightforward - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's in the Mares' Hurdle but we've others who could run in that, so she has the option of a few handicaps and maybe the Martin Pipe might suit her. She's held her form together really well for the last few seasons. She's a lovely mare. 19-2-25

runners.name: Lantry Lady
runners.comment: Fourth in a Grade 1 last season and didn't take to chasing on her reappearance
runners.spotlight: Won the Grade 3 Red Mills Hurdle on just her second career start and highly tried in Grade 1s afterwards, finishing a good fourth to Lossiemouth in the 2m4f mares' race at Cheltenham last season; jumping failed to stand the test on her chase debut and she's respected back in this scene, especially as she's so lightly raced.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Mares' Hurdle (Registered As The David Nicholson Mares' Hurdle) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Langtry Lady is the one for the future, definitely. That was only her third start and Jack (Kennedy) said she just got a little bit lost at the start. She's probably a three-mile mare in time, so I'm delighted - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Lantry Lady is a really nice mare and I'm delighted for the Marigas as they are great supporters of ours. She was impressive here last year in her maiden hurdle and then we put her away as she was a bit immature. I was concerned about fitness and that it was only her second run after winning a maiden hurdle, but she's obviously stepped forward again.   Cheltenham has to be a possibility and we'd love to go. It would be a step up in trip, but she suggests at home that all she does is stay. I'd say she definitely wants a good ease in the ground so we'd be cautious of that - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Of Luck To The Irish At Cheltenham Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lantry Lady was a mare we liked a lot at home. I thought she would need the run but she looked good. I thought she lacked the experience to win but that was very good. She probably needs a nice ease in the ground - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She likes really soft ground. She ran a cracker in the Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham last season but probably didn't quite get home over three miles at Punchestown, so she'll be campaigned over two to two and a half this season. She's going chasing and we'll get her out whenever we have ease in the ground. 18-11-24

runners.name: Feet Of A Dancer
runners.comment: Solid efforts in hot handicaps the last twice; might not be up to this level
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner; handicapping the last twice, running with distinction in Leopardstown's Pertemps Qualifier and again in the Final at Cheltenham; won't mind dropping back from 3m but whether she's up to this level is debatable (has a bit to find on the figures).

quotes.race: Redweld Stables Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I like the way Feetofadancer did that. We might give her time between her races and maybe come back for the mares' handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival - Paul Nolan, trainer

quotes.race: Racing Again July 7th Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Feet Of A Dancer is going the right way and has a lovely attitude. Hopefully she might continue to improve and we can maybe target something at Listowel - Paul Nolan, trainer.

quotes.race: Wexford Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Feet Of A Dancer came on from her last run. She was professional today, jumped very well and we are very pleased. We won't overface her and maybe end up in the Lartigue Hurdle in Listowel - Paul Nolan, trainer, speaking on RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: She's a smart mare. She was just too fresh and keen at Leopardstown but hopefully we can get rid of that fizziness for Cheltenham. If she settles better, I've no doubt she'll stay. She has some decent form in the book.  20-2-25

runners.name: Gala Marceau
runners.comment: Has flashes of smart form but has been below that in her last two appearances
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the 2023 Triumph; finished behind Lantry Lady in last season's Grade 1 Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham and was out the back when falling three out in last month's renewal; only third in a Listed hurdle at Warwick the time before, so current wellbeing is an issue.

quotes.race: Prix Alain du Breil - Course de Haies de Printemps (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (4yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We all love a filly who's able to come through a whole season and at the very end put in probably her best performance. Danny thought Gala Marceau would be one who would suit the Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham next season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was a bit late back in, so I haven't got around to schooling her over fences just yet. She would look an ideal type for the Mares' Hurdle, but if she happened to jump well she could easily go chasing. 25-11-24

She faced a stiff task on her debut for us when taking on Lossiemouth but ran a lovely race to be second. Then she got the better of Lossiemouth at Leopardstown, which was an admirable effort but events behind her played a large part in the result as her stablemate got stuck in traffic. Gala Marceau will meet Lossiemouth again in the Triumph in what's sure to be an interesting contest. She's her own worst enemy as she's a real hard puller and when she gets that under control she'll improve again. 08-03-23

runners.name: Found A Fifty
runners.comment: 5-10 over fences, concerning that his last two races have blotted his fine overall record
runners.spotlight: 5-10 over fences, runner-up on three occasions, all at Grade 1 level; concerning that his last two races have blotted his fine record; had an excuse at the DRF (nasal discharge), ran out of steam from the last in the Champion Chase; only previous run over this trip was when second here in the 2023 Drinmore; won over a shade shorter at Down Royal last November.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Fortria Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Jack said Found A Fifty didn't feel as good today as when he last rode him. He thought down the back he was going flat out, then he probably made up too much ground from the fifth-last to the third-last. He just stopped in front. But that was a fair performance and he's a smart horse. He won't run in the John Durkan, I would say we'll go to Leopardstown at Christmas for the 2m1f Grade 1 and work from there - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bottlegreen Ladies Day 2024 Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance to give a stone to the second horse and Found A Fifty had a good blow. I suppose we will have to look at a race like the Durkan, but that's the level we're at with him. He's settling better and the way he jumps we could come back to two miles. He's a good horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very messy at the start and I collided in the air at the first with Charlie Deutsch's horse. We probably didn't go as hard as I thought we were going to go and I was always travelling, then down the back we really pressed on. I was happy enough to let them go and I probably ended up there a bit too soon to be honest, but Found A Fifty was very good. He hasn't missed a beat all season. He's a great horse. A tough horse. He's versatile. He stays two and a half but a strong run two is fine for him - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Eventco Marquees Ltd. Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Found A Fifty is a good horse. He got very revved up last year and he could blow his top, but Jack was delighted with the way he settled. Normally you might be glad to see those fences taken out, but when you saw the way he jumped I was hoping the opposite! I love the way he quickened down the straight. He's in the Drinmore so we'll see - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He won two Grade 1s last season as a novice and was second in the Arkle. You can put a line through his run at Leopardstown as he wasn't himself at all that day over Christmas. We could step him up in trip for the Ryanair and he'd have an each-way shout in it if we did. He's been good since Christmas. 19-2-25

runners.name: Ash Tree Meadow
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Career-highlight in winning 2023 Galway Plate, out of form since Killarney win last May
runners.spotlight: Seven-time chase winner; career-highlight in winning the 2023 Galway Plate; not at his best since Grade 3 Killarney win last May; reportedly bled at Gowran in October before being given a winter break; big price when unseating at the 11th (Foinavon) in the Topham.

quotes.race: BoyleSports An Riocht Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ash Tree Meadow did it very well, travelled well and jumped brilliant. Two miles was too sharp for him the last day but he went well on that ground today and his jumping was exceptional - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It wasn't really the plan to run Ash Tree Meadow but when the race looked like it would cut up we decided we'd declare him and then make our mind up what to do. We let him run and it has worked out great. He's a very good horse. Sam [Ewing] said he hated that ground and he'll be better on better ground. There is a race in Fairyhouse, a Grade 2, and a race in Aintree for him so we'll see what happens. He'll be entered in the Irish National and we'll see what Eamon [Waters, of Alymer Stud] wants to do. It's just whether he'd get that trip would be my only concern - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I don't think Ash Tree Meadow wants winter heavy ground. We didn't put him in the John Durkan. We will probably give him a break now as he has been in all summer and we will train him back for some of the Grand Nationals next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: This race has been the plan since last year for Ash Tree Meadow - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Graigs Lane Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: I think Ash Tree Meadow is a nice horse. He's a big chaser really and he's a horse for the future. Davy [Russell] said that while it looked like he didn't jump that well he was travelling so well that he didn't let him wing hurdles because he would have made up too much ground. He's a grand horse. He likes that nice ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he bled at Gowran Park last time. We're going to give him a very easy time of things for a while now and maybe train him for the Nakayama Grand Jump next April. I would like to get a prep into him before that, though. 28-10-24

runners.name: Journey With Me
runners.comment: Most recent of three chase wins came in this race last year on heavy, weak form this term
runners.spotlight: Most recent of three chase wins came in this race last season on heavy ground, beating Appreciate It by 9l; nowhere near that level of form in three starts this season; beaten 44l at Windsor in January; 13l behind Saint Sam when last of three in the Red Mills at Gowran.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Odds All Channels Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: We were a bit sketchy over the last but Journey With Me did it well. His jumping took a little bit of time to warm up, maybe after the fall the last day, but a great performance. He settled well, I didn't think we were going a mad gallop but we did all finish pretty tired so maybe it's tougher ground than it looks - Rachael Blackmore, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Journey With Me was good. He was still a bit green in front and further will suit him. I would think he will be going for the Ballymore - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: "Doc's Bumper" Point-To-Point INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Journey With Me was good, he's a real galloper. We were fortunate enough to be able to buy him after he won his point-to-point and you would have to be delighted with that - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's lightly raced and we're hoping he'll be a Grade 1 horse, perhaps in the Ryanair. He travelled as well as anything to the second-last in the Punchestown Gold Cup last season but just didn't seem to see it out, so we'll stick to two and a half miles. We were hoping to run in the Clonmel Oil this weekend but not on that ground. He's in the John Durkan at Punchestown. 18-11-24

He did well with a 13-length win on his first completed chase at Naas just before Christmas. He has since run well when second to the useful Impervious at Punchestown in January, where he was only headed close home. He's not going to Cheltenham but will be a nice one for Punchestown in April. 01-03-23

runners.name: Saint Sam
runners.breeder: I Catsaras, V Dubois & M Dubois

prev_owners.owner: Mme Victoria Dubois & Mme Irene Catsaras

runners.comment: 6-14 over fences, has been alternating between hurdles and chases, often races too keenly
runners.spotlight: Front runner; 6-14 over fences; has alternated between hurdling and chasing since being pulled up in this race last season, winning over timber at Cork and Auteuil and adding a Clonmel Grade 2 Chase (2m5f, good) in November; has often raced too keenly, including when beaten at odds-on by a stablemate at Gowran in February.

quotes.race: Clonmel Oil Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Saint Sam is a hardy bit of stuff and has his own way of doing it but he's been a great servant. You're a passenger on him and all you do is steer him. He's so hard on himself but there's still fire in his belly. He's a big, strong horse and if he makes a mistake, he just gallops away off the back of the fence - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Red Mills Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It's great to win the Red Mills Chase, it's a race we pinpoint at the start of the year. The small field suits Saint Sam and he likes to get on with things. He's a great jumper, but we were worried with it being his first run back that he'd be too fresh and too much in that heavy ground, but Paul got breathers into him. I think those Grade 2 and Grade 3s are where he's most comfortable - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Eileen Kelly Memorial Chase
quotes.quote: Saint Sam put up a huge performance there over that trip. Paul didn't really get a chance to settle him and to come up that hill three times like he did was very good. Those races seem to suit him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tramore Racecourse Directors Chase
quotes.quote: Rachael said Saint Sam was very enthusiastic. He loved the track. He might go to Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Proudly Sponsoring At Punchestown Hurdle
quotes.quote: Saint Sam can go out in trip. He likes to get on with it and he seemed to settle a little better so hurdling might be his game now. He is bred to stay and I am keen to get him out in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sean O'Keefe was unlucky on Saint Sam as he got jumped out of the saddle when there was that faller at the second last - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrick Ward & Co Solicitors Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Saint Sam needs to learn a lot. He made two bad mistakes but got away with it, he's a horse that can find a fifth leg. We're very happy with them and happy that Haut En Couleurs got up off the ground as well - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's won 11 times and never lets us down. It was a fair performance at Clonmel as you rarely see horses quicken up the hill the way he did. He'll be kept on the go through the winter and can mix between hurdles and fences. 25-11-24

I always thought he would make up into a Triumph Hurdle contender but in three runs he has not shown enough to suggest he could win it. His last run when second in the Grade 1 Spring Juvenile Hurdle at the Dublin Festival was a step up on his two previous efforts but I'm not sure if he will trouble the main contenders and we will probably talk things over with his owners about whether we take up his option of the Boodles Juvenile Hurdle. 10-03-21

runners.name: Blood Destiny

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin, Gabriel Leenders Et Al

runners.comment: Needed the race when beaten by two stablemates in a Grade 2 event at Thurles in January
runners.spotlight: Grade 3 winner at Navan last term; beaten favourite in Grade 1 won by Spillane's Tower here last Easter and was pulled up (coughed post-race) at the Punchestown festival; probably needed the race when beaten by two stablemates in a Grade 2 event at Thurles in January.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We tried new tactics and I thought that might be a help after Punchestown. Paul [Townend] was very taken with Blood Destiny there. He's brilliant to jump, that was always his feature, but we were making too much use of his jumping instead of just using it when we needed it. Coming back in trip might have been a help as well. I don't know whether we've made a mistake now leaving him at home for Cheltenham but at least he has one nice prize in the bag. I imagine he'll probably go for the WillowWarm Gold Cup at Fairyhouse. That was the plan, here and then on to that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet 10 Euro Get 50 Euro Sign Up Offer" Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Blood Destiny was dynamite everywhere and always looking for the next fence really. He's a real chaser. They tried to push me and get him lit up, but I wasn't interfering with him and he was getting a length everywhere with his jumping - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Race Displays Hurdle
quotes.quote: Blood Destiny has obviously improved again from his win at Cork and just has a lovely way of going about it. He was idle enough and missed a couple of hurdles but he was doing nothing - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paul (Townend, rider) had lots of confidence in Blood Destiny, and when he let him stride on he jumped those hurdles well. The experience he got in France helped. He does that nicely in the juvenile division and will make a chaser in time. Hopefully he will go forward. Whether it's too close for him to run at Christmas or not, we'll see. We might wait but will see how he comes out of this. I hope he comes home safe and sound and I'll be planning a Grade 1 route with him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very useful chaser who had a little setback, so you won't see him until after Christmas. We'll do things a little differently to see if he can become a proper Grade 1 horse this season. 25-11-24

He's a very interesting prospect for the Triumph Hurdle having won his two races for us very impressively, particularly last time at Fairyhouse. We didn't run him at the Dublin Racing Festival as it was only three weeks after his previous run and that would have been a big ask for a youngster. Having missed that race, he'll be going over next week a much fresher horse. I think he's very good. 08-03-23

runners.name: Heart Wood
runners.comment: Enhanced his reputation with a fine second in the Ryanair, suited by the race conditions
runners.spotlight: Beat Corbetts Cross readily in a three-runner Listed chase at Wexford (2m7f, soft) on reappearance in October; just denied by Croke Park in a tight finish to the Drinmore over C&D on his final novice outing; faded into fourth in Savills Chase at Leopardstown; enhanced his reputation with a fine second to Fact To File in the Ryanair; suited by the race conditions.

quotes.race: Ryanair Chase (Registered As The Festival Trophy) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heart Wood ran a cracker and he is only a baby and he is coming along really nicely. It was a really good race, and they went a savage pace, and the winner is obviously very good. I think this is the right trip for Heart Wood as I've tried him over three miles a couple of times and he just wasn't getting home, however he is only seven so we will see - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Michael Hickey Memorial Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Heart Wood. Darragh [O'Keefe, jockey] did great and I thought he did everything right. His jumping was a little sticky at the start, but he certainly warmed up to it and I loved the way he picked up - he looked great. He's definitely pacey, but I wouldn't want to discount three miles just on his Aintree run - we'll have a look at it again. We think he's still eligible for the Drinmore, so if he is we'll have a look at that. He's still a young horse who could keep improving - Henry De Bromhead, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: O'Driscolls Irish Whiskey Leopardstown Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Heart Wood had a couple of nice runs in beginners chases and in all fairness it seemed a reasonable mark. We said we'd aim for here today and we're delighted to win this. We'll see what the handicapper thinks and then sit down and decide where we go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The Ryanair is the plan with him. He was very good at Wexford and I thought he ran really well in the Savills, he travelled everywhere but didn't just see it out. The Ryanair looks an ideal race for him as three miles seems to be just catching him out. 7-2-25

runners.name: Kilcruit
runners.comment: Only mild encouragement from last month's third over hurdles at Thurles, stable outsider
runners.spotlight: Has run only five times since a runaway Punchestown festival handicap chase success in 2023; failed to beat a single opponent in his two races this season; only mild encouragement from last month's third over hurdles at Thurles.

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Novice Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Kilcruit was very good and the dry ground was a big help to him. He was probably a Graded horse in a handicap. He jumps for fun and Paul said he was in control at all times. We might look at the Galway Plate, you'd imagine that would be the ideal race to look at - David Casey, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Lily & Wild Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Kilcruit showed a lovely attitude towards his fences, he had a good blow and he will come on. He learned a lot and I love the way he was looking for the next fence - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kilcruit ran well but it appears what we all thought that he probably wants two and a half miles. He won his trial over two miles, so we came here for that and today he looked like he needs another half mile. It's the same with Bring On The Night who was having his second run over hurdles and I'm happy with him. Both of those will go up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Punchestown.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: KIlcruit set out to do what he did, I don't know if we learned much bar that he gallops. It didn't look the fastest 2m on the clock, but we will see. He had nothing against him to make him jump any better. I don't know if we run him again before Cheltenham - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: ITM - Supporting Irish Store Sales Champion INH Flat Race (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Kilcruit is a good stayer and it was very simple. I was happy enough to get to the front when he did and he just kept galloping - Derek O'Connor, rider.

quotes.race: Goffs Future Stars (C & G) I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It was a superb performance from Kilcruit in what looked like a real good race. I was hoping he'd be a nice horse but I didn't think he had that sort of capability. That's unreal what he produced there - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Racing Ind'y F'raiser For Children's Health Fdn Crumlin In Memory Of Pat Smullen Flat Race
quotes.quote: Kilcruit is a horse we really like. He's improved an awful lot. He's a light horse and doesn't take a lot of work to get fit. I think he's got a lot of ability. He'll improve again - Paddy Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's on a break for the first half of the season and we'll try to get him back in the spring. He'll miss Christmas and probably the Dublin Racing Festival and it'll probably be next spring before you see him. There's no great aim for him at the moment, except maybe Fairyhouse or Punchestown. I'd imagine a nice handicap at one of those festivals will be on his radar. 13-11-23

A lovely horse who has finished second and third in his two visits to the Cheltenham Festival. This season he made a nice winning debut over fences at Punchestown and his two subsequent runs have been in Grade 1s where he finished third and fifth. We have options next week in the Ultima, Brown Advisory, Turners and Plate. 08-03-23

runners.name: Rebel Gold
runners.owner: R Kennedy & Michael Odowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan

prev_owners.owner: Michael O'Dowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael O'Dowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
Michael O'Dowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael O'Dowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy

runners.comment: Brought his chase record to 4-24 with a recent handicap win at Wexford, aiming high here
runners.spotlight: Veteran who brought his chase record to 4-24 with a recent handicap win at Wexford; 50-1 when last of four finishers in this race last year; similar task this time.

quotes.race: Newlands Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Rebel Gold didn't have to make all the running today which was a big help to him. I would have been more confident had the ground been soft, but he was fine on it and we will probably head now for the Grade 2 at Fairyhouse - Pat Foley, trainer

quotes.race: Dan & Joan Moore Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: That was great. Rebel Gold jumps and travels and any jockey that rides him comes back with a smile on their face. They get such a thrill from him. He's a pleasure to train because he's the most straightforward horse you'll come across. We went for the Leopardstown Chase last year and really thought he'd get the trip, as it turned out he didn't really. We might go back for it though, ride him differently and try to creep into it. He deserved to win a big one.  I'm delighted for the horse and delighted for the owners - Pat Foley, trainer.

quotes.race: Daly Farrell Chartered Accountants Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Rebel Gold is a fantastic jumper, is 132 over fences already and we'll see what the handicapper does with him now but there'll be a nice handicap in him. The Shamrock Handicap Chase back here in March will probably be his next race. He's not really ground dependent so we will keep him going over the summer - Pat Foley, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Exhibit A Displays Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The other horse was a bit slow at the last and that helped me. My lad hadn't run since Galway so it was a good performance as he needed the run. He'll be a nice horse for chasing. I'd say that could be his limit over hurdles now. I'd say more than likely his next run will be in a chase. He's a big horse and ran in point-to-points so I'd say that's his game - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

quotes.race: Well Done To All Frontline Staff From Limerick Racecourse Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: It's my first winner for Tom [Foley]. The horse was very free early on but they've done a great job settling him in his work. He loves the ground and should improve as well. He's nice and there might be a novice for him at Galway, he'll stay further -they went a good gallop. It probably wasn't the strongest race in the world but you can only beat what's put in front of you. It was a nice performance - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

runners.name: Shannon Royale
runners.comment: Has the form to feature and the return of blinkers might not be a bad thing
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to smart opposition in his first two chases before beating the useful High Class Hero at Punchestown (3m, yielding); nothing positive to take from his last three races (all good ones; two handicaps) but the ability is there to feature off this mark (with Rob James taking off 7lb) and the return of blinkers might not be a bad thing.

quotes.race: Your Free Entry Sponsored By Tote Ireland Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Shannon Royale is a good galloping type and a good staying type. He is more of a handicapper than a graded horses. He jumped well in the main and was just wasn't doing a lot in front - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: End Of The Season Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shannon Royale has plenty of ability but he has his own ideas about things. He's done it well enough but was fairly idle in front. He jumped the last well and was always going to hold on - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were a bit disappointed with Shannon Royale the last day so we put cheekpieces on him to sharpen him up. He had fitness on his side and Jack said he was a different horse today altogether. His jumping was good. He won his bumper and got beat at Fairyhouse and we were disappointed with his last run but he was good today - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did particularly well on his summer holidays and he has the makings of a nice staying novice chaser. He has a big engine and you haven't seen the best of him yet. 28-10-24

runners.name: Folly Master
runners.comment: Punchestown winner in Dec (2m3f); lots more to offer, especially at this trip
runners.spotlight: Improving 7yo who made it 2-4 over fences when comfortably accounting for Rolly Bowley Boy over 2m3f at Punchestown in late December (soft; 10-11f); was running well when falling on his last attempt at 3m; appeals as a horse with lots more to offer.

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee, Never Beaten By SP Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Folly Master is a lovely horse, very straightforward and genuine. He wants proper soft ground and maybe another mile. He could be one for a bigger day in the spring - Tom Dreaper, trainer.

quotes.race: Leugh Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Folly Master is a lovely horse and is getting better for racing. He is a staying chaser for the future - Tom Dreaper, trainer.

runners.name: Macs Charm
runners.comment: Essentially disappointing since a stylish winner of this race two years ago
runners.spotlight: Quite a stylish winner of this two years ago when 5lb higher but lightly raced in the meantime and mostly disappointing, especially this campaign; cheekpieces didn't do a lot for him last time.

quotes.race: Ardmulchan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Macs Charm, he stays at it really well. He's a 3m horse in time and I suppose he proved that today. He's in again on Thursday but I'm not sure whether we'll go to war with him again so quick but it's an option. We'll look for something similar otherwise - Colm Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Cleatus Poolaw
runners.comment: Lightly-raced chaser for whom nothing went right in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Has yet to reproduce his best form over fences, though didn't run badly over 3m3f at Punchestown before a lot went wrong in the Kim Muir (interfered with more than once); still only a 7yo and having his sixth run over fences.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cleatus Poolaw is a chaser in the making, what he does over hurdles will be a bonus. He could step right up to 3m - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be more of a handicapper than a graded horse over fences and maybe something like the National Hunt Chase could come into the reckoning for him now the conditions have changed. He should do better over fences than he did over hurdles. Staying is his game. 28-10-24

runners.name: Pats Fancy
runners.comment: Doesn't look in good enough form to exploit his much reduced mark
runners.spotlight: 125-1 for the Kim Muir and performed accordingly; that was his second disappointing run after a long absence and doesn't look in good enough form to exploit his much reduced mark.

stable_tour.quote: I was really pleased with his last run. It was about having a prep run before Cheltenham and I didn't expect him to beat Bravemansgame. The ground would have been on the good side for him, and Newbury's a speedy track, but he travelled and jumped well, and has come out of the race brilliantly. He's also run well at Cheltenham a few times. 25-02-22

He got an entry in the Grand National as I've always thought he'd be the right type for it. It's just a shame we've been unable to keep him right in the last couple of seasons. We ran him in the National Hunt Chase three years ago when the ground was quick and since then he's had little tendon injuries. We've given him a lot of time and he seems a lot better for it. He's on a good mark but would need to win a chase before April to get in the National, although unfortunately he never travelled when pulled up in testing ground at Sandown last Saturday. 10-02-25

runners.name: Battle It Out
runners.comment: Lost his way after impressing in a chase last season; young enough to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Impressive winner of a Listed handicap chase at Naas last February (2m4f, soft to heavy) before losing his way; a recent run over hurdles might have done him good and he's still only a 7yo; 8lb higher than for that last win but this mark shouldn't be beyond him.

quotes.race: Nas Na Riogh Novice Handicap Chase (Listed)
quotes.quote: Battle It Out had a nice light weight and it was a proper test whcih is what he wants. He'll be a lovely horse next year, he is still only a frame - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Battle It Out is a smashing big horse. He has done nothing but improve and is still doing so. A summer's break is beckoning for him - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer

runners.name: Better Times Ahead
runners.comment: Runner-up in this 12 months ago; encouraging signs in the Leinster National latest
runners.spotlight: Chased home handicap snip Macdermott in this 12 months ago when 5lb lower and nearly won a Listed chase next time at Punchestown; effectively just his second run of this campaign when staying on into sixth in the Leinster National; big run expected under conditions that are right up his street.

runners.name: Union Station
runners.comment: Runner-up over 3m4f at Leopardstown and assured stamina will be no bad thing here
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced maiden but surely a winner waiting to happen over fences and he saw the trip out well when runner-up on handicap debut (chasing) over 3m4f at Leopardstown in early March; assured stamina will be no bad thing here.

stable_tour.quote: He was entered at Naas on Sunday but we didn't declare him because of the ground. He's a chaser in the making. He'll start off over hurdles and has summered nicely. 12-11-24
He was entered at Naas on Sunday but we didn't declare him because of the ground. He's a chaser in the making. He'll start off over hurdles and has summered nicely. 13-11-24

runners.name: Wheres Frankie
runners.comment: Pulled up in last year's Irish National and has offered little in three subsequent outings
runners.spotlight: Four of his five wins have been here and he handles most ground; however, he was pulled up in last season's Irish National and has offered little in three subsequent outings; now tries cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Willie Gibbons Celebrating 38 Years At Leopardstown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie was suited by the tip and the rain during the week was a blessing. He'll go back to Fairyhouse now at Easter and that'll be it for the season - Karl Thornton, trainer

quotes.race: Early Bird For Easter Festival @Fairyhouse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie just loves it around here. The last day over hurdles he pulled something early on and we've done a bit of physio and acupuncture on him since. We schooled him yesterday and I said he should be right enough. He loves those staying trips and we may as well just keep coming back here with him. The handicap chase for horses rated 0-140 here on Easter Monday is probably tailor-made for him. It's a couple of weeks earlier than usual, so he might get softer ground there and it might be safe enough - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Easter Festival 16th - 18th April Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie will come back here in April over fences. We thought he would handle the ground and he did - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Fairyhouse On Social Media Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Where's Frankie did it well, it was very straightforward. He has a big raw frame and wasn't right all last year, but he's coming good now. He could come back here in two weeks - Karl Thornton, trainer

quotes.race: Tote+ Pays You More At Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: I'd say Where's Frankie has been a bit backward but he's been progressing this year. We've been pleased with his work and his jumping has sorted itself out - Donagh Meyler, rider

runners.name: Stormy Judge
runners.comment: Dual chase winner who will enjoy the ground but doesn't arrive here in the best of form
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner who will enjoy the ground but he never counted in the Leinster National and then faded away in the new cheekpieces at Downpatrick; asking a lot to bounce back in this good handicap.

quotes.race: Tipper Road Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Stormy Judge stayed on really well today and three miles will be his trip. He can handle soft - Pat Fahy, trainer.

runners.name: Street Value
runners.comment: Former Porterstown winner but this season is becoming a bitter disappointment
runners.spotlight: Won the 3m5f Porterstown Chase here in late 2023 but hasn't approached that level this season and no sign of rediscovering it last time at Naas.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Guaranteed Overnight Prices" Porterstown Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Street Value deserved this. He took a terrible fall here at Easter when we thought we lost him. For him to come back and do that on a big day is unbelievable. Hopefully he could come back here for an Irish National some day - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Street Value loves soft ground. I was going to run at Leopardstown but it wasn't soft enough and we just had to wait. We'll see what the handicapper does - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Street Value is just a big galloper and was tough as nails. Barry John let the race just develop in front of him and he was tough at the end. It was a hard slog and he'll get two or three weeks off now - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Street Value is a grand horse and Hugh [Morgan] said he was flat out all the way, he only got rocking and rolling at the bottom of the hill. With a circuit to go I thought we could be in trouble but he's just a big, honest, old baby. Looking at the size of him, I'd say whatever he does over hurdles is a bonus and he's a chaser in the making - John Flavin, trainer

runners.name: Salmanino
runners.breeder: E Petit & H Petit & L Kovenko
runners.comment: Fell two runs back and may have been remembering that when never really going at Navan
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on his comeback run (3m) and was going well when falling four out next time; may have been remembering that fall when pulled up at Navan as he was slow at the first and steadily lost his position when things hotted up.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Salmanino was entitled to win that and it was the ideal race for him. He'll go for staying handicaps now and thank goodness for this type of race - Liz Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets Now Streaming UK & Irish Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Salmanino has just got one gear, he jumps very well and hopefully will be an improved horse over a fence. We'll have to keep him at three miles to be competitive again - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Rolly Bowley Boy
runners.comment: Had excuses last time after a good stable debut; returning to 3m should help
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler; yet to win over fences but a runner-up on five occasions and after a good stable debut over 2m3f (beaten by Folly Master) he blundered his way out contention next time (2m4f); stays this far and enters the reckoning.

6:10.race_name: Leinster Reinforcements & Brazil Piling (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race

runners.name: Ill Sort That
runners.comment: Dual bumper winner and withdrawn from a Grade 2 novice hurdle here earlier this month
runners.spotlight: Only seventh in a maiden hurdle to kick off with but has won both his bumpers, the first here and then making all at Naas (on heavy); withdrawn from a Grade 2 novice hurdle here earlier this month due to yielding ground; clearly held in some regard.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Prices (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Obviously I'll Sort That is not going to Cheltenham but could go to Fairyhouse for a winners of three and then out to grass. We'd be looking forward to him next year, he's a lovely horse to have - Declan Queally, jockey.

runners.name: Shuttle Diplomacy
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: After 315 days away, he ran a mighty race to finish a close third in the Champion Bumper
runners.spotlight: The ground was heavy when winning a Listed bumper at Limerick last season and, after 315 days away, he ran a mighty race to finish a close third in the Champion Bumper at Cheltenham; well positioned in that steadily-run race but there's no knocking the form.

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker Champion (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shuttle Diplomacy is a proper horse. Bryan (Cooper) rode him in work on Tuesday and he was awesome. He was able to quicken a third time, he's just very good. He was very green at Naas. He was bought very cheap and I've had him since he was a two-year-old. He'll go to Punchestown now. He's a fine horse and has so many gears - Thomas Cooper, trainer.

quotes.race: Fifty Stars "What About Those First Foals" (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Shuttle Diplomacy has only been away a couple of times, but he was very green. He hung but it was only greenness that caused it and but for that he would have won very easily. We'll stay at home I would say and he'll probably end up at Punchestown - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.name: Camberwell
runners.comment: Carlisle form nothing special but was a late withdrawal from the Grade 2 at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Sent to Carlisle for his rules debut (soft; 8-1) and responded well for pressure to win going away; that form isn't flashy but he was a late withdrawal from the Grade 2 at Aintree earlier this month, so may be capable of a lot better.

runners.name: Kovanis
runners.comment: Impressed in a point; more workmanlike in his bumper but he's clearly promising
runners.spotlight: Bought for Â£330,000 after impressing in a 3m point at Portrush; only workmanlike in winning his bumper at Leopardstown over Christmas but the third is a half-brother to State Man who has since won a maiden hurdle; this 5yo should have lots more to offer.

runners.name: Sortudo
runners.comment: Ran well at Cheltenham but has 4l to find with third-placed Shuttle Diplomacy
runners.spotlight: Bang there in two bumpers at Leopardstown (the latest a Grade 2) and he ran well to be seventh of 17 in the Champion Bumper, where he appeared to get outpaced when it mattered; has 4l to find with third-placed Shuttle Diplomacy but these conditions can be a great leveller; respected.

quotes.race: Garrarus Beach (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Authorized is a brilliant sire and Jody did well to get Sortudo settled. I think there should be a lot of improvement in him. He's an exciting horse and will probably stay in bumpers this year. We'll see how he comes out of the race and look at Leopardstown over Christmas. He could be at the top end of our bumper horses - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Jackmoon
runners.breeder: M Remy Buchot & Mme Gyslane Huet
runners.comment: Has shown a nice level of ability in all his bumpers but has been absent for nearly a year
runners.spotlight: Has shown a nice level of ability in all his bumpers, getting to within 6l of top novice hurdler Romeo Coolio on one occasion; has been absent for nearly a year.

runners.name: Tamberian
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winning jumpers but likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners El Rio (useful 2m3f-2m4f hurdle/chase) and Cracker Jak (2m5f/3m hurdle); dam maiden sister to smart bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Let Yourself Go; likely best watched.

runners.name: The Night Agent
runners.comment: Second in a bumper before finishing an unlucky third on his hurdle debut; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a bumper at Naas (soft/heavy) and was close up in a Clonmel maiden hurdle despite not enjoying the best of runs at various stages; shouldn't be underestimated.

runners.name: Question Piege
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: The only mare in this field and would need to see some market confidence
runners.spotlight: Closely related to French 15.5f winner Toto Demonmirail, half-sister to French 1m7f hurdle winner Out Of Risk; dam French 10.7f/11.5f winner, sister to a Listed chase winner; the only mare in this field and would need to see some market confidence.

1:15.race_name: Fitzgeralds Woodlands House Hotel & Spa Adare Maiden Hurdle
1:15.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Amberjack
runners.comment: Tongue tie now tried after 23l defeat on hurdles debut at Clonmel, passed over
runners.spotlight: Tongue tie is now tried after a trio of tame bumper efforts and a 23l defeat on hurdles debut at Clonmel; passed over.

runners.name: Be Positive
runners.comment: Decent run on penultimate, didn't back it up latest, place chance on best form
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit more on penultimate start at Leopardstown when an 11l eighth of 18 at long odds; didn't back that up on latest at Clonmel when 12-1; place chance if reproduces his Leopardstown form.

runners.name: Bitofajokelike
runners.comment: Huge odds and never sighted in all four starts, tongue tie made no difference latest
runners.spotlight: Triple figure odds and never sighted in four starts; tongue tie made little difference last time at Limerick; oppose.

runners.name: Bob The Builder
runners.comment: Point winner, struggled in beginners' chases last twice, unlikely to be the answer here
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of point-to-points earlier this season; huge odds and no impact in two beginners' chases on return to the racetrack; unlikely to be the answer.

runners.name: Chosen Thyme
runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles and rated 112, sound effort in Limerick maiden, place chance
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles but has run well in defeat and rated 112; decent third in a Limerick maiden (3m, good) on latest early this month; handles testing ground; place claims; sixth here on Sunday.

runners.name: Felix Felicis
runners.comment: Pulled up in both points, hard to fancy on racecourse debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two point-to-point starts on yielding-soft; from the family of Glens Melody but hard to fancy on racecourse debut.

runners.name: Frosty Fossna
runners.comment: Fell in sole point, half-brother to the useful Winter Fog, check the market; tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Was running respectably when falling in sole point-to-point start at Tralee on good ground; half-brother to the talented Winter Fog is tongue tied for his hurdles debut; worth a market check on return from mammoth absence.

runners.name: Good N Kind
runners.comment: Point winner, fine effort on hurdles debut after absence, the one to beat upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 2.25l runner up behind Port Joulain in a Gowran bumper in March 2024; fine effort on hurdles debut on return from over year off last month at Limerick (2m3f, soft) and form since boosted by the third; the one to beat stepping up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He was impressive in his point win and ran really well when second in a Gowran bumper for us. He ran into a good one of Willie's [Mullins] that day. We hope he's a real staying type and he'll start in a maiden hurdle once there's ease in the ground. 18-11-24

runners.name: Light On His Feet
runners.comment: Never figured in first two maiden hurdles, hood goes on, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Killarney bumper on debut; never figured in first two maiden hurdles and now hooded; others appeal more.

runners.name: Milanova
runners.comment: Long odds and well beaten in first two maiden hurdles, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Long odds and beaten a combined distance of 102l in maidens at Fairyhouse and Punchestown; may need more time.

runners.name: Native Dream
runners.comment: Maiden pointer, fell and well beaten in maidens at Naas, looks a longer term project
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer has failed to make much impression in two maiden hurdles at Naas, falling first time up and beaten 48l latest; looks more of a longer term project.

runners.name: Nukies Artic
runners.comment: 150-1 for both starts in maidens and failed to land a blow, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 150-1 for both starts in maiden hurdles at Punchestown and Limerick and failed to land a blow; others preferred.

runners.name: Qaasid
runners.owner: Four Fools & A Fast Horse Syndicate
runners.comment: 91 rated Flat winner, yet to fire over hurdles, ground and trip worries, place chance
