runners.spotlight: 91 rated five-time Flat winner in the UK including twice on turf; hasn't translated that ability to this sphere and his fourth on latest at Fairyhouse was a remote one; best form is on a sound surface and unsure this longer trip will suit but still has place claims in this company.

stable_tour.quote: He is a Shadwell-bred gelding and although he's only got his head in front twice he has run consistently well and is a hard horse to criticise as he tries every time. He's in the same bracket as Dingle in that he will be a good all-weather horse this winter - all of his wins have been on the all-weather. He'll be ready to resume again in December and hopefully give us a lot of fun. 06-09-23

runners.name: Rilo Tang
runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten both starts, cheekpieces go on, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and has run accordingly in both starts to date; cheekpieces go on; difficult to fancy.

runners.name: Rowdy
runners.comment: 0-7 in points, mild promise in bumpers for Tom Lacey, best watched on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in point-to-points; mild promise in a couple of bumpers in the UK for Tom Lacey last year but is probably best watched on hurdles debut after falling at Dromahane earlier this month.

runners.name: Shelton Johnson
runners.comment: Fell and pulled up in two points over a year apart, watch on belated Rules' debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in two point-to-points over a year apart, pulling up at Ballindenisk and falling at Tallow on latest in February; best watched on belated Rules' debut.

runners.name: The Burrow
runners.comment: Point winner, struggled in a bumper and maiden hurdle, cheekpieces and tongue tie on
runners.spotlight: Won a Ballycrystal point-to-point for Gerard Lawless in January; suffered heavy defeats since in a bumper at Gowran and a maiden hurdle at Fairyhouse; tongue-tie and cheekpieces go on but he's hard to fancy.

runners.name: This Way Please
runners.comment: No show in two points, dam a French winner, lacks a recent run, best watched; tongue tied
runners.spotlight: No show in point-to-points at Turtulla and Ballingarry five months apart; tongue tied for hurdles debut; out of a French hurdle winner but lacks a recent run and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Millie B
runners.comment: 4-7 in points, no impact in two maiden hurdles, may be seen to better effect in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Prolific in point-to-points, winning four from seven; has struggled in two maiden hurdles though, beaten 110l on her latest start at Punchestown; may be seen to better effect in handicaps.

runners.name: Miss Penny Copper
runners.comment: Point winner, mild promise in two of three Rules' starts, place claims upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; showed mild promise in a bumper here in January and again when sixth of 16 when 7-1 on her hurdles debut at Clonmel, though was still beaten a long way; unlikely to be good enough to win but she has place claims stepped up in trip in this weak race.

1:50.race_name: Leisure Domes Ltd Marquee Hire Handicap Hurdle
1:50.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Inthenickoftime
runners.comment: Wexford winner off 6lb lower last August, off since October, would prefer better ground
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap hurdle at Wexford (2m1f, yielding) off 94 back in August; off since below par effort off revised mark over 2m4f at the same venue in October; would prefer a sounder surface and lacks a run.

runners.name: The Vegas Raider

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing CXIII And Partner

runners.comment: Ballinrobe winner off 6lb lower, fine run there after break latest, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort is 1-16 over hurdles, the win coming on yielding to soft ground off 94 at Ballinrobe (2m1f); fine run back there over 21.5f (good) on return from a break latest; up 3llb and different trip/ground here; not discounted.

runners.name: Mahlers Cove
runners.comment: 1-11 over hurdles, raised 3lb for 7l second latest, trip and ground ok, place claims
runners.spotlight: 1-11 over hurdles; has run well on soft ground in two of his last three starts; 3lb rise for 7l second on latest at Naas seems harsh; trip and ground fine though and he has place claims again.

quotes.race: Killinan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mahlers Cove loved the ground today and that was the key. He's disappointed me a bit, I thought he was going to be a better horse than he is. He had been cutting out in his races but we changed his training and it seems to have worked - Jimmy Mangan, trainer

runners.name: On The Tide
runners.comment: Off the mark in h'cap chase latest, rated 7lb lower over hurdles, soft ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Gained first win under Rules at the twentieth attempt in a Wexford handicap chase latest (19.5f, yielding); rated 7lb lower over hurdles but he needs better ground than he's likely to encounter here.

runners.name: Charlies Pride
runners.comment: Won at Kilbeggan in 2023, off since poor Clonmel run in May 2024, watch after layoff
runners.spotlight: Won at Kilbeggan in second handicap hurdle start off 88 in August 2023; ran well off revised mark a month later but only seen once since, in May 2024, and that was a poor effort at Clonmel; best watched after almost a year off.

runners.name: Southgate Avenue
runners.comment: 0-6, struggled in handicaps so far, down another 2lb but needs to show more
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; switch to handicaps hasn't changed his fortunes; his sixth last time at Clonmel was a remote one; down another 2lb but he needs to show more.

runners.name: A Nod To Getaway
runners.comment: Soft ground winner, generally consistent on easy ground, good effort latest, go well again
runners.spotlight: Won on soft ground at Wexford in May 2024 off 83; generally consistent when he's had soft ground and placed on heavy on his last two starts at Clonmel and Limerick; nudged up 3lb for a 5l second on latest but should be competitive again; chance.

runners.name: Queen Of Seduction
runners.comment: Flat winner, 0-8 over hurdles but ran well latest, handles testing ground, not out of this
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat turf winner remains a maiden after eight runs over timber; best effort yet a 2.25l second of 18 at Naas earlier this month (2m, good to yielding); claims if building on that and she has won on testing ground on the level; not out of this.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Queen Of Seduction was fit and I was told not to get beaten for stamina. She is a big filly and I would say she is only filling into herself. She could be one to keep improving - Ronan Whelan, jockey.

runners.name: Good Bye Milan
runners.comment: Won off 82 at Gowran in October (2m, good), off since November, soft ground a worry
runners.spotlight: Gained second career win off 82 at Gowran (2m, good) in October; left off after poor run at Limerick the following month, presumably to wait for summer ground, and she won't get that here.

runners.name: Hit The Frame
runners.comment: 0-5 over timber, tame efforts first two h'caps at 2m5f, down in trip, needs more time
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles; not much promise in maidens and now drops back in trip after a couple of tame efforts in handicaps at around 2m5f; dropped 2lb for last run but may need more experience.

runners.name: Highland Earl
runners.comment: No impact on h'cap debut at Naas latest, didn't show enough to make him of interest here
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in third maiden hurdle when sixth at Thurles (15.5f, good); failed to make an impact on handicap debut at Naas latest; down 2lb but didn't show enough to make him of interest here.

runners.name: Like A Bumblebee
runners.comment: 0-6, signs of life latest when falling three out, locally trained, check market
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; well beaten first five starts but was in the process of showing a little bit more on latest at Naas (2m, good to yielding) when falling three out; locally trained and worth a market check.

runners.name: Romella
runners.comment: Veteran, off since Thurles win in November, may need this, soft ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Veteran mare has won four times over hurdles, including on latest in November at Thurles (2m, good); up 5lb but has won off higher marks in the past; may need this run after five months off and soft ground is a concern.

runners.name: The Dooner Citizen
runners.comment: Ran well here over 2m4f on penultimate, ground fine, drops in trip, place claims
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles; best effort came here over 2m4f on penultimate on soft ground when beaten 1.75l off 85; not as good latest upped to 2m7f in a handicap chase at Tramore; drops markedly in trip and reverts to hurdles; place claims.

runners.name: Old Kenmare
runners.comment: Improved efforts in h'caps on good/good to yielding, chance if handling the softer ground
runners.spotlight: Has improved for switch to handicaps; remote third at Clonmel (18.5f, good) followed by a 2l second of 11 at the same venue four days ago over 2m1f (good to yielding); same mark here but different ground; chance if he handles it.

runners.name: Cramers Valley
runners.comment: 0-17, front runner, second last twice on good ground, handles soft, make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: 0-17 over hurdles but knocking on the door in recent starts; has finished second under front-running rides here (16.5f, good) and at Limerick (2m, good) on last two starts; has run well on soft; should make a bold bid again.

runners.name: King Of The Bronx
runners.owner: Lucky Seven Syndicate/Seven Plus One Syndicate
runners.comment: Flat winner on soft, best hurdles effort latest, will like the ground, can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Flat claimer winner (on soft) is 0-6 over hurdles; best effort yet in this sphere on latest at Fairyhouse (2m, good to yielding); still relatively early days in this sphere and he should appreciate the softer ground; in good hands and can't discount.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: I was hoping King Of The Bronx would be one for handicaps. The race fell apart in front of him to be fair to him. We were off the bridle going up the hill on the far side but he just stayed on past a few and he got a bit of confidence from that - Nigel Slevin, trainer

runners.name: Better Than Heaven
runners.comment: Won on good at Navan in 2021, off the track a long time, best watched on return
runners.spotlight: 1-6 over hurdles but that win came in June 2021 at Navan (2m4f, good); off since heavy defeat over C&D in November 2021; best watched after long absence.

runners.name: Opera Point
runners.comment: 0-9 over timber, best effort here on good ground but still beaten 15.5l, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Eleven-race maiden under Rules is 0-9 over hurdles; one of better efforts came over this C&D but was still beaten 15.5l and that was on good ground; hard to make a solid case for.

runners.name: Fernhill Fling
runners.comment: 0-11 over timber, hasn't built on Wexford third, yard has better shout with Cramers Valley
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles but has shown glimpses of ability, such as when a 6.25l third of 11 at Wexford (16.5f, soft) in October; hasn't built on that in three runs since and the yard has a better chance with Cramers Valley.

runners.name: Cullagh Pride
runners.comment: Promise in maidens but struggled in h'caps, pulled up last three starts, oppose; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; showed promise in a couple of maidens in 2023 but has struggled in handicaps, pulling up on her last three starts; passed over.

runners.name: No Big Deal
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden, has shown glimmers, tongue tie returns, check market; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; dual-purpose maiden has shown glimmers of potential in a couple of his handicap hurdles, including in a first-time tongue tie at Naas last April and it is back on today; attracted market support on latest but ran poorly; worth a market check if gets a run.

runners.name: Fourcardrun
runners.comment: Huge odds and no show in maidens, could improve for handicaps but best watched
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; huge odds and ran accordingly in three maiden hurdles at 2m-3m; could improve for switch to handicaps but may need the experience; probably best watched.

2:25.race_name: Coolmore N.H. Sires Luxembourg Handicap Chase
2:25.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Golden Joy
runners.comment: Won Leopardstown beginners' latest over 2m1f, obvious chance in first handicap chase
runners.spotlight: French hurdles winner off the mark at the second attempt in chases in a 2m1f Leopardstown beginners' on yielding last month, his main rival falling at the last; of obvious interest on handicap chase debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Golden Joy jumped very well, that will stand to him. Thurles the last day it may have happened a bit quick for him but still ran a nice race, coming here I thought I had a chance - Jordan Gainford, jockey, speaking to Racing TV  We'll probably go for a novice handicap chase, the 2m division is not always the strongest. I'd say the ground was a big key to Golden Joy here - Gordon Elliott. trainer, speaking to Racing TV

stable_tour.quote: He's an interesting horse. He's been a bit disappointing, but we was probably just a shade weak last season and shaped better than the bare result a few times. He's strengthened up a lot over the summer and I think you might see a different horse this season. 28-10-24

runners.name: Je Tai Porte
runners.comment: 2-10 over fences, last h'cap win off 15lb lower, big ask latest, may be on tough mark
runners.spotlight: 2-10 over fences, the last win coming last June in a Roscommon novice on good; won a handicap chase on yielding at Ballinrobe last May off 118; tough task on latest at Cheltenham; remains 15lb above last win so may need some respite from the handicapper.

quotes.race: KOG Logistics Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I've tried to sit Je T'ai Porte in a couple of times but she'd be fairly free and doing a bit too much the whole time, but she was grand in front here. I think the loose horse from the last helped her, she put in a good round of jumping and hopefully could win more - Shane Fitzgerald, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better Guaranteed Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Je T'ai Porte is not the most straightforward. I'm hoping when she steps up in class she might improve as she might be able to take a lead. She will stay going for the summer - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She had a great summer, winning twice over fences. We've given her a break and she'll be back for the spring. 12-11-24
She had a great summer, winning twice over fences. We've given her a break and she'll be back for the spring. 13-11-24

runners.name: Captains Nephew
runners.comment: 2-12 in chases, remains 8lb above last win, poor over hurdles latest, more needed
runners.spotlight: 2-12 in chases; last won at Fairyhouse just over a year ago off 122; has generally struggled off his revised mark since and handicapper has been slow to relent; well beaten off lower hurdles rating latest; needs more.

quotes.race: BoyleSports, Proud Sponsors Since 2014 Novice Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Captains Nephew just didn't see out his race at Thurles the last day, I'd say the track was too quick for him. His form up to then has been mighty and this is the race I'd had in mind for him for a fair while - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Derrygrath Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Captains Nephew put up a good performance. We were hopeful of a nice run. He's a big horse but I would say he might appreciate some nicer ground as well - Darragh O'Keeffe, trainer

runners.name: Gaelic Arc
runners.owner: Mark R D Fleming / T Westropp Bennett
runners.comment: Lost form since good run at Gowran, would prefer a sounder surface
runners.spotlight: 1-15 in chases; ran well at Gowran in November (2m, good) but badly out of sorts in three runs since, though faced a tough task at Cheltenham latest; would prefer better ground than this; eighth at Fairyhouse on Sunday.

quotes.race: Ballygowan Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaelic Arc is a funny horse, difficult to train, and a horse you wouldn't have a punt on. He's going to be a lovely horse over a fence. The ground today probably suited him and was the key today. Niall Prendergast gave him a cracking ride and he'll go over fences now - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Gaelic Arc is a gorgeous horse. He goes on soft ground so we'll probably go for a winners bumper - John Ryan, trainer

runners.name: Coming Up Easy
runners.comment: Raised 9lb for easy h'cap chase debut win, different ground here, has won on heavy, chance
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner took a big step forward when hacking up in his first novice handicap chase at Limerick (2m2f, good to yielding); up 9lb for that; trainer said afterwards he improved for the sounder surface so softer conditions are a worry, though his hurdles win came on heavy; considered.

stable_tour.quote: He relished the heavy ground when he won at Limerick last season. He then disappointed us at Punchestown but came back sore from there. I hope he's going to make a nice chaser; he's a real stamp of one. He'll go over two and a half miles and beyond. 18-11-24

runners.name: Kings Halo
runners.comment: Won here over 2m4f in January, no impact up in trip-class since, this may be too sharp
runners.spotlight: Gained third win over fences here in January off 118 over 2m4f (yielding to soft); no impact upped in trip and class the last twice at Punchestown (3m3f) and Naas (3m1f); big drop in trip here may not be ideal.

quotes.race: Clinton Higgins Chartered Accountants Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Kings Halo jumped and travelled, Danny got the fractions right. The drop back in trip made no difference. The ground and weigh suited him - James Dullea, trainer.

runners.name: My Gaffer
runners.comment: Won Clonmel beginners' on soft, behind Coming Up Easy latest, down 1lb, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the second attempt over fences in a Clonmel beginners' in February (20.5f, soft); struggled in a Limerick novice handicap (2m2f, good to yielding) on latest behind Coming Up Easy; down 1lb and may do better returned to this easier ground; not discounted.

quotes.race: Monksgrange Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: My Gaffer promised a lot. We ran in in some big handicap hurdles and he was too small, he got crowded out. He's a brilliant little jumper and I would say some of those summer Nationals around the likes of Ballinrobe will be the races for him. He's a nice little horse - John Ryan, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: He was gutsy and tenacious and even when the horse came to him My Gaffer kind of picked up a bit - Walter O'Connor, representing the owner.

runners.name: Jay Pee M
runners.comment: Course winner, 2-3 over fences, up 7lb for 2m1f Navan win latest, ground ok, more to come
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler has proved to be a much better chaser; 2-3 in this sphere, winning a beginners' here over 2m4f and a handicap chase at Navan over 2m1f, both on soft ground; up 7lb for that latest win and moves up in grade but there could yet be more to come.

runners.name: Mount Frisco
runners.comment: Out of form since return from six months off, ground fine but hard to fancy on recent runs
runners.spotlight: Tramore novice chase (15.5f, heavy) in January 2024 remains his only win in this sphere; out of form in three runs since return from a six month break; well-beaten off lower hurdles mark latest; hard to fancy on recent efforts, though he'll like the ground.

3:00.race_name: Rathbarry & Glenview Studs Mares Maiden Hunters Chase
3:00.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Defeat The Dark
runners.comment: 0-5 in points, improved efforts last twice on good-yielding, softer ground a concern
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in point-to-points but has run well in defeat; best efforts have come on good and yielding ground the last twice; not as good when encountering softer ground so conditions are a concern.

runners.name: Eyes Off Annie
runners.comment: 2-5 in points, both wins on testing ground, strip fitter for latest, claims
runners.spotlight: 2-5 in point-to-points, the wins coming on testing ground at Punchestown and Durrow (runner up won a handicap chase at Carlisle last month); should strip fitter for latest second at Oldcastle after a 379-day break; claims.

runners.name: Iorens
runners.comment: Winless since April 2022, chase rating of 88 for Dan Skelton, hard to fancy on recent form
runners.spotlight: 1-8 in point-to-points, that win coming on debut at Rathcannon in April 2022 for Sean Doyle; failed to win for Dan Skelton and ended up with a chase rating of 88; hard to fancy on recent point-to-point form for Turlough O'Connor.

stable_tour.quote: I probably should have run her in bumpers last season but now she gets to start in a maiden hurdle with loads of experience under her belt. Her point-to-point and first run over hurdles looked promising and if we get her back to that level of form she'll be a progressive horse. 21-11-23

runners.name: Justlikejessejames
runners.comment: Won her last two points, handles soft ground, in form and chance in first-time tongue tie
runners.spotlight: 2-10 in point-to-points, those wins coming on her last two starts at Nenagh (good to yielding) and Durrow (yielding) last month; handles soft and clearly in fine fettle at the moment; chance in first-time tongue tie.

runners.name: Lucky Venture
runners.comment: Off since Damma House win in November 2023, market should reveal plenty after absence
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt in point-to-points at Damma House when last seen in November 2023; has a long absence to overcome and the market should reveal expectations on return.

runners.name: Nicolas Fortune
runners.comment: 0-8 in points, decent run latest, may need better ground; tongue tie and cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: 0-8 in point-to-points and 0-6 under Rules in bumpers and hurdles; decent second on latest at Castletown-Geoghegan (3m, good) earlier this month; tongue-tie and cheekpieces go on; may need better ground.

runners.name: Pallas Athene
runners.comment: Without a win since March 2023, hasn't shown enough in recent point runs to fancy here
runners.spotlight: 1-5 in point-to-points, the win coming on debut at Lisronagh in March 2023; ran some decent races under Rules for Gordon Elliott without winning; hasn't shown enough in recent point-to-point starts to be of interest here.

stable_tour.quote: This mare won her point emphatically for Sam Curling at Lisronagh and she'll start off in a bumper in the next little while. 24-10-23

runners.name: Some Joy
runners.comment: 1-10 in points, 2l second at Ballynoe latest, fourth in this last year, place chance
runners.spotlight: 1-10 in point-to-points; won a three-runner race at Ballindenisk in January on soft to heavy; beaten 2l on latest in Mares Final at Ballynoe (3m, soft); fourth in this last year on soft ground and she has place claims.

runners.name: The Great Unknown

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan

runners.comment: 3-5 in points, runner up on latest when conceding weight, soft ground fine, leading chance
runners.spotlight: Prolific in point-to-points, winning three from five and three of her last four; was giving lots of weight to the winner when a 1.75l runner up on latest at Daramona House; soft ground fine and she is a leading contender.

3:35.race_name: John Thomas McNamara Series Maiden Hunters Chase
3:35.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Arkhill
runners.comment: Durrow winner last month on second start; yard won this last year so respected
runners.spotlight: Mount Nelson 6yo finished second on point-to-point debut at Punchestown in February before landing long odds in 4-finisher Durrow maiden following month (yielding); yard won this race last year so has to be respected.

runners.name: Ask Mike
runners.comment: Just fair form in three hunter-chases, will need to jump better than at Thurles last time
runners.spotlight: Came home alone when scoring at Borris House in December 2023; just fair form in three hunter-chases, will need to jump better than at Thurles last time when cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Bigbraveboy
runners.comment: Forced much of pace before dropping out when stiff task in Tetratema last month
runners.spotlight: One win from nine starts in points; forced much of pace before dropping out on rules debut when stiff task in Tetratema at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Chiefs Kingdom
runners.comment: Definite ability under rules last term; comeback second in point should have him straight
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners including Ballymoy (smart 2m-3m1f hurdler/chaser); dam bumper/2m4f hurdle winner; fairly useful form when placed in maiden hurdles last season and okay run in Wexford beginners chase; back from 283-day absence when second in Ballycahane maiden point-to-point last month for Aidan Fitzgerald; one to consider.

runners.name: Cold Old Fire
runners.comment: Dual points winner didn't recover from bad blunder at Tramore a week ago
runners.spotlight: Useful form in point-to-points this term, beating a subsequent winner at Dungarvan and came home alone at Knockanohill; never really recovered from bad blunder on rules debut in Tramore hunters chase a week ago.

runners.name: Drive On Jimmey
runners.comment: Ballindenisk winner went close at Nenagh last time; not one to rule out
runners.spotlight: Won at Ballindenisk in December (soft) and best effort latest when second (Midnight Moonshine third) at Nenagh last month on good-to-yielding; not one to rule out.

runners.name: Dromleigh
runners.comment: Recent Down Royal fourth in a stronger race augurs well
runners.spotlight: Went well under rules last season, narrowly losing out over 2m5f at Clonmel and third at Fairyhouse (3m); better again on track return last month when fourth in 2m4f Down Royal winners' contest on good ground; should be thereabouts back in maiden company.

runners.name: I Am Rocco
runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg

prev_owners.owner: Fintan J Quinn & Liam Breslin & Mrs Anne McMahon

runners.comment: Placed hurdler last season but plenty to find on recent point-to-point form
runners.spotlight: Placed in Ballinrobe staying handicap hurdles last summer on softish ground; 0-4 in point-to-points, seemingly plenty to find on recent efforts.

runners.name: I Masked Du Potier
runners.comment: Winner of three of last four starts for this rider; may not want too much rain
runners.spotlight: Progressive pointer the winner of three of last four starts for this rider, most recently last month at Nenagh and when ready winner of 3-finisher Ballycrystal open; may not want too much rain.

runners.name: Long Road
runners.comment: Got up late for second at Tramore a week ago; this looks a stronger race though
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in point-to-points but much better form on rules debut a week ago when strong-finishing second in 2m6f hunters chase (yielding); this likely a stronger race however.

runners.name: Made U Look
runners.comment: Recent Kildorrery win has worked out really well; local challenger could play a major role
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo came good at fourth attempt between the flags when taking Kildorrery maiden last month under a positive ride (second and third have won since); form looks solid and no surprise if local challenger played a major role here.

runners.name: Manlikemike
runners.comment: Closing when a faller at Loughbrickland recently; respected yard
runners.spotlight: Dual point-to-point winner including at Knockmullen House in November but disappointing since, latest when faller two out when closing at Loughbrickland last month; respected yard, considered.

runners.name: Midnight Moonshine
runners.comment: Hasn't progressed from Comea win; tongue-tied for rules debut
runners.spotlight: Upset a hot favourite at at Comea in February (yielding) and just behind Drive On Jimmey when third at Nenagh, below best at Lscarrol last time though; tongue-tie on for rules debut.

runners.name: Mohera Prince
runners.comment: Unseated on hunter chase debut at Thurles and carried out at Liscarroll latest
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 11 attempts between the flags came in Kildorrery adjacent maiden last month (soft); unseated on hunter chase debut at Thurles and carried out at Liscarroll latest; others preferred.

runners.name: Mount Rinjani
runners.comment: 0-13 in point-to-points, hard to see him playing a role on rules debut
runners.spotlight: 0-13 in point-to-points, hard to see him playing a role on rules debut with visor tried.

runners.name: Sampoet
runners.comment: Recent second at Rathcannon; hard to see him featuring on second start under rules
runners.spotlight: Dromahane maiden winner last season but well held until recent second at Rathcannon; hard to see him featuring on second start under rules.

runners.name: Tennessee Titan
runners.comment: Placed hurdler last season; pulled up on last month's comeback run at Liscarroll
runners.spotlight: Knockanard point-to-point winner in 2022 for Paul Nolan and placed hurdler last season for current yard; pulled up on last month's comeback run at Liscarroll, having never featured; hard to be confident in.

runners.name: West Of Carrig
runners.comment: Didn't count at Cheltenham but previous points' form gives him leading claims
runners.spotlight: Quite smart form when making all for open wins in February at Dungarvan and Tallow; unseated at the last, having trailed throughout, in Cheltenham Foxhunters last month; sights lowered considerably here and likely big player.

runners.name: Cebu City
runners.comment: Chased home clear winner in modest Castlelands maiden last month; stiff task here; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; lightly raced 6yo chased home a clear winner in modest Castlelands maiden last month; stiff task here.

4:10.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Bugs Moran
runners.comment: Readily beat King Alex on comeback at Dromahane 8 days ago; yard often targets this race
runners.spotlight: Ex Noel Meade-trained 8yo a 136-rated hurdler, winning valuable 3m Fairyhouse novice handicap at Easter 2022; returned from 533-day absence to run away (from King Alex) with Dromahane open point-to-point eight days ago and interesting contender from a yard which has won this three times in the last six years.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Novice Handicap Hurdle Series Final (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Bugs Moran jumped great for him, stayed well and he loves good ground. The trip was a big help to him and he's learning on the job. He's very light and spindly. He jumps well and he'll jump fences too on fast ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Early Doors

prev_owners.owner: J P Magnier & Mrs Magnier & Mrs Shanahan & Mrs O'Brien

runners.comment: Last year's third to Lifetime Ambition; poor Tetratema effort raises doubts
runners.spotlight: Career highlight when winning the Galway Plate in 2020; third to Lifetime Ambition in this race last year and kicked off this campaign with Oldcastle win before pulled up after never counting (lost shoe) in Tetratema at Gowran last month; bit to prove now.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: I got a good start and was tracking the leaders the whole way. He jumped brilliant for the first circuit but the second fence away from the stands on the second circuit he missed. I was tracking the lads going to the second last and we were proper motoring but he missed it and they got away from me a bit. It gave me something to aim at coming up the hill. He galloped all the way to the line. He won the Martin Pipe Hurdle in the past and always had the ability but has taken his time getting jumping and cheek-pieces were a big help to him and they really sharpened him up. He was well-in today and hopefully he can improve from that - Mark Walsh, rider

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Early Doors has been running in Graded company all year. He came back to handicaps today and Jonjo gave him a great ride, so we are very happy. Jonjo is a fantastic rider. A couple of weeks ago I was speaking to Frank Berry [the owner's racing manager] and he said we could get Jonjo for the Martin Pipe, so I said let's have a go at that then. - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Fishery Lane Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Early Doors learned a lot from Wexford and jumped a lot better today. I missed the second last a bit but when another horse came upsides him he put his head down and battled really well - Mark Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: Nick O'Donnell Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He had the best bumper form in the race and we would have been disappointed if he couldn't do it like that. His jumping could improve but you wouldn't mind that for his hurdles debut, it's all new to him. He seems a nice horse though. I took it up sooner than I wanted to because I didn't think we went that quick and from looking at his bumpers, all he does is gallop. He had the class to just outstay them - Mark Walsh, jockey

quotes.race: Family Saturday At The Festival Flat Race
quotes.quote: He has always shown a good bit at home but he's out of a Desert Prince mare and I was worried about the ground. He seemed to handle it wel,l though, and Paddy (Mullins) was very positive about him. He has never been off the bridle before and that was impressive - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Early Doors

stable_tour.quote: A bit like Darasso, he's so versatile and capable of running to around 150 over hurdles or fences. He can operate over a range of distances too. The long-term plan is to train him for the Irish Grand National. He ran a nice race when he was fifth to Lord Lariat last season. I've no particular short-term target but he'll probably run somewhere in November. There's no rush back since we're thinking ahead to Fairyhouse at Easter. 20-10-22

runners.name: Heroes Of Renown
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner here in the past but recent points' form doesn't look good enough
runners.spotlight: Won 3m maiden hurdle here in 2021 for James Motherway; without success since, however; recent point-to-point form doesn't look good enough here.

runners.name: King Alex
runners.breeder: Mme S Lardot,Mlle D Lardo,Mlle G Lardot,A Lardot
runners.comment: Readily beaten by Bugs Moran at Dromahane recently; hard to see him reversing the form
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins and a Limerick novice chase success for Barry Connell; point-to-point win came at Castlelands last month but has since been put in his place by Bugs Moran at Dromahane; hard to see him reversing that form.

quotes.race: Cargill Neomilk Calf Milk Replacer Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: King Alex won three on the bounce last year and he's a smart horse. He was brave here and ground it out. There is a valuable novice handicap chase at Naas before Cheltenham which we might go for - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Racing Industry Fundraiser For Children's Health Foundation Crumlin Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: King Alex is a bit spooky and in the straight the only thing he was concentrating on was the loose horse. Luckily he is a big strong horse because he never raised a leg at the second last. He has a good engine and we might look for something at Leopardstown over Christmas - Barry Connell, trainer

quotes.race: Navanracecourse.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We'll probably keep King Alex hurdling until the handicapper gets to him. We can go chasing then, he has a mark over fences - Barry Connell, trainer

runners.name: Lifetime Ambition
runners.comment: Last year's winner a good third at Aintree recently; the one to beat again
runners.spotlight: Classy operator for Jessica Harrington and took this race last year for current connections; continues in good form, wins at Belharbour (beating West Cork Wildway) and Belclare before good third in 2m5f Aintree Foxhunters early this month; looks the one to beat again.

quotes.race: Jack Tyner Memorial Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition is a lovely horse to have. He doesn't qualify for Aintree this year. He might go to Punchestown, if the griound is heavy we will wait for Killarney - Pat Doyle, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Hugh McMahon Memorial Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It was Lifetime Ambition's first start over three miles on the track and Robert (Power, jockey) said he wanted every bit of it. He'll have an entry in the the novice handicap chase over two miles and five furlongs at the Punchestown festival, as well as the Grade 1 novice chase over three miles and one (furlong). Robert said he's a proper Grand National horse in the making for Aintree next year and that he loves that nicer ground. We might campaign him differently next year; have him ready for the autumn, keep off the heavy ground and have him for a spring campaign. Today he was jumping like he did at Down Royal on his debut over fences - Kate Harrington, assistant to Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Ten To Follow Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition got his act together at the end of last season and when we schooled him over fences his jumping was different league. He could be exciting. He'll probably get an entry for the Drinmore - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Lifetime Ambition deserved that. It's a surprise that he hasn't won before now, he has run into a few good horses. When he jumps a fence you will see a much improved horse - Robbie Power, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I can't wait to go over fences with him - his schooling has been magic. He won his last two races over hurdles and wants a bit of nice ground, which is why I'm happy to get him out earlier. He was just no good on heavy ground last winter and then came alive in the spring, with his best run when bolting up at Punchestown. He's declared for Down Royal on Friday and we just hope there isn't too much rain for him. He'll be a two-and-a-half mile novice chaser and we hope he's Graded class. 29-10-21

runners.name: Lisleigh Lad
runners.comment: Fairyhouse winner earlier in season but fair bit to find on form since
runners.spotlight: Won 3m1f hunter chase at Fairyhouse in November (3m, good) but let down by jumping at Thurles and out of depth at Cheltenham latest; plenty to find.

quotes.race: INHSC Supporting Point-To-Points Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Lisleigh Lad wasn't right last year but was spot on for today. I don't think he'll go back pointing now and we'll stay inside the rails. He's a great jumper. I have two nice four-year-olds for point-to-points, but they're big and backward and won't be running until next year - Eleanor Broderick, trainer.

runners.name: West Cork Wildway
runners.comment: Veteran finished second to Lifetime Ambition at Belharbour; place claims at best
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler/chaser in his day; returned to point-to-points in December, notably chasing home ready winner Lifetime Ambition at Belharbour and second again at Kildorrery last time; place claims at best.

quotes.race: BetVictor Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: West Cork Wildway was very good today. He learned from his mistake at Killarney and he is a nice horse going forward. He'll give us a few more good days out hopefully - Paul O'Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Boomerang.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He hadn't run in a while but Paul (O'Flynn) thought he'd run well. He's not a bad horse. I thought that was a nice race. He can be a bit funny with his head at times. I think he might progress further chasing - rider Darragh O'Keeffe.

quotes.race: Season Finale INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a very nice horse with a good pedigree. Any horse who can win a four-year-old maiden first time out obviously has a fair level of ability and he won a winners' race too. After a break, he ran very well in a nice maiden hurdle at Listowel, beaten by two decent horses, and he was well entitled to do what he did today. I think the owners had an offer to sell him after his point-to-point but they're a big syndicate and I think they felt they'd rather have some fun with him. You'd look forward to him in a maiden hurdle after that, he's a very athletic jumper - Eoin O'Brien, rider of West Cork Wildway

runners.name: Carrig Wells
runners.comment: Won 3m maiden hunter-chase on this card last year; pulled up on recent comeback run
runners.spotlight: Won 3m maiden hunter-chase on this card last year but well held in light campaign since, latest after 323-day absence when pulled up behind Bugs Moran at Dromahane eight days ago.

4:45.race_name: Pegus Horse Feed Point-To-Point Flat Race
4:45.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Another Belter
runners.comment: Mild promise last year for Ross O'Sullivan but recent points' form modest; new yard
runners.spotlight: Mild promise last year for Ross O'Sullivan but recent point-to-point form modest; debuts for new yard.

runners.name: Clay Pigeons
runners.comment: Boulta winner fetched 62,000GBP; rider/trainer combination won this last year
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Theclockisticking (useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase), Delta Run (bumper/2m4f hurdle) and Flying Colum (point); dam unraced sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Synchronised; just held on in Boulta maiden point-to-point in December before realising 62,000GBP at Cheltenham Sales six days later; rider/trainer combination won this last year so demands respect.

runners.name: Cloneen To The Max
runners.comment: Placed three times from eight attempts between the flags; unlikely one here
runners.spotlight: Placed three times from eight attempts between the flags; unlikely one here.

runners.name: Cloudio
runners.comment: Dungarvan debut win has been franked since; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Cloudings half-brother to 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Roccovango; dam bumper winner, half-sister to bumper/2m hurdle winner Beyond The Obvious, from family of Champion Chaser Newmill; winning debut (beating a subsequent winner) in Dungarvan adjacent maiden in February (yielding-to-soft); one to consider.

runners.name: Deerpark Hill
runners.comment: Tallow win hasn't worked out but unexposed 5yo still respected
runners.spotlight: Ocovango 5yo returned much improved from 296-day absence to win Tallow adjacent maiden in February, although form has worked out; can't rule out.

runners.name: Frankies Freebie
runners.comment: Modest enough third on most recent point-to-point, doesn't appear an obvious candidate
runners.spotlight: Modest enough third on most recent point-to-point, doesn't appear an obvious candidate here.

runners.name: Generous Risk
runners.comment: Fetched 250,000GBP after winning at Belclare last month; top connections
runners.spotlight: No Risk At All gelding cost 100,000Euros as a 3yo; third foal; dam dual bumper winner, half-sister to winners Battlecry (smart bumper and 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase) and Value At Risk (useful bumper and 2m3f-2m4f hurdle/chase); ran away with three-finisher Belclare maiden last month and four days later fetched 250,000GBP at Cheltenham Sale; obvious interest.

runners.name: Hunt Away
runners.comment: Won last three point-to-points; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Sans Frontieres half-brother to five winners inc Clondaw Castle (bumper and smart 2m-3m hurdle/chase), Red Devil Boys (bumper/useful 2m3f hurdle), Queens Rock (2m/2m3f hurdle) and Kara Loca (2m1f chase/2m4f hurdle); dam bumper winner; completed hat-trick of point-to-point wins when scoring at Ballyvodock in February; handles heavy ground so rain no issue; likely contender.

runners.name: Johnny K
runners.comment: Easily beat a warm favourite at Loughbrickland; can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at fourth time of asking in Loughbrickland maiden last month (yielding-to-soft), easily beating a warm favourite; can't rule out.

runners.name: Loyal Praetorian
runners.comment: Debut winner of recent 2-finisher Bandon maiden; much more to do here
runners.spotlight: Soldier Of Fortune 5yo cost 13,000Euros as a foal; first foal; dam bumper/2m hurdle winner; winning debut when beating sole other finisher (and favourite) in Bandon adjacent maiden last month; much more on his plate here.

runners.name: Minella Emperor
runners.comment: Cheap buy since three uneventful point' runs; likely yard second-choice
runners.spotlight: Three uneventful runs in point-to-points before fetching just 3,500GBP in December; respected yard but looks decidedly the second-choice.

runners.name: Mister Loolah
runners.comment: Second to Loyal Prateorian at Bandon last month, only two finishers; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward on second point-to-point start when second to Loyal Praetorian at Bandon last month, only two finishers; others preferred.

runners.name: Phoenix Arizona
runners.comment: Now 0-6 in point-to-points, very unlikely one to make an impact here
runners.spotlight: Now 0-6 in point-to-points, very unlikely one to make an impact here.

runners.name: Tokens Glory
runners.comment: 0-14 in point-to-points for former yard; first start for new yard
runners.spotlight: 0-14 in point-to-points for former yard; first start for new yard.

runners.name: Wings Of A Swallow
runners.comment: Ballynoe winner worth considering, especially if market support arrives
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to useful bumper/2m5f hurdle winner Ask For Glory; dam well held in bumpers, half-sister to useful 2m4f-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Montroe and 2m3f/2m5f hurdler Meriel's Mistake; won Ballynoe adjacent maiden last month (soft) his second start; respected yard, worth considering if market support arrives.

runners.name: Kilbuny Supersonic
runners.comment: Off the mark in Lingstown maiden last month (yielding); others appear more likely
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to bumper/2m4f hurdle winner Kilbunny Pontic; well beaten in valuable Limerick bumper a year ago, off the mark between the flags on latest in Lingstown maiden last month (yielding); others appear more likely.

5:20.race_name: Cork & Waterford Mares Point-To-Point Flat Race
5:20.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING, Yielding to soft in places; Hurdle course - SOFT, Yielding to soft in places

runners.name: Carry On Heidi
runners.comment: Won Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe last month (soft); one to consider
runners.spotlight: Idaho mare was scoring for the second time between the flags when landing Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe last month (soft); one to consider.

runners.name: Changeyourstars
runners.owner: Mrs C T Ryan & Philip Brady Partnership
runners.comment: Stoutly-bred mare won Tallow maiden in February; considered
runners.spotlight: Shirocco half-sister to winners Beauport (smart 2m4f-4m2f hurdle/chase inc Midlands National) and Divine Inspiration (point/2m5f chase); unraced dam closely related to useful 2m4f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Oscar Barton; won 3-finisher Tallow mares maiden in February (yielding), second had previously finished second to Carry On Heidi at Ballindenisk; bred to stay.

runners.name: Clear Captions
runners.comment: Third to Miss Doyenne at Cragmore in January when last seen; 12l to find on that run
runners.spotlight: Jet Away mare finished third to Miss Doyenne at Cragmore in January when last seen; 12l to find on that run.

runners.name: Crohan Lady
runners.comment: Well behind Carry On Heidi in Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe latest
runners.spotlight: Ballycrystal winner in December (good-to-yielding) but twice beaten since, latest when well behind Carry On Heidi in Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe.

runners.name: Dora Dor
runners.comment: Unbeaten in two point-to-points; likely major player
runners.spotlight: Golden Lariat half-sister to winners Prospect House (2m2f hurdle) and Highway Companion (2m4f hurdle); dam French 2m1f hurdle winner, half-sister to Triumph Hurdle winner Snow Drop; 2-2 in point-to-points, backing up Dromahane win last month by taking Oldcastle winners' contest a fortnight later; likely major player.

runners.name: Lakewood Rose
runners.comment: Pulled up after being made plenty of use of in Gain Mares Final won by Carry On Heidi
runners.spotlight: Knockanohill adjacent maiden winner last month but pulled up after being made plenty of use of in Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe won by Carry On Heidi.

runners.name: Lily Milan
runners.comment: Dead-heated in Dungarvan mares maiden in February (yielding-to-soft); worth a look
runners.spotlight: Milan half-sister to winners Kilbarry Chloe (2m/2m6f hurdle), Kilbarry Calling (2m2f chase), Kilbarry Cushty (2m hurdle) and Redstone (2m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to high-class 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Racing Demon; debut runner-up at Dromahane before dead-heating in Dungarvan mares maiden in February (yielding-to-soft); worth a look.

runners.name: Living My Life
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in fourth on latest point-to-point at Rathcannon; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in fourth on latest point-to-point at Rathcannon; hard to fancy on that evidence.

runners.name: Miss Doyenne
runners.comment: Cragmore winner has since joined Henry de Bromhead; respected
runners.spotlight: Doyen mare cost 10,000Euros as a foal; closely related to bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Miss Eyecatcher, half-sister to point winner Mr Dinosaur; dam unraced half-sister to smart bumper and 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Battlecry; nicely improved on second start to win Cragmore mares' maiden (second won next time, Clear Captions third) for R McGrath in January; since joined top yard which has won two of last three runnings of this race.

runners.name: Mystic Malina
runners.comment: Winning debut last month in Kildorrery mares maiden; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Nothing of note on breeding but made winning debut last month in Kildorrery mares maiden; more needed.

runners.name: Nolans Rocco
runners.comment: Best effort latest when third (beaten 5l) to Carry On Heidi in Gain Mares Final
runners.spotlight: Placed form in point-to-points, best effort latest when third (beaten 5l) behind Carry On Heidi in Gain Mares Final at Ballynoe.

runners.name: Simply Natural
runners.comment: Oldtown mares winner has since joined top team and entitled to plenty of respect
runners.spotlight: Cost 5,500gns as a foal and 5,500Euros as a 3yo; half-sister to three winners inc Mongibello (bumper/2m4f hurdle) and Lady Sunrise (French 6f 2yo); dam French 1m1f/10.5f winner, half-sister to French 2m5f Grade 3 hurdle winner Unidentified Thief; successful debut for Pat Turley in Oldtown mares maiden in February (yielding); since joined top team and entitled to plenty of respect.

runners.name: Torpille Dagrostis
runners.comment: Point' second joined top team for 62,000GBP; obvious appeal
runners.spotlight: Sister to bumper/hurdle/chase winner Itchy Feet, half-sister to two French chase winners; second in a point at Loughanmore for Ger Quinn last October before fetching 62,000GBP at Cheltenham; missed engagement in Fairyhouse Listed bumper early this month due to quicker ground so has to be respected here in a likely weaker race on softer ground.
